name: 1. Lingaraja Temple
info: Lingaraja Temple is a glorious temple located in Bhubaneswar and is one of the most significant attractions and landmarks. This eleventh-century temple is a constructive marvel in the city of Bhubaneswar. A popular place to visit in Bhubaneshwar, this historical temple is moreover a valuable exploration in this portion of the nation. The entire design, stone groove, and interiors are very attractive. The surroundings of the temple are very polished, orderly, and calm. A trip to Bhubaneshwar is imperfect without visiting this charming Lingaraja temple.

name: 2. Udayagiri and Khandagiri caves
info: Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves are wonderful attractions in the Khandagiri region of Bhubaneswar. The caves are also widely known as Karnataka Caves. These fascinating caves are a mixture of magical natural and ancient manufactured caves - making them an amazing place to visit. It may take at least 2 to 3 hours to see these caves on a small hill. Several monkeys can also be seen around the caves. Indeed, the places to visit in Bhubaneshwar are amazing.

name: 3. Rajarani Temple
info: This 11th-century temple is a wonderful specimen of architecture. Located in the ancient city of Bhubaneswar, this magnificent memorial is a must-visit place. The environment is very calm and serene. There is a very properly maintained garden around the temple. This ancient memorial does not have to be worshipped inside the temple premises. You can admire the luster of rock and the wonderful painting in and out of the temple.

name: 4. Mukteshwar Temple
info: This old temple of Bhubaneswar was established in the tenth century. This wonderful part of design and purity is dedicated to Lord Shiva. The wonderful temple has an unbelievably graceful atmosphere. The temple complex has an attractive fishpond and a delightful garden for relaxing and taking a stroll. This religious temple is a must-visit place in Bhubaneswar.

name: 5. The Odisha State Museum
info: Odisha has an extremely prosperous species and heredity and is a wonderful spot to review the amazing cultures of this lovely state. A beautiful area to learn about culture, art, language, architecture, and religions has developed in the interesting state of Odisha. It is a big museum with many floors and many volumes, and if you want to visit it thoroughly, it can take 4-5 hours. The gathering of artifacts and exhibitions in this museum is astounding. Here you can find ancient manuscripts, tools, weapons and scientific instruments, and much more to learn about ancient history. This will surely captivate you, and if you are interested in knowing about this beautiful state and Bhubaneswar city, then this is one of the best places to visit in Bhubaneswar.

name: 6. Botanical Garden Bhubaneswar
info: This is an excellent landscape park conserved by the government. The best part of this botanical garden is the appearance of many exotic birds around the park. If you are a bird lover, then try to come here in the early morning, and you will be mesmerized by the lovely voices of the birds here. The garden is filled with exquisite flora, assorted roses, and cactus. It is the biggest garden - spread over 2 acres and full of enchanting natural beauty. The place is extremely peaceful.

name: 7. Dhauli Shanti Stupa
info: Situated on the Dhauli hills, this is a beautiful and inspiring Buddhist monument. The sculpture was assembled in a very restful climate in the 1970s. This Buddhist religious temple is constructed of white marble and looks amazingly pretty. The visit to this monument filled with ethereal views is incredibly gratifying. The view of the city of Bhubaneswar from this monument built on the top of the hill is quite mesmerizing. It is a beautiful place away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

name: 8. Deras Dam
info: It is a great dam with many picnic opportunities in its vicinity. From the city center, the dam is around 15 km away. The entire area around the dam is forested. It is a wonderful picnic spot with 4 sides covered by an enchanting natural environment and magical scenery. One can dip in the reservoir or sit with one's feet in the water during summers. There is also a small cafeteria to enjoy hot tea with a hot breakfast. This area is closed till 4.30 pm. This place will relax and rejuvenate your soul with its lush green natural setting and the soothing sounds of flowing water.

name: 9. Chandaka Reserve Forest
info: It is an adorable forest resource around Bhubaneswar. This area is full of overgrown leafy woodland and high barriers. Nature is plentiful in this jungle region. The forest area is spread over 175 sq km; the forest is covered by hilly hills of the Cuttack and Khurda areas. This forest is famous for being an essential elephant reserve. One can also get jeep safaris in the wilderness and analyze the glamorous elephant life in this area.

name: 10. Iskcon Temple Bhubaneswar
info: ISKCON Temple is one of the most beautiful temples in Bhubaneswar and one of the most religious places. The ISKCON temple was constructed in 1991. It is also a possibility to the God Jagannath Temple located in Puri. It is believed that this temple provided an abode to Lord Jagannath.

name: 11. Hirakud Dam Orissa
info: Hirakud Dam has been designed at the Mahanadi in Sambalpur, Odisha, and is the lengthiest artificial Dam in our country. The Dam is spread over 56 km and is one of the best places to visit in Bhubaneswar. The Dam was constructed in the year 1956. It is an incredible place to see the essence in all its jewels. A drive-thru road takes you 21 km above the Dam and gives you breathtaking views. It is also an outstanding location for people who are interested in seeing and enjoying birds.

name: 12. Regional science center
info: It is a remarkable science center and is different in numerous ways. The Science Center has multiple appliances and engines that show how unusual things function. The center also has a 3D theater where 3D snapshots are narrated to daily life science. It is a popular place among science enthusiasts and children. An interesting planetarium field displays various planets, stars, and constellations. There is also a lovely park with fascinating ducklings peeping and splashing there. This place is visited by hundreds of tourists every day.

name: 13. Baitala Deula Bhubaneswar
info: It is built with different techniques, Baitala Deula is noted for its dramatic pattern and captivates many visitors. It was Established in the 8th century. A grand Hindu temple located in the capital city of Odisha, Baitala Deula, is assumed as a favorable place in Bhubaneswar for all past fanatics. The main divinity respected in this temple is Devi Chamunda, and the shikhara of this temple illustrates the three strengths of Goddess Chamunda, Mahalakshmi Mahasaraswati, and Mahakali.

name: 14. Anath Vasudev Temple
info: The Ananta Vasudeva Temple is a very renowned and one must-visit place in Bhubaneswar for all the people who want to get acquainted with the myths and civilization of the city. Many tourists visit here to see the extraordinary architecture of this ancient temple. This temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna, and many ceremonies and observances are conducted here throughout the whole year. The temple was assembled in the 13th century. As soon as you arrive, you can see the icons of Lord Krishna and other gods.

name: 15. Biju Patnaik Park
info: Places to visit in Bhubaneswar amidst nature. The grassland is occupied by vegetation and good treatment of spices. It is an old park with an open gym area and play areas for children. There is also a room for breakfast, snacks, and food. The park is locally prominent as a wilderness park and is visited by travelers for casual walks. Throughout the day, the garden is very peaceful and an excellent spot for relieving stress and getting some time off to improve your health.

name: 16. Nandankanan Zoological Park
info: Nandankanan Zoological Park is one of a kind zoo that is placed in a woodland. Nandankanan Zoological Park was organized in 1960 to secure that birds and flowers thrive in their real environment. This zoo is the main breed and white shining tigers in the nation. It is a very popular tourist spot in Bhubaneswar.

name: 17. The Tikarpada Wildlife Sanctuary
info: Tikarpada Wildlife Sanctuary is one of the visitor spots in Bhubaneswar recognized for its eye-catching glamour and lush fresh surroundings. The sanctuary is scattered over 795.52 kilometers and has an enormous variety of creatures, birds, and flowers. This sanctuary is the birthplace of tiger, leopard, gaur, cymbals, sloths, etc. Within the Tikarpada Wildlife Sanctuary and one more sanctuary is trustworthy for feeding and taking care. It is one of the best wildlife sanctuaries in Odisha.

name: 18. Brahmeswara temple
info: The Brahmeswara Temple is a beautiful temple which is one more primary instance of the gloriousness of the Oriya type of design. It is encircled by 4 identical temples. It was built in the 11th century. The central pillar of the temple is devoted to the Shiva Lingam, and you can also see the idols of Lord Shiva. The convent is one of the most remarkable visitor places in Bhubaneswar, popular for its wonderful architecture.

name: 19. Ramchandi Beach
info: Ramchandi Beach, located 65 km from Bhubaneswar, is counted among the most beautiful beaches in India, which is situated at the confluence of the Bay of Bengal and the deep river Kushabhadra. An ideal destination for thousands of tourists every year for picnics and excursions, this place is also considered one of the favorite places for couples. Many tourists visit this beach to experience the beautiful sunrise and sunset. There is a magnificent view to be seen. Here you can swim in the sea, walk on the sandy beach, or enjoy other activities. And you can also enjoy the picturesque plains of the beach.

name: 20. Museum of Tribal Arts & Artifacts
info: This Museum of Tribal Art and Artifacts is near the Bhubaneswar Railway Station. This museum is popular as one of the best tribal museums in the country. Established in 1953, the institution comes under the Scheduled Castes and Tribes Research Training Institute, which works to develop and promote tribal culture. Tourists can roam the 5 different halls of the museum dedicated to the exhibits of the local tribes, their culture, and lifestyle. There is an exhibition of clothes, jewelry, musical instruments, weapons, household items, art, photographs, etc.

name: 1. Ganga River
info: The Ganges River, which was named after the Hindu goddess Ganga, is one of India's most cherished natural wonders and is one of the world's longest rivers. The river flows southeast from the Himalayas in the north to the Bay of Bengal, where it empties into the Indian Ocean. Around 600 million people depend on the Ganges River for their daily needs of bathing and drinking water respectively. Hindus go from all over the globe to Varanasi to cleanse themselves in the sacred Ganges water and to conduct rituals along the hundreds of ghats (washing stations) that line the river. When it comes to visitors, the river serves as a fixed point of direction for traveling about the city, and you'll spend a significant amount of time touring and taking in the views of life along the Ganges River.

name: 2. Dasaswamedh Ghat
info: The Dasaswamedh Ghat is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Varanasi because of its vibrant environment. In this bustling tourist attraction, you may find flower merchants boasting vibrant flowers, boat operators peddling tours along the Ganges River, and sadhus (holy men) decked up in colorful face paint. During the day, you may spend hours just walking about and people-watching.

name: 3. Assi Ghat
info: In terms of popular tourist destinations in Varanasi, the city's southernmost principal ghat is always near the top of the list. The main feature in Assi Ghat is a Shiva lingam (phallic symbol of the Hindu god), which is located under a holy fig tree. It attracts hundreds of pilgrims every day who come to worship Lord Shiva after bathing in the Ganges River.

name: 4. Manikarnika Ghat
info: At Manikarnika Ghat, plumes of smoke rise to the sky in a swirling motion. Rather than coming from a factory, it is derived from the constant cremations that take place on this ghat. Hindus believe that Manikarnika Ghat is one of the most auspicious sites for the souls of the deceased to attain moksha (liberation from suffering) (emancipation from the cycle of spiritual rebirth). Hundreds of cremations take place every day at this ghat, which is open around the clock. The funeral pyre burns around the clock.

name: 5. Dhamek Stupa
info: While Hinduism undoubtedly has a grip on Varanasi, Buddhism has a significant presence in the nearby town of Sarnath, which is less than 12 kilometers away. A large stone and brick building measuring 43.6 meters in height and 28 meters in circumference, you'll discover the Dhamek Stupa near the temple complex. The stupa was constructed more than 1,500 years ago as a replacement for a building that had been in existence since 249 BCE, according to legend. The faithful believe that the Buddha visited Dhamek Stupa after attaining enlightenment in order to deliver his first speech, which revealed the Eightfold Path, to the people. As you go around the stupa, have a look at the intricate carvings of birds, people, and flowers that decorate the walls of the structure.

name: 6. Shri Kashi Vishwanath Temple
info: A holy destination near the Manikarnika Ghat in Varanasi, the Shri Kashi Vishwanath Temple attracts Hindu pilgrims and visitors who travel hundreds of miles to visit it. The Shri Kashi Vishwanath Temple is around four kilometers from the Varanasi Junction railway station. The spectacular monument, which is devoted to the Hindu god Shiva, has gained the moniker "The Golden Temple" because of its stunning spire, which is plated in about 800 kg of pure gold and is the tallest structure in the world. Because of its remarkable style, this temple has served as an inspiration for the construction of hundreds of other temples across India.

name: 7. Banaras Hindu University
info: Since its founding in 1916, Banaras Hindu University has played an important role in the development of Varanasi's identity. A total of more than 25,000 students attend the well-regarded public institution, making it one of Asia's biggest residential universities. There are no hill stations in the vicinity of Varanasi, so if you're searching for a place to get away from the throng and the hustle and bustle of the city, come to this lovely 1,300-acre campus instead. The tranquil location is covered by hundreds of towering trees and provides a welcome respite from the bustling environment of the Banaras Ghats, which can be found nearby.

name: 8. Ruchika Art Gallery
info: Do you want to carry a bit of Varanasi with you when you go home? Looking for something unique to do? Visit the Ruchika Art Gallery, which is located just off Ravindrapuri Road. Ruchika Mehrotra, the gallery's owner, has created a warm, delightful shop in which to display a vibrant collection of paintings that capture the energy of Varanasi and the ghats in a rainbow of colors. Ruchika Mehrotra's gallery is located in the heart of Varanasi, on the banks of the Ganges.

name: 9. Shri Durga Temple
info: Varanasi is home to a variety of spiritual activities that are not limited to the ghats. The Shri Durga Temple, located about a five-minute walk west of Assi Ghat, is a popular destination for Hindus who seek to pay homage to the goddess Durga. The 300-year-old temple is easily identifiable since it is painted brilliant crimson from top to bottom.

name: 10. Ramnagar Fort
info: Varanasi is one of the few Indian cities that does not have a fort, and it is no exception. Ramnagar Fort is located around 14 kilometers outside of the city core. Originally built as a defensive structure, the 18th-century sandstone fort and palace is now home to a quirky museum filled with vintage automobiles, elaborate hookahs, antique firearms, sedan chairs decked out in jewels, and a unique astronomical clock that has been in operation for more than 150 years.

name: 11. Darbhanga Ghat
info: Photographers should be aware that Darbhanga Ghat provides the ideal chance to capture breathtaking images of Varanasi. The ultra-luxurious BrijRama Palace, a historic fort that has been turned into a heritage hotel, stands at the top of the steps going down to the riverfront. The Greek pillars and curving balconies of the home provide a royal air to the surrounding region (and to your images).

name: 12. Shivala Ghat
info: If you're looking for some peace and quiet along the Ganges, Shivala Ghat is a good location to stop by. It's not as busy as other riverside places in Varanasi, but it's still worth a visit. The absence of people at the ghat makes it easy to politely witness the faithful taking their customary baths in the holy river and the families gathered for prayers and tea in the early morning hours of the day. Do not be shocked if you end up sharing the space with water buffalo, who are known to congregate in the vicinity. In addition, you may view a palace that was erected by Nepalese monarch Sanjay Vikram Shah in the nineteenth century.

name: 13. Sankat Mochan Hanuman Temple
info: The Sankat Mochan Hanuman Temple, which is located on the banks of the Assi River, attracts hundreds of people each day who come to present sweets and flowers to the Hindu deity Hanuman, who is worshipped at the temple. According to legend, this temple was built on the site where Hindu saint and poet Goswami Tulsidas had a vision of the monkey deity, which inspired him to build it. When it comes to monkeys, keep an eye out for the mischievous critters that have been sighted jumping about the temple on several occasions.

name: 14. St Mary's Church
info: St. Mary's Church is next to JHV Mall, Cantt. The locality is 200 years old Christian religious attraction. The church was founded by Rev George Weatly in 1810. This particular church holds a beautiful and classic heritage, thanks to which it is also called as 'Church of England'. Queen Elizabeth II inspected this cathedral in 1960. Presently the church is no longer used to offer prayers. INTACH, or Indian National Trust for Art and Cultural Heritage, has assumed the obligation to rehabilitate this heritage place and maintain it.

name: 15. Bharat Kala Bhavan Museum
info: When the Bharatiya Lalit Kala Parishad was established in a wing of the Godowlia Palace in Varanasi on 1st January 1920, it was the beginning of the realization of the plan for Bharat Kala Bhavan. After being relocated to numerous different places across Varanasi between 1920 and 1962, the museum's collection was finally established in the current structure in 1950 by Jawaharlal Nehru. The museum was subsequently relocated to its current location at the Banaras Hindu University in 1962. Mahatma Gandhi visited Bharat Kala Bhavan three times, and on his third visit, he wrote on the wall of the building, "the collection is extremely nice."

name: 1. Kolkata
info: Kolkata, India's second-largest metropolis, is often known as the "Face of West Bengal." It is an always continuing celebration of the existence of human beings. The capital of West Bengal, this vibrant 350-year-old metropolis on India's Eastern Coast is the state's largest city. It thrives as India's artistic, social, intellectual, economic, and financial capital. Kolkata, often known as the 'City of Joy,' is a bustling metropolis. People visiting India should be delighted by the low cost of goods, hand-pulled rickshaws, roaming avenues, and various delicacies available. This gorgeous city's features include the Victoria Memorial, Howrah Bridge, Fort William, Eden Gardens, Jorasanko Thakur Bari, the ancestral house of Nobel Laureate Rabindranath Tagore, and several more attractions. Include this city in your travel itinerary because it is brimming with exciting things to do!

name: 2. Darjeeling
info: In the city of Darjeeling, visitors may see the spectacular snow pinnacles of Kanchenjunga, as well as the beautiful tea plantations, the fragrant orchids, the lush greenery of the pine trees, and the cute Himalayan toy train that winds its way through the brilliant mountains. This hill station is famed for combining old-world beauty with contemporary conveniences like a hidden treasure. This city is one of the most incredible tourist destinations in West Bengal for those looking for a much-needed respite from India's sweltering and humid summers. There's a potent combination of breathtaking mountain vistas, waterfalls, sightseeing excursions, Buddhist temples, museums, shopping, and delectable Tibetan cuisine to be found here. With its lush green surroundings and mesmerizing hills, this location is unquestionably one of the most incredible spots to visit in West Bengal in June.

name: 3. Sundarban
info: This UNESCO World Heritage Site has the world's largest mangrove ecosystem, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. In this area, several streams and tributaries are brought together by tidal conduits and a labyrinth of small mangrove islands to form the most extensive estuary woodlands. It is also home to the Royal Bengal Tiger, one of India's most infamous wild animals. Because of their interconnection, the Sundarbans are one of the most attractive places. There are 250 tigers on this magnificent territory and a variety of birds, reptiles, and numerous invertebrates, including crocodiles, that call it home for the time being. This natural paradise is around 110 kilometers from Kolkata.

name: 4. Mandarmani
info: Mandarmani, a seashore hamlet in the East Medinipur region, is located at the northern edge of the Bay of Bengal, near the border with Bangladesh. It is one of the largest and fastest-growing resort villages in West Bengal, and it is situated around 180 kilometers from the city of Kolkata. In India, it is often considered the country's longest drive-in seaside. At this magnificent coastline, visitors may relax, swim, and take pleasure in every second of their stay. They may use green coconut water as soon as they become fatigued to relieve the effects of exertion. There are relatively few people around, which is one of the most appealing aspects of this beach. One may spend their time sunbathing and taking in the sights and sounds of the birds and sea.

name: 5. Kalimpong
info: This melting pot of civilizations, including those of the Indians, the British, the Nepalese, and the Tibetans, is located three hours outside Darjeeling. It is a well-known tourist destination because of its floral gardens, Buddhist monasteries, medieval cathedrals, and holy temples, among other attractions. This hill station, located at an elevation of 4100 feet above sea level, provides panoramic views of the Himalayan range. Make sure you partake in the many activities available in this area, including the beautiful hill treks, bird viewing, and shopping at the Kalimpong Market Square, all highly recommended.

name: 6. Siliguri
info: It is known as the "Gateway to the North East" because of its location in Jalpaiguri, a charming city that sits in the state of West Bengal. Siliguri, one of the most attractive tourist destinations in West Bengal, is home to an international airport and is often used as a stopover point before travelers go on to other towns in the state. Siliguri, on the other hand, has a lot more to offer. This city is surrounded by many natural wonders, including lush green trees and breathtaking national parks, making it one of the most refreshing places. Located near Siliguri, the Jaldapara National Park is a must-see destination since it has a lovely riverine forest and vast meadows.

name: 7. Kurseong
info: Located only a few kilometers outside of Darjeeling, Kurseong is one of West Bengal's most spectacular tourist destinations, and it is a must-see for anybody visiting the region. Kurseong, popularly known as the 'Land of White Orchids,' is a town in South Korea home to breathtaking waterfalls, religious temples, and the most beautiful Buddhist gompas in the country. It is a calm, little hill station with nice warm weather practically the whole year; this is a great place to relax. The monsoons transform this town into something breathtaking, with all of the vegetation and greenery seeming more vibrant and vibrant than ever. Kurseong is home to an abundance of white orchids, which may be spotted blooming boldly on the slopes of the hillsides around the town. The tea plantations, snow-capped mountain peaks, and cooling rainforests transform this area into a nature lover's heaven.

name: 8. Durgapur
info: Durgapur, also known as the 'Steel Capital of East India,' is a tourist attraction in West Bengal located on the banks of the Damodar River and is famed for its steel industry. Durgapur is one of the most beautiful West Bengal tourist destinations, as it combines the best of small-town charm with the excitement of a big metropolis. It is not to be missed if you are visiting the state. In this town, you will find ancient traditional marketplaces, glistening temples, and expansive parks where your children may spend their free time in this state. This town, located in the heart of West Bengal, has a lot more to offer than you may expect. When visiting Durgapur, sample some of the local street cuisines.

name: 9. Dooars
info: For those seeking a holiday packed with lounging and relaxing, Dooars is one of the top spots to visit in West Bengal to consider spending time. It is one of the most popular tourist locations in West Bengal, and it is recognized for its tremendous range of mountains, lush forests, diverse flora and fauna, and tea gardens, among other things. These floodplains begin at the mouth of the Teesta River and extend to the Sankoshi River. It is believed that the term 'Dooars' derives from the word "doors" since these floodplains serve as the "front doors" leading into Bhutan.

name: 10. Navadvipa
info: Located on the banks of the Ganges, a cluster of nine islands known as the Nabadwip Mayapur islands may be found among the tumult and splendor of West Bengal. This location is considered one of the most sacred religious sites in West Bengal. Navadvipa is renowned as "God's Land" since it is home to around 200 temples distributed across the rural environment of this location. It is also known as the Land of Lord Chaitanya (Lord Krishna's rebirth); it is a sacred site for Hindus. Dispersed woodlands, winding roads, and stunning orchids give an unrivaled sense of tranquillity that cannot be replaced. This area, untouched by commerce and urbanization, will charm its way into your hearts and minds.

name: 11. Raichak
info: Raichak is a riverfront town situated 50 kilometers from the capital of Kolkata in West Bengal. The city is unknown, and it is a breath of fresh air after a long time. With small urban or commercial development and has remained unaffected by the passage of time, the town is considered one of the most attractive destinations in West Bengal. An abundance of forts can be seen around the city, adding to the old-world beauty of this location. While the river Hooghly runs through the town, it creates a picturesque scene worth seeing.

name: 12. Jaldapara National Park
info: Jaldapara National Park, located in West Bengal, is a haven for various animal species. The park, which encompasses lush landscapes, is home to a diverse range of wildlife. There is a vehicle safari available for those who want to go on an adventure. Nature enthusiasts will be able to observe a variety of exotic creatures such as the one-horned Rhinoceros, Asian elephants, bison, and other species.

name: 13. Buxa Tiger Reserve
info: Rajabhatkhawa is a tiny town in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal, and it is the county seat of Alipurduar. In addition to being bordered by dense woods, the area is ornamented by expansive, beautiful terrains. The village, located near the world-renowned Buxa Tiger Reserve, is a tranquil haven amid nature. The location is ideal for wildlife enthusiasts since it has an Animal Rescue Center where visitors can get up and personal with animals.

name: 14. Bagdogra
info: Bagdogra is one of the most beautiful tourist destinations in West Bengal, thanks to its lush tea plantations, panoramic vistas of the Himalayas, and beautiful woods. Bagdogra International Airport is located in the city, which offers an excellent connection to the rest of the country and the state. This region, which boasts pristine landscapes and breathtaking natural vistas, must be visited if you want to experience the true spirit of West Bengal.

name: 15. Shantiniketan
info: Shantiniketan is a town in the Birbhum region of West Bengal, approximately 212 kilometers from the capital city of Kolkata. It was made famous by Nobel Laureate Rabindranath Tagore, who lived there for a time during his lifetime. The location, which is now home to a university, attracts many tourists each year. Ensure to check out the numerous attractions in the area, including Tagore's Ashrama, Poush Mela, Amar Kutir, and the Rabindra Bhaban Museum, where you can see many sculptures and paintings by Tagore.

name: 16. Digha
info: According to many, Digha is a well-known seaside resort town widely regarded as one of the most significant locations to visit in West Bengal. In addition to its pristine shallow-sand beaches and religious structures. It is just one hundred and seven kilometers away from Kolkata and is considered the most popular weekend retreat for families. This bustling town has remained untainted by commercial exploitation and allows you to take pleasure in the wonders of nature in the most enjoyable manner imaginable.

name: 1. Dhamma Chakra Stupa or Deeksha Bhoomi
info: Deeksha Bhoomi, which is frequently referred to as "the most peaceful place in Nagpur," is one of the best Tourist Places in Nagpur. It is situated five kilometers southwest of Nagpur City. It is a monument with a massive whitewashed dome, the biggest stupa in Asia, and it is a relatively modern construction that was completed in 2001. It was built in honor of Dr. B.R Ambedkar and the occasion of his accepting Buddhism, during which he was joined by 60000 other people who had also converted to Buddhism.

name: 2. Umred Karhandla Wildlife Sanctuary
info: Umred Karhandla is a popular tourist destination, particularly for wildlife enthusiasts and photographers. Umred Karhandla is home to "Jai," one of the largest tigers in the sanctuary and the only male in the whole sanctuary.

name: 3. Ambazari Lake & Garden
info: As we know, Nagpur is the land of many lakes, and Ambazari Lake is one of the most popular tourist attractions, mostly because it is the biggest lake in the city. This lake, one of the most beautiful locations to visit in Nagpur for couples, is also one of the biggest 11 lakes in the city.

name: 4. Vidarbha Cricket Association Ground
info: This stadium, situated in the city of Nagpur and has been the site of several memorable matches since it was built. According to official statistics, one important detail about the Vidarbha Cricket Association Ground is that it is considered one of India's biggest stadiums in terms of field space. All types of matches like a test, t20, ODI series, and international cricket matches are played on this field.

name: 5. Krazy Castle Aqua Park
info: Krazy Castle Aqua Park, one of the most entertaining locations to visit in Nagpur, allows you to enjoy yourself with your family. It also attracts visitors from surrounding towns and states. Like any other water park, Krazy Castle Aqua Park has drawn many tourists due to the variety of exciting rides. Additionally, it provides mind-blowing packages for college students, business workplaces, and educational institutions. Furthermore, the most pleasant time to visit this location is during the hot and humid summer months.

name: 6. Khindsi Lake
info: Khindsi Lake is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Nagpur because of the natural beauty and water activities available. It is, located 40 kilometers far from the city center, is one of the most romantic spots to visit in Nagpur for couples. Furthermore, it is one of the most important boating destinations in central India and draws many visitors throughout the year.

name: 7. Raman Science Center
info: This interactive science center, which is affiliated with Mumbai's Nehru Science Center, is located in the city of Nagpur. On the 7th of March in 1992, this Center was opened for the first time and became fully operational on the 5th of January in 1997. A variety of exhibits are held here to demonstrate the advancement of science and technology throughout the world. Furthermore, the name of this center is derived from the well-known Nobel Prize recipient, Mr. Chandrasekhara Venkata Raman. The services provided by the Raman Science Center to the visitors are awesome. In addition, there is a gallery in this Science Center showcasing information and technology and inventions and breakthroughs from across the globe.

name: 8. Japanese Rose Garden
info: This rose garden is one of the most popular tourist attractions in Nagpur. This garden's name comes from the style and layout of Japan. This garden, which is similar to the rose garden in Japan, is situated in the city of Nagpur and is open to the public. You can enjoy it by strolling around the garden, watching and admiring the many different varieties of roses. Visiting this Japanese rose garden may get mental and physical peace.

name: 9. Jama Masjid
info: Nagpur's Jama Mosque is the largest mosque in the city. It features a dome in the middle and is encircled by four minarets on each of its four sides, much like the majority of the other Masjids. The fine features and elaborate motifs that go into its manufacture are stunning. There is a garden next to the Masjid where tourists and visitors can relax. This garden also contributes to the overall beauty of the Masjid. It would be best if you enjoyed this place with your family and friends in Nagpur.

name: 10. Lata Mangeshkar Musical Garden
info: There are several interesting spots to visit in Nagpur at night, and one of them is Lata Mangeshkar Musical Garden. This garden, which is located 7.5 kilometers east of Nagpur in Surya Nagar, is operated under the administration of Nagpur. Under the supervision of Jaiprakash Gupta, a trustee of NIT, this place has become a popular holiday destination.

name: 11. Ramtek Temple
info: The Ramtek Temple, located on the top of a hill inside a fort on the outskirts of Nagpur, is dedicated to Lord Shiva. This makes it a relaxing location suitable for a day picnic with family and friends.

name: 12. Balaji Temple
info: This well-known temple is devoted to the Hindu deity Lord Balaji. The building of this temple is very attractive as it incorporates a wonderful combination of northern and southern construction styles. Different cultural events and festivals are held here, attracting people from all over the country to participate.

name: 13. Narrow Gauge Rail Museum
info: The Narrow Gauge Rail Museum is an excellent place to visit if you are interested in trains. This museum displays vintage railway equipment and information on the railroad revolution and other related topics. Nitish Kumar, chief minister of Bihar, presided at the museum's opening ceremony in 2002.

name: 14. Waki Woods
info: If you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life and spend quality time with your friends and family, then Waki Woods is the ideal location for you to do so. Everyone who enjoys picnicking and camping here finds this spot a delight.

name: 15. Dragon Palace Buddhist Temple
info: A must-see place in Nagpur is the Dragon Palace Buddhist Temple, also known as the Lotus Temple of Nagpur, considered one of the city's top attractions. This temple was built in 1999 using monies contributed by the Ogawa Society of Japan.

name: 16. Sitabuldi Fort
info: The fort of Sitabuldi is one of the most prominent historical tourist sites in Nagpur. Sitabuldi Fort was the battleground of the Battle of Sitabuldi in 1817.

name: 17. Seminary Hill
info: Seminary Hill is one of the most beautiful sites in Nagpur, and it is a must-see place for everyone who loves nature. It is one of the most popular tourist destinations in the city. The Seminary Hill is a great spot for anybody looking to relax and feel rejuvenated with windy and pleasant weather.

name: 18. Nagzira Wildlife Sanctuary
info: If you are a wildlife enthusiast, you should visit this wildlife sanctuary while you are in Nagpur for a vacation. This wildlife sanctuary is home to over 166 bird species and 35 different reptile species.

name: Help Others, Please Share
info: Splunk

name: 1. Golden Temple
info: This temple is the Sikhs' most important, holy, and religious Gurudwara. Harmandir Sahib is its full name. It is also known as Darbar Sahib and Golden Temple. Guru Ramdas Ji of the Sikhs established it. This Gurudwara is the highest of the five Takhts known as Shri Akal Takhat. The entire Golden Temple is composed of white stone, and the walls are covered with gold leaf by experienced artisans and shippers, resulting in highly appealing craftsmanship.

name: 2. Bagah Border
info: Bagha is a village located between Amritsar and Lahore. Because this village marks the boundary between India and Pakistan, it is known as the Bagha Border across India. A great celebration called Ratri Jagran is being held here for the momentous anniversary of India's Independence Day, beginning on the night of 14 August. Many visitors and nation lovers come here to observe the soldiers' enthusiasm and patriotism and learn the lesson of patriotism in their lives. People from all around the country attend and participate enthusiastically.

name: 3. Jallianwala Bagh
info: The terrible massacre in which British soldiers killed our unarmed Hindu brothers occurred here. Nobody has ever witnessed such a heartbreaking scenario. On 13 April 1919, a conference was called at Jallianwala Bagh during the liberation fight. This was opposite to British rule. All Indians were joining together to fight for their independence. General Dyer opened fire on unarmed children, women, and people to prevent this. This proved to be the most terrible crime under British control. Because of this tragedy, the location became known as the Jallianwala Bagh massacre. It has since been transformed into a lovely memorial and park, but the memories of those times may still be seen here. There are still bullet traces on the walls and much evidence around here. Jallianwala Bagh is just one kilometre from the Golden Temple. You may all come here and see this painful incident. The Jallianwala Bagh Trust has created and maintains a museum here.

name: 4. Partition Museum
info: Every Indian should visit Amritsar's Partition Museum at least once to understand how difficult it was to get independence from the British. After visiting here, you will understand how much we Indians have lost and how much we have gained. Will be able to see through videography.

name: 5. Sadda Pind
info: Amritsar is an excellent site to visit tourist destinations; one of them is Sadda Pind, which is only 8 kilometres away from Amritsar.

name: 6. Gobindgarh Fort
info: This fort was constructed in honour of Guru Gobind Singh. The fort is known as Govindgarh Fort, known by the same name throughout India. This fort is made of brick and lime. Raja Ranjit Singh designed and built this fort in the 17th century. Govindgarh Fort is situated on the shores of Tumbh Lake. It is reported that an underground tunnel connects from here to Lahore at Khooni Darwaza. General Dyer developed a plot for the Jallianwala Bagh massacre from this fort.

name: 7. Gurdwara Sri Tarn Taran Sahib
info: This Amritsar location is around 20 kilometres from Amritsar. It was established by Arjan Dev Ji, the fifth Guru of Sikhs. A large lake around the Gurudwara adds to its attractiveness; friends must visit this wonderful spot at least once. It is a lake that is said to cure all ailments for individuals who take a bath. According to the belief, people travel to this place from all around to wash away their sins. This is why the lake is known as Tarn Taran. Many anecdotes regarding this may be heard from the locals, which you will find interesting and shocking.

name: 8. Maharaja Ranjit Singh Museum
info: In 1977, Maharaja Ranjit Singh's summer residence was converted into a museum to provide comprehensive information on Sikh history, culture, and architecture. The Maharaja Ranjit Singh Museum, a reconstructed version of the Summer Palace, is located in the famous Rambagh Garden in the centre of Amritsar. The Panorama, a two-story circular tower adjacent to the museum, features excellent paintings representing Maharaja Ranjit Singh's six important wars. Many remnants of royal lineage are housed at the museum, including arms and armour, century-old coins, and fine paintings and manuscripts.

name: 9. Vibeksar Sahib Gurudwara
info: The sixth Sikh Guru, Guru Hargobind, established Bibeksar Sahib on the banks of Bibeksar Sarovar in 1628. He used to sit in the evenings with smart individuals and discuss religious topics. There is a magnificent garden and the Karir tree on the pond's banks, where Guru Hargobind Ji used to rest after hunting with his horse in this picturesque setting. In honour of Guru Hargobind Ji, Maharaja Ranjit Singh established this gurdwara.

name: 10. Khairuddin Masjid
info: Khair Uddin Masjid, known for its architecture, is a must-see in Amritsar. This large Muslim religious complex, established by Mohammad Khairuddin in 1876, played an important role in India's freedom effort. Khair Uddin Masjid is also a symbol of unity among Hindus, Muslims, Sikhs, and Christians. This mosque is located near Gandhi Gate in Amritsar's Hall Bazar.

name: 11. Funland Company Gardens in Amritsar
info: Apart from religious and historical tourist sites, Amritsar has a beautiful area to visit with a family known as Company Bagh, which is unique. It is open throughout the year. There will be various adventurous activities for people of all ages and one can see fake animals and birds here. If you visit Amritsar with children, Company Bagh may be the finest site since youngsters will love swinging and observing the animals.

name: 12. Siddha Shakti Peeth Lal Mata Temple
info: Among Amritsar's well-known philosophical sites, the idol of Lala Mata in this temple is thought to be the form of Vaishno Devi. Visitors must also pass through the cave, just like Vaishno Devi did. It is stated that whosoever visits Vaishnodevi in Jammu or the Lal Mata shrine in Amritsar would have equal darshan and spiritual benefits.

name: 13. Shri Durgiana Temple
info: Laxmi Narayan Temple is another name for Shri Durgiana Temple. After the Golden Temple, it is Amritsar's second holiest temple. It appears to you to be a golden temple. The temple's principal deity is Goddess Durga. However, it is also dedicated to Lord Vishnu and Goddess Lakshmi. The temple is located in the centre of a body of water and has a ghat where pilgrims can take a dip. It is said that bathing in this sacred water purifies you of all your sins from your previous life. It was initially built in the late 16th century, and Guru Harsai Mal Kapoor rebuilt it again in 1921. The temple serves langar (free meal) every day for worshipers and tourists. The biggest festivals observed here are Dussehra, Janmashtami, Ram Navami, and Diwali.

name: 14. Mata Lal Devi Temple
info: Mata Lal Devi Temple, also known as the Sheesh Mahal of Amritsar, is well-known among Hindu visitors for its supernatural abilities. The temple is devoted to the female saint Lal Devi and is thought to be a tiny replica of Jammu's famed Vaishno Devi shrine. The shrine is lighted by numerous diyas and is embellished with mirrors when the sun shines on them. Idols of numerous deities are erected on the complex's inner walls. Inside the shrine, worshipers can discover several artefacts and statues. An artificial cave brings pilgrims to the goddess' temple, which is only accessible by crawling or after completely reclined.

name: 15. Akal Takht
info: Akal Takht translates as "Throne of the Immortal," with "Akal" meaning "forever" and "Takht" meaning "throne." It is revered in Sikhism for its significance in religious and political history. It is one of Sikhism's five Takhts or seats of power. Many inscriptions and sermons based on Sikhism's teachings are delivered from here. Guru Hargobind built the Harmandir Sahib Gurdwara complex, located within the Harmandir Sahib Gurdwara. The current edifice is a five-story skyscraper with flawless white marble and a gold-leaf dome.

name: 16. ISKCON Temple
info: ISKCON Temple (also known as Shri Gaur Radha Krishna Mandir) is a prominent Hindu temple devoted to the Hindu deities Krishna and Radha, located in the city's centre near Moni Chowk. The temple has several deities, the most important of whom are Radha and Krishna. A little shop here also offers deity statues, religious texts, and other relevant stuff.

name: 17. Bhagat Singh, Rajguru, Shahdev Samadhis
info: Friends, anytime you pass through Amritsar, go to Hussainiwala Bagh, 110 kilometres away, to pay a visit to the samadhis of Shaheed Bhagat Singh, Raj Guru, and Sukhdev Ji on the Indo-Pak border. As soon as you kneel before this martyr's memorial, your eyes will be flooded with tears. We cannot express how beautiful this site is in words.

name: 18. Harika Wetland Bird Sanctuary in Amritsar
info: There are nests of colourful and beautiful birds of many species in this sanctuary, which gives a different identity to Amritsar tourism; here, a tourists come throughout the year for bird watching, especially during the rainy season for its greenery and birds chirping. The captivating voice drives genres insane.

name: How to reach Amritsar
info: Suppose you are visiting Amritsar and looking for famous food items. So, here are some of the most popular dishes: Dal, Roti, Sabzi, Kheer, Chana Masala, Chopped Onion and Tamarind Chutney, Keema Kulcha, Shammi Kebab, Mutton Tikka, Tandoori Chicken, Kharod Ka Shorba Lachha Paratha, Spinach Aside from Paneer and Smoky Begun Bharta, you will have the opportunity to sample many of Amritsar's famous foods.

name: Famous food in Amritsar
info: Suppose you are visiting Amritsar and looking for famous food items. So, here are some of the most popular dishes: Dal, Roti, Sabzi, Kheer, Chana Masala, Chopped Onion and Tamarind Chutney, Keema Kulcha, Shammi Kebab, Mutton Tikka, Tandoori Chicken, Kharod Ka Shorba Lachha Paratha, Spinach Aside from Paneer and Smoky Begun Bharta, you will have the opportunity to sample many of Amritsar's famous foods.

name: Best time to visit Amritsar
info: The winter season is considered the best time to visit Amritsar because the Golden Temple is made of marble stones, and you must walk on them because it is too hot to walk in the summer. The best time to visit is between September and December.

name: How To Reach Kolkata
info: Kolkata, India's largest city, is well connected to the rest of the country by road, air, and train. As a result, you may go to Kolkata by taking any route.

name: Famous Food Kolkata
info: Many people want to know what is renowned about food in Kolkata before traveling. Thus we'd like to notify you that you can quickly discover all varieties of Bengali food and meals in Kolkata.

name: Best Time To Visit Kolkata
info: Winter is regarded as the most significant time to visit Kolkata, as this is when most visitors visit. Many festivities, including Durga Puja, are celebrated with great pomp in Kolkata.

name: 1. The Ridge:
info: It is considered the heart of Shimla. The Ridge road is a vast open area. It is the center of all cultural events in Shimla. Summer Festival is the most well-known festival conducted at the Ridge. It is situated on Shimla's well-known retail street, Mall Road. Sanjauli Snowdown, Jakhu temple, mall road, kali bari, oakover, Annadale, and other famous Shimla destinations are all connected to this road. Stunning views of the snow-capped mountain ranges rising against the blue sky make It a famous tourist site.

name: 2. Jakhu Temple:
info: It is a famous ancient temple in Shimla. The main deity of this temple is Lord Hanuman. Tourists visit this temple to see the Shri Hanuman Jakhu as the main tourist attraction. Shri Hanuman Jakhu means the idol of Lord Hanuman, and it is located on the premises of the temple. There is an aerial ropeway to reach the temple. The ropeway connects the temple to the spot near the center of Shimla. This temple was opened in 2017, and its architectural style is Kath Kuni architecture.

name: 3. India Gate:
info: It is a famous tourist place in New Delhi. Along with famous tourist places, it is the most important place for Indians. The All India War Memorial is another name for it. It was built in memory of the 82,000 Indian and British soldiers who died during WWI (World War I). Sir Edwin Lutyens designed the India gate. It takes 1-2 hours to see and walk to the India gate.

name: 4. Qutub Minar:
info: It is a famous tourist place in Delhi. It is a "victory tower" and minaret located within the Qutub complex. Islamic architecture is the architectural style of this minaret. This minaret's height is 238 ft; top diameter is 9 feet, and base diameter is 47 feet. This minaret has a 379 spiral staircase. The minaret is open for visitors from 10:00 am to 5:00 pm. The entrance fee for Indians is 40 rupees, and entrance fees for a foreigner are 600 rupees.

name: 5. Humayun's Tomb:
info: It is a famous tourist place in Nizamuddin East, Delhi. It is the Mughal Emperor Humayun's ultimate resting site. Mughal architecture is the architectural style of this tomb. Sayyed Muhammad and Mirak Mirza Ghiyath were the architects of this tomb. It is the Indian subcontinent's first garden tomb. This tomb is inside the Char Bagh Garden. The tomb is open for visitors from 10:00 am to 6:00 pm. The entrance fee for Indians is 10 rupees, and entrance fees for a foreigner are 250 rupees. Charges for video filming are 25 rupees. It takes 2 - 3 hours to see and walk in the whole area.

name: 6. Garden of Five Senses:
info: It is a famous park in Delhi. Pradeep Sachdeva is the architect of this park, and 10 crores are the development cost of this garden. This park is 20 acres in size. There are several themed parks throughout the garden. The theme parks and attractions of the park are a solar energy park, pools of water lilies, Mughal baghs, an amphitheatre, herb gardens, cascades of sparkling water, rock carvings, bamboo courts, and themed decor. The park is open for visitors from 9:00 am to 7:00 pm. The entrance fee for adults is 30 rupees, and the entrance fee for a kid is 15 rupees. As a goodwill gesture, a duplicate of Labna Arch was recently unveiled by India in the Garden of Five Senses.

name: 7. Lodhi Garden:
info: It is a popular tourist place in Delhi. This garden has the tomb of Sikandar Lodhi and Mohammed Shah. Within the boundaries of Lodhi Garden, Shisha Gumbad, and Bara Gumbad are located. The Bara Gumbad is not a tomb but was built as an entrance to a three-domed masjid. Indo-Islamic is the architectural style of this Gumbad. Sheesh, Gumbad is known as Glass Dome because glazed tiles have been used in its construction. Islamic Hindu architecture is the architectural style of this Gumbad. 'Lady Willingdon Park' was the previous name for Lodhi Garden. This garden is open for visitors from 6:00 am to 7:30 pm.

name: 8. Delhi Zoo:
info: It is a popular tourist place in Delhi. It is also known as Chidiya Ghar or National Zoological Park. This zoo is 176 acres in size. The zoo has 1350 animals from 130 species. The zoo was opened in 1959. The zoo is closed on Fridays, and on other days it is open from 9:30 am to 4:30 pm for visitors. The entry charge for an Indian adult is 40 rupees and for an Indian kid is 20 rupees. The entry charge for the foreigner adult is 200 rupees, and for a foreigner kid is 100 rupees.

name: 9. Kempty Falls:
info: This is a famous tourist place in Mussoorie. It is approximately 13 km from Mussoorie. The water spring comes down from a cliff from a height of 1364 meters, and this is a very eye-catching scene. Visitors can visit the waterfall area from 10:00 am to 6:00 pm. There is an aerial ropeway also, and its fee is 80 rupees.

name: 10. Lal Tibba:
info: It is a famous viewpoint in Landour. It is situated on the summit of Depot hill. This viewpoint is 6 km away from Mussoorie. Visitors can visit this viewpoint from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm. The entrance fee is 50 rupees, and It takes 1-2 hours to see and walk in that area. This hill is also known as Red hill. Red hill or Lal Tibba name is given to this hill because the sky turns in red during sunrise and sunset. So this name is a direct reference to the sky's color.

name: 11. Gun Hill Point:
info: Gun Hill is Mussoorie's second-highest point. It is a famous tourist destination, particularly for photographers and nature enthusiasts. A full view or 360-degree view of the Mussoorie is visible from here. Visitors can visit this viewpoint from 10:00 am to 6:00 pm. There is an aerial ropeway also, and its fee is 75 rupees.

name: 12. Company Garden:
info: It is a famous tourist place in Mussoorie. This garden is situated in the high Himalayas. This garden is a lovely spot to spend an entire day. Municipal Garden is another name for this garden. For the kids, there are exciting rides also. The main attraction of this garden is the telescopic view, nursery, flora and blossoms, green lawn, and waterfalls.

name: 13. Jwala Devi Temple:
info: It is a holy and popular tourist place in Mussoorie. Jwala Ji Temple is another name for this temple. This temple of Goddess Durga is located on the top of Benog hill, and this temple is located at an altitude of 2104 meters. The temple opens from 5 am to 12 pm and 4 pm to 8 pm for visitors. Temple is 2 km away from the Clouds End Mussoorie and 8 km from Mussoorie.

name: 14. Pangong Lake:
info: It is Ladakh's most visited tourist destination. It is an endorheic lake. The length of this lake is 134 km, and the lake's width is 5 km. Lake's 5 sub lakes are Rum Tso (twin lakes), Tso Nyak, Pangong Tso, and Nyak Tso. During the winter, the lake freezes entirely. Famous food at this lake is tea and Maggi. To visit this lake, visitors require an inner line permit. The inner line permit fee is 20 rupees. Visitors can visit this lake from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.

name: 15. Hall of Fame Ladakh:
info: It is a famous tourist place in Leh Ladakh. It is a museum that was constructed in honor of the courageous soldiers who died in the Indo-Pakistan war while fighting for India. It takes 2 - 3 hrs to see the whole museum. The entrance fee for Indians is 10 rupees, and entrance fees for a foreigner are 50 rupees. The museum is open from 9 am to 1 pm and 3 pm to 7 pm for visitors. The Indian army maintains this museum.

name: 16. Shanti Stupa:
info: It is a white-domed Buddhist monument in Leh Ladakh. This stupa is located on a mountaintop in Chanspa. The Japanese Buddhists built the Shanti Stupa in 1991. For Buddhists, it is a sacred site. This stupa has 2 levels. The gold-encrusted Dharmachakra and Buddha statues are located on the first floor. The nirvana, life, and death of Buddha are depicted on the 2nd level of this stupa. The stupa is open for visitors from 5:00 am to 9:00 pm. It takes 1 - 2 hrs to see the whole stupa.

name: 17. Hemis Monastery:
info: It is a popular tourist place in Ladakh. It is 45 kilometers from Leh. Tibetan architecture is the architectural style of this monastery. Sengge Namgyal was the founder of this monastery. The important festival of this monastery is the Hemis festival. This monastery has a magnificent copper statue of Lord Buddha, as well as thangkas, gold and silver stupas, and murals. The monastery is open for visitors from 8:00 am to 1:00 pm and 2 pm to 6 pm. It takes 2 to 3 hrs to see the whole monastery.

name: 18. Hidimba Devi Temple:
info: This is a popular tourist place in Manali. Its other name is Dhungari Temple. This is the temple of Hidimba Devi. A cedar forest encompasses the temple. Pagoda architecture is the architectural style of this temple. Maharaja Bahadur Singh constructed this temple in 1553. People of Manali worship Hidimba Devi in Navratri, and Navratri is the main festival of this temple. This temple is open for visitors from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.

name: 19. Manu Temple:
info: This temple is in Manali. This is the temple of Sage Manu. Pagoda architecture is the architectural style of this temple. The temple is located in the valley of the Beas river. Inside the shrine, photography is forbidden. There is no specific dress code for the temple, but the visitors have to wear clothing that is long enough to cover their legs and shoulders. This temple is open for visitors from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm. It takes 1 to 2 hrs to see and walk on the premises of this shrine.

name: 20. Great Himalayan National Park:
info: It is a popular destination for animal lovers. This park is spread across 1171 km2 of land. This park was established in 1984. This park is in the Kullu. This park has 181 birds, 31 mammals, 3 reptiles, 11 annelids, 17 mollusks, 9 amphibians, and 127 insects.

name: 21. Taj Mahal:
info: The Taj Mahal is located on the right bank of the Yamuna river. The Taj Mahal, often known as the "Crown of the Palace", is an ivory-white marble mausoleum in the Indian city of Agra. It was built in 1632 by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan and contains the grave of Mumtaz, she was his favorite wife, and that also contains the grave of Shah Jahan. The mausoleum is set in casual gardens and is bordered by a wall on three sides. It is part of a 42-acre compound that includes a mosque and a guest room.

name: 22. Jim Corbett National Park:
info: It is a popular destination for animal lovers. This park is spread across 20.8 km2 of land. This park is in Nainital. This park was established in 1936. This park has 33 species of reptiles, 488 species of plants, 586 species of birds, 7 species of fish, and 36 species of dragonflies.

name: 23. Amer Fort:
info: This is a popular tourist place in Rajasthan. It is situated in Amer. It is also known as Amber Fort. Rajputana architecture is the architectural style of this fort. This fort is made using pink and yellow sandstone. This fort is huge, so visitors can hire a guide to get complete information about this fort. Every evening, in this fort, a fifty-minute light and sound show is presented. This show represents the history of fort and Jaipur. This show fee is 295 rupees. Around the fort, some entertainers, singers, and snake charmers are also present to entertain the visitors. Visitors can visit this fort from 9 am to 6 pm. It takes 3 to 4 hrs to see and walk in the whole fort.

name: Way To Reach Mumbai
info: Mumbai has a massive railway network connecting it to the country's rest part. Travelers from India's eastern, central, and western portions can purchase a ticket to Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus. In contrast, those coming from the north can choose Mumbai Central Station. Other than these two important railheads, the city of Mumbai is connected by other stations, such as Kalyani Railway Station and Dadar Railway Station. Just outside the stations, taxis, buses, and cabs are readily accessible.

name: 1. Charminar
info: Hyderabad, the Telangana capital city, is a famous tourist spot and offers a mesmerising experience to its visitors. It is situated in the old part of the city. It is square shape structure, and it is 30m in breadth and 56m tall. Sultan Mohammed Quli Qutub Shah built it in 1591 to pay homage to his beloved wife, Bhagmati. It is also called as "Arc de Triomphe of the East." The Charminar become more beautiful with its four towers present in each corner. The height of the minaret present on each side (each with four stories) is 48.7 m. It has a tiny mosque as well on the top floor. It consists of 45 prayer spaces, and people visit the place, particularly on Friday. It becomes glamorous in the evening due to the lighting of the building and is worth watching.

name: 2. GOLCONDA FORT
info: The Golconda Fort, an architectural marvel, is well connected with other parts of the city. The Qutub Shahi Kings constructed it, and the fort consists of 8 gates and 87 bastions. It is 11 kilometres away from the city. The magnificent buildings have impressive walls which are 15 to 18 feet tall and perimeter close to 11 km. The sound and light show conducted in Telugu, Hindi, and English language with the narration by the legendary and superstar actor Amitabh Bacchan makes the environment exciting.

name: 3. Ramoji Film City
info: Ramoji Film City is an alluring tourist destination that attracts tourists from different parts of the city. They have registered their name in the Guinness Book of World Records. It has spanned over 2500 acres and is located 30km far from Hyderabad. It is one biggest film studios globally and can accommodate 50 film units at a point in time. The remarkable and brilliant, sound technical facilities make it an ideal place for all the shootings and production of a movie.

name: 4. Hussain Sagar Lake
info: It takes pride in being the largest artificial lake in Asia and connects the twin cities. It is situated on the tributary of the Musi River and was found during the Ibrahim Quli Qutub Shah's rule in 1562 AD. It was named after Hussain Shah Wali.

name: 5. Birla Mandir
info: It is situated height of the 280- foot- high hillock of Kalapahad. The name has come from the powerful Industrialist: the Birlas. They have built temples in various parts of the world. It was built in 1976, and it is believed that 2000 tonnes of marble were used to construct such a magnificent temple. The marbles were brought from the state of Rajasthan. The architecture design is a mixture of three known architecture: Rajasthani Architecture, South Indian Architecture and Utakal Temple architecture. It has 11 feet high monument of Lord Lakshminarayan with a beautiful lotus carved near it. Deities such as Andal, Venkateswara and Padmavati are placed in separated shrines. Lord Buddha has a separate temple in the complex.

name: 6. Jala Vihar
info: It is situated at the Necklace Road, Jala Vihar, a family entertainment park, enjoys being at prime locations. It provides an exciting range of water activities such as Mushroom Umbrella, Tilt Bucket, River Ride, Mini Aqua trailers, Float Slide, Pendulum, and Tilt Bucket. It is ideal both for adults and kids.

name: 7. Chowmahalla Palace
info: Its literal meaning is "four palaces" in Urdu. It was constructed in the 18th century by the fifth Nizam Afzar-ud- Daulah, Asaf Jav Vu. The Palace was finished in 1869. In the beginning, it spanned over 45 acres but later got reduced to 12 acres. The Palace houses two courtyards: the southern courtyard and the northern courtyard.

name: 8. Lumbini Park
info: It was constructed in 1994 by the Hyderabad Urban Development Authority. The Park was given its name after the birthplace of Lord Buddha. Later it was renamed by the Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh. It is situated near Hussain Sagar Lake. It is considered to be one of the best tourist hotspots. You will see a huge clock at the entrance featuring different kinds of wonderful flowers. The laser show and musical fountain make the place more attractive. Another striking feature of the Park is its rich flora. It is immensely popular among children.

name: 9. Qutub Shahi Tombs
info: It has 7 tombs of Qutub Shahi Ruler and is one of the oldest heritage sites of Hyderabad. It is situated at a distance of 850 m from the Banjara Darwaza of Golconda Fort.

name: 10. Nehru Zoo Park
info: Nehru Zoological Park is situated near the Mir Alam Tank of Hyderabad. It takes pride in having about 1,500 species of reptiles, animals and birds. It is the largest Forest Zoo in India, administered by the Forest Department, Andhra Pradesh Government. It has spread over 380 acres, and it is immensely famous for being a picnic spot. It has a history museum which brings many tourists to the Park. For public viewing, it was opened in 1963. Tiger Safari, Lion Safari, Bear Safari and Butterfly Safari are present here for the tourists.

name: 11. Birla Planetarium
info: N.T. Rama Rao had inaugurated in the year 1985. It is the dome-shaped planetarium located city's heart at Naubat Pahad. It was developed in partnership with Japan. It is one of the modern planetariums present in the nation. It gives information related to space, invention and theories to the visitor. Apart from being popular among kids, it attracts tourists from all walks of life. The Sky show is an important and striking feature of the planetarium. It exhibits different sky show to the tourists.

name: 1. Ahmedabad
info: Ahmedabad is a significant city in Gujarat. Ahmedabad is the former capital of Gujarat and a city on the banks of the Sabarmati River.

name: 2. Kutch
info: Kutch is an almost island with a shape resembling a tortoise, is an ex-princely state of India that still exhibits some of its former magnificence. Because of the enormous stretches of the white salt desert, Kutch is perhaps one of India's most picturesque yet strangely otherworldly locations

name: 3. Gir National Park
info: The only place the Asiatic Lions live is at Gir National Park and Wildlife Sanctuary. The sanctuary is a component of the Kathiawar-Gir dry deciduous forests ecoregion in Talala Gir, Gujarat. The best months for observing animals are April and May, and Gir National Park is closed from June 16 to October 15 each year.

name: 4. Somnath
info: One of the 12 Jyotirlingas is located in Somnath, a pilgrimage site with the literal translation "lord of the moon." The mythology, religion, and stories surrounding this town contribute significantly to its unique identity.

name: 5. Statue of Unity
info: India's Iron Man, Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, is honored with the Statue of Unity. The statue was made to encourage Indians by evoking Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel's sense of nationalism and freedom struggle

name: 6. Vadodara
info: Gujarat's Vadodara, commonly referred to as Baroda. It is home to some of the most exceptional architectural exhibitions. Vadodara is Gujarat's cultural center and is known for one of the most opulent palaces in India, like the Lakshmi Vilas palace and numerous other renowned monuments.

name: 7. Dwarka
info: Dwarka, located on the western tip of Gujarat's Saurashtra peninsula, is the capital city of Lord Krishna's kingdom. Dwarka, also known as Devbhoomi Dwarka, is the only city part of the Char Dham and the Sapta Puris described in Hinduism. The seashores and beaches are well-liked vacation spots.

name: 8. Saputara
info: Saputara is a charming tiny hill station in Gujarat's Dang district, nestled in the Sahyadris or Western Ghats. The town is a tourist favorite because of its lush green forests, undulating mountains, brilliant waterfalls, beautiful meandering roads, vivid scenery, and many quaint cubbyholes. It is located 875 meters above sea level and is ideal for eco-tourists, animal aficionados, and those who enjoy adventure activities.

name: 9. Champaner
info: Champaner, the capital of the Sultanate of Gujarat, is a historical city in the Panchmahal region of Gujarat. The Champaner-Pavagadh Archaeological Park is rich in historical and mythological significance

name: 10. Junagadh
info: Being the former capital of Junagadh Princely State, the town is rich in historical value, with numerous historical monuments to visit. Junagadh is situated near the Girnar hills and the world-famous Gir National Park

name: 11. Gandhinagar
info: Gandhinagar is Gujarat's capital city and is about 23 km from Ahmedabad on the western bank of the Sabarmati River. Gandhinagar, one of India's few planned cities, includes Akshardham Temple, one of the country's most stunning temples.

name: 12. Porbandar
info: Porbandar, famously known as Mahatma Gandhi's birthplace, is a lovely coastal town with temples, dams, and a popular commerce hub. The old port city with a noteworthy historical event is a tourist destination with few attractions.

name: 13. Bhuj
info: Bhuj is recognized as a desert city with a history that dates back to kingdoms and empires, including palaces from the reigns of Naga leaders, Jadeja Rajputs, Gujarat Sultans, and the British Raj. With its numerous temples, quaint alleyways, and traditional handicrafts, Bhuj is one of India's most fascinating historical places. It is a municipality in Gujarat's Kutch district. The 2001 earthquake devastated the city, and it is currently recovering.

name: 14. Surat
info: Surat, whose name is associated with Saurashtra, is a port city in Gujarat. Surat, the state's second most populous city, is a global diamond-cutting center and a textile commercial hub. It is known as 'the city of flyovers' and attracts tourists interested in the region's colonial heritage and unique animals.

name: 15. Patan
info: Patan is home to Rani Ka Vav, the latest Indian entry on the list of UNESCO World Heritage Sites, and it is a treasure trove of architectural marvels and old temples with a history extending back to the medieval period. This location in Gujarat is located on the banks of the ancient Saraswati River.

name: 16. Dholavira
info: Dholavira is a known excavation site from the Indus Valley Civilization. It was a thriving Harappan site between 2650 and 1450 BCE.

name: 17. Ambaji
info: Ambaji is a lovely Gujarat town primarily known for pilgrimage and religious tourism. The area is filled with stunning temples that serve as captivating architectural exhibits. Ambaji is most closely associated with the worship of Goddess Amba, and several temples, including the Ambaji Temple, are dedicated to her.

name: 18. Anand
info: Anand is a popular city in Gujarat's Anand District. It is located 101 kilometers from Gandhinagar, the state capital. Due to the AMUL manufacturing factory and the milk revolution that occurred in the twentieth century, Anand is sometimes called the Milk Capital of India.

name: 19. Rajkot
info: Rajkot, which lies in the western part of the nation, is the fourth-largest city in the Gujarat state of India. Rajkot is a business city with few attractions to view. It is worth a visit for its traditional snacks, sweets, Navratri celebrations, handicrafts (silverwork, patola weaving, bandhani), and its labyrinth of winding streets with distinctly cultural characteristics. Rajkot is ideal for a day excursion and is halfway between Porbandar and Ahmedabad.

name: 20. Himatnagar
info: Gujarat is India's Sabarkantha district, where Himmatnagar is situated. The municipality serves as the region's administrative hub and is situated along the Hathmathi River

name: 21. Bhavnagar
info: Bhavnagar, known as the cultural center of Gujarat, is situated at the southernmost point of the Gujarat peninsula. Literary giants like Govardhan Tripathi, Kavi Kant, Narsihm Mehta, and Ganga Sati have ties to Bhavnagar. While the careless waves of the Gulf of Khambat may be seen on one side, the busiest port for ocean shipping in India can be seen on the other.

name: 22. Palanpur
info: A city and municipality in Gujarat, India's Banaskantha district, is called Palanpur. The district's administrative center is renowned for its illustrious history and colossal Hindu and Jain shrines. A trip here would help you understand the conflicts fought and won and the dynasties that once called this place home.

name: 23. Umbergaon
info: Umbergaon, also known as Umargam, is a small census town in the Gujarati state of Valsad, where most of its residents are fishermen. The town, situated in a little mountainous area and close to the Maharashtra border, is renowned for its numerous beautiful beaches and historic temples.

name: 24. Anjar
info: Anjar is a town and municipality in Gujarat's Kutch District. It is the oldest town in Kutch, having existed for more than 1,400 years. Anjar is well-known for its gher and dabeli, two of its signature dishes. In addition, it has long served as the hub of Kutch's trade and economy.

name: 25. Pirotan Island
info: Pirotan Island is one of 42 islands in the marine park region, which is located close to the Marine National Park in the Jamnagar district of Gujarat on the western coast. It has a surface area of 3 square kilometers. Pirotan Island provides a peaceful setting for a meeting with nature as a part of the first marine national park. One of the two islands in the region that is often open to tourists and visitors is Narara Island.

name: 26. Dandi Beach
info: Dandi in Surat is a lovely beach destination renowned for its historical significance. It is a favorite among visitors to this location because of its panoramic beauty and extensive history.

name: 27. Zarwani Waterfalls
info: Zarwani Waterfalls is one of India's most popular natural attractions, about 90 kilometers from Vadodara in Gujarat.

name: 28. Hathni Waterfalls
info: One of the most amazing and magnificent waterfalls in the Indian subcontinent may be found in Jambughoda.

name: 29. Kabirvad
info: A small island known as Kabirvad in Gujarat's Bharuch district has been considered Saint Kabir's home for several hundred years. What began as a single Banyan tree in Kabirvad has since sprouted into over 3000 trunks, with the mother tree believed to be over 600 years old.

name: 30. Vadla
info: Within a short drive of Ahmedabad is Vadla, a developing sanctuary for migratory birds traveling to Gujarat's marshy wetlands. In contrast to the Nal Sarovar Bird Sanctuary, Vadla is still a secret gem only known to the locals and is still relatively unspoiled.

name: 31. Modhera
info: The ruins of the Sun Temple constructed by the Chalukya dynasty are housed at Modhera, a historic village in the Indian state of Gujarat. The Sun Temple, a center for spirituality and culture, lends a mysterious aspect to its surrounding community.

name: 32. Marine National Park
info: The Gulf of Kutch's Marine National Park is India's first marine park. Due to the extensive range of plants and animals, it serves as a magnificent natural showcase for India's resources and beauty. Forty-two isolated islands in an archipelago make up the park. The park also protects numerous aquatic species from poachers by housing them.

name: 33. Wankaner
info: In Gujarat, where the River Macchu turns, is the princely town of Wankaner, renowned for its royal history and historical buildings. The words "wanka" and "ner," which together mean "bend" and "river," are the source of the city's name. The Jhala Rajputs were the first to dominate the city, also known as Jhalawar.

name: 34. Nargol Beach
info: Nargol Beach is a stunning and tranquil beach located in Gujarat and widely dispersed over 16 kilometers.

name: 35. Sardar Sarovar Dam
info: Sardar Sarovar Dam, a huge gravity dam on the River Narmada at Navagam, Gujarat, was constructed to preserve water, benefit the local community, and protect the environment. The project's foundation was set by Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru in 1961, and its development began in 1979. Today, this dam assists with irrigation, hydropower generation for Gujarat, and providing drinking water to nearby villages.

name: 36. Ratanmahal Sloth Bear Sanctuary
info: A steep isle in Gujarat's Dahod District known as the Ratanmahal Sloth Bear Sanctuary is where sloth bears can be found. Locals advise travelers to avoid the Sloth Bear because they believe it to be even more deadly than a leopard. Gujarat Tourism's full-service hotel facility is on-site at the Kanjeta Eco campground.

name: 37. Zanzari Waterfalls
info: The Zanzari Waterfalls are located along the Vatrak River in Dehgam, Gujarat. A gorgeous collection of rocks, stones, and craters is where the main waterfall, which is 25 feet high.

name: 38.Taranga Hills
info: "Taranga" refers to a three-peaked hill along the Sabarmati River in Gujarat's Mehsana district. It is about 130 kilometers from Ahmedabad. As one of the five greatest Mahatirthas, Taranga Hills is of utmost significance to Jains.

name: 39. Sardar Patel Zoological Park
info: A recently opened zoo called Sardar Patel Zoological Park is located in Kevadia, a town in Gujarat's Narmada district. This fantastic enterprise, close to the magnificent Statue of Unity, is home to over 170 different types of fauna worldwide, a large variety of plants, and a stunning aviary with native and exotic bird species.

name: 40. Thol Bird Sanctuary
info: Gujarat's Mehsana district is home to the environmentally diverse bird refuge known as Thol Bird Sanctuary. It is one of the most well-liked locations in the state for bird watching and is tucked away within the deep deciduous forest. Numerous unique species and migratory birds, including pelicans, flamingos, and mallards, are welcomed at the refuge. Thol Lake adds to the tranquility of the Sanctuary, making it a well-liked hangout for nature enthusiasts.
