name: 1. Ganpatipule: Exotic Beaches
info: Ganpatipule is surrounded by beautiful beaches and mangroves, as well as plantations. The beautiful blue sea of the Arabian Sea enhances the natural wonderfulness of this location. Ganpatipule Beach and Aare Ware Beach are two fascinating sea beaches to explore during your vacation to Ganpatipule. Another old temple in this area is the Swayambhu Ganpati temple. The Jaigad Fort and a lighthouse built during the British era are also noteworthy. Without a doubt, this is among the most popular tourist spots in Konkan.

name: 2. Alibaug: The Best of Everything
info: You may see some of the most valuable forts on the west coast in Alibaug, also called Alibag. The Alibaug Fort and the Magen Avot Synagogue should top your list of places to see in Konkan. Thousands of pilgrims go to the Siddheswat Mandir and the Kanakeshwar Mandir each year. You may walk along some of the region's beaches, such as Kashid Beach, Korlai Beach, Nagaon Beach, and Akshi Beach. Water sports are available in addition to the delicious seafood cuisine.

name: 3. Ratnagiri: The Port Town
info: The world-famous Alphonso mangoes are farmed near the port town of Ratnagiri. The Western Ghat highlands and the Arabian Sea waves make this town the perfect destination for a romantic weekend. When travelling to Ratnagiri, you must stop at some of the region's most beautiful beaches to relax and rejuvenate in the natural world. Guhagar Beach and the Ratnagiri Lighthouse are must-sees in this area.

name: 4. Sindhudurg: For Forts
info: When one thinks about Sindhudurg, the first thing that springs immediately to mind is Chhatrapati Shivaji's fort of the same name. The Sindhudurg Fort, which has 50 mini towns, is the district's most prominent destination. This site is popular for snorkelling and other water activities and is one of the best spots to visit in Konkan in the winter. You will be able to taste Malvani cuisine as well. While here, don't forget to taste the Alphonso mangoes and coconuts.

name: 5. Dapoli: For Cultural Vultures
info: Mini-Mahabaleshwar is another name for Dapoli, located about 215 kilometres from Mumbai. This place, formerly ruled by the British, is now in place by various cultures. Dapoli is known for its beautiful beaches, but it also includes forests. Additionally, old temples such as Keshavraj and Vyaghreshwar Temple may be visited. Dolphin sightings and forest treks are two activities not to be missed here. Dapoli is one of the greatest sites to visit in Konkan if you want to improve your understanding of other cultures.

name: 6. Murud: To Get an Amazing Vacation
info: Murud, near Alibaug, is famous for its beautiful sea beaches and historical structures. During your tour to Murud, you must see the Murud Janjira Fort. This fort is located close to the town on a small islet. Other attractions include the Nawab's Palace, the historic cemeteries of Khokri Gumbaj, and Dutta Mandir. There are other adventure sports offered here.

name: 7. Harnai: Beaches are aplenty
info: Harnai is famous for its Harnai Karde Beach and other beautiful sea beaches in Dapoli. Harnai is one of the spots to visit in Konkan if you want to experience true Konkani culture and various beautiful sea beaches, including Ladghar, Kelshi, and Anjarle. You may also go to Suvarnadurg and Parshuram Bhumi.

name: 8. Mahad: Exotic Location
info: Mahad is one of the fascinating places to visit in Maharashtra's Konkan region. This city was previously the capital of Shri Shivaji Maharaj and is now home to Buddhist Gumpas and Maratha forts. Because of the repeated floods that have happened here in recent years, this region now resembles a triangle peninsula. You may find the Gandhar Pale Buddhist Caves, Raigad, Pratapgad, Birwadi, Warandha Forts, and other tourist attractions here.

name: 9. Kelshi: An Undiscovered Treasure
info: Kelshi is a secret treasure yet to be discovered by the public. Therefore, Kelshi is the place to go if you're looking for tranquillity, peace and beauty. It is a little town that is well known for its beaches. Kelshi also has a wide variety of plants and wildlife. It would be best to visit it while on vacation because it is one of the most significant places to see in Konkan.

name: 10. Roha: Ruins from the Past
info: The popularity of Roha as a tourist destination is growing. The little village, which lies between the Kalasgiri hills and the Kundalika River, is said to be haunted. River rafting is only one of the popular activities in the village. A must-see Konkan attraction, keep this on your schedule.

name: 11. Amboli: Wonderful Vacation
info: Amboli, a beautiful and peaceful town just beyond Goa's borders, is the ideal spot for a well-deserved rest and one of the greatest tourist destinations in Konkan. The area is rich in flora, wildlife, and breathtaking views that will keep you entertained. Several little waterfalls can also be seen there.

name: 12. Chiplun: The Best of Greenery
info: Chiplun is famous for being Parshuram's residence. As a result, you can appreciate how priceless it is. It contains several temples, and its splendor is most prominent in the rainy season. Therefore, be careful to go while it's raining. It also features a museum where tourists may learn about the history of the city in addition to temples.

name: 13. Shrivardhan: The Royal Residence
info: The most well-known beaches are Kondivali and Diveagar. If you're looking for a thrilling adventure, travel to Shrivardhan, a coastal town with several beaches. It is famous not just for its beautiful beaches but also for being the former residence of the Peshwas.

name: 14. Dombivli: Pursue Lord Ganesha's blessings
info: Dombivli is a charming city located 40 kilometres south of Mumbai. Dombivli is one of the most amazing sights in Konkan and a well-known city with good connections to Mumbai and Thane. Seek Lord Ganesha's grace at the renowned Ganpati temple in Dombivli. Reti Bandar, located on the side of the peaceful Ulhas River, is the finest place to come in Dombivli for people who wish to see lovely scenery. Kelkar Road in Dombivli is a famous shopping destination for locals and tourists, and you should visit it and buy a bit.

name: 15. Badlapur: Enthralling Waterfalls
info: Badlapur, situated in the Than district and surrounded by Nature and calm, is another popular nice vacation spot in Konkan. Because of its closeness to Mumbai, this city is a great place to spend a weekend. It is a wonderful alternative for all nature enthusiasts due to the good weather and beautiful waterfalls. You may visit the iconic Kondeshwar Shiv Temple and participate in the daily morning and evening prayers.

name: 16. Kalyan: Investigate the Grand Fort
info: Kalyan is Maharashtra's ninth biggest city and is noted for its old walls. During the Mughal Empire, Kalyan was protected by walls that are still visible today. Kalyan, one of the most attractive destinations in Konkan for history lovers, receives many people each year. To make your holiday unforgettable, visit this fort during the Navratri festival and participate in great events. In this city, Durgadi Fort is the main tourist destination.

name: 17. Malvan: Enjoy Delightful Desserts
info: Malvan is a picture-perfect town with beautiful beaches and a majestic fort. Beaches, mangoes, and locally created delicacies are all popular in this town. Malvani Khaja, Malvani Ladoos, Konkani meva, Aambawadi, and Fanaspoli are all delectable sweet foods that all foodies must try. One of Malvan's best-known tourist attractions is Sindhudurg Fort, which Hirojee Indalkar built-in 1664. You may rest and relax at famous beaches like Arse Mahal, Chivla, and Tondavli.

name: 18. Thane: Lakes that mesmerize
info: Thane is a huge city with beautiful lakes that attract many visitors. Thane, home to various beautiful lakes such as Brahmala Lake, Masunda Lake, Datiwali Lak, Rewale Lake, and Burbank Lake, is a city for people who wish to get away from the busy city life and relax in the middle of Nature. Visit Thane's lakes to enjoy the lovely sunset view or go for a stroll while enjoying Nature's creations.

name: 19. Mumbai: Dreamland
info: Mumbai is one of Maharashtra's most popular tourist destinations. One of the greatest spots to visit on the Konkan coast is the home of Bollywood stars. Everyone may find something to enjoy in this city, which is famous for Marine Drive and Juhu Chowpatty. Mumbai will treat you with the finest of everything, from shopping to street cuisine. The Gateway of India, Siddhivinayak Temple, Juhu Beach, and Haji Ali Dargah are some prominent tourist destinations in Mumbai.

name: Best Tourist Places in Chennai
info: Covelong Beach is a beautiful beach located in the charming village of Covelong on the Coromandel coast. It stands out as one of the top attractions in Chennai. With its clean and untouched shoreline, crystal-clear blue waters, and tall swaying palm trees, this beach provides a peaceful getaway from the busy city life.

name: 1. Covelong Beach
info: Covelong Beach is a beautiful beach located in the charming village of Covelong on the Coromandel coast. It stands out as one of the top attractions in Chennai. With its clean and untouched shoreline, crystal-clear blue waters, and tall swaying palm trees, this beach provides a peaceful getaway from the busy city life.

name: 2. Marina Beach
info: Marina Beach, one of the top tourist places in Chennai, is a beautiful stretch of golden sand that beckons visitors from far and wide. This iconic urban beach in the city's heart offers a delightful blend of natural beauty and bustling activities. As you step onto the soft sand, you'll be greeted by the soothing sound of crashing waves and a refreshing sea breeze.

name: 3. Marundeeswarar Temple
info: On the Bay of Bengal beaches lies Marundeeswarar Temple, a well-known Shiva temple in Chennai. Marundeeswarar is renowned as the 'god of medicines,' Hindu worshippers travel across the country to pray for health and healing.

name: 4. Breezy Beach
info: Breezy Beach, located in the coastal neighborhood of Valmiki Nagar in Chennai, is a serene and idyllic retreat for beach lovers. With its soft golden sands, gentle sea breeze, and panoramic views of the Bay of Bengal, this charming beach offers a delightful escape from the city's hustle and bustle.

name: 5. Fort St. George
info: Fort St. George is so historic and classic that every other visitor might visit this place. It is situated on the coastal stretch of Chennai and is a historic landmark and a must-visit attraction for history enthusiasts and tourists alike. Built-in 1644 by the British East India Company, this imposing fort holds immense historical significance as the first fortress established by the British in India.

name: 6. Madras War Memorial
info: The Madras War Memorial is a poignant tribute to the brave martyrs of the Second World War. Nestled in the heart of Chennai, it is an awe-inspiring destination that pays homage to our fallen heroes and beckons visitors with its captivating beauty.

name: 7. Arignar Anna Zoological Park
info: A must-visit destination and location for adventurers and animal lovers in Chennai. It has been regarded as one of Chennai's most sighted and visited locations. Spread across the lush and beautiful greenery with the mesmerizing escape from the pollution in the city. As you enter the zoological park, you will find yourself in the vibrant ecosystem, bustling with different animal species like deer, elephants, etc.

name: 8. Mylapore
info: Mylapore, a vibrant neighborhood nestled in the heart of Chennai, India, is a captivating destination that offers a perfect blend of tradition, history, and modernity. This ancient area is steeped in cultural significance and serves as a gateway to other renowned tourist attractions in Chennai.

name: 9. Royapuram Fishing Harbour
info: The Royapuram fishing harbor is one of the top tourist attractions in Chennai for those visitors who are fascinated by taking stunning images of the places they visit. This area, also known as the Kasimedu fishing port or the Chennai fishing harbor, attracts many tourists since it is a popular fishing place in Chennai. If you want to get a glimpse into the life of Chennai residents, you should visit this port. A large number of anglers and boats may be seen catching fish. Locals may also be seen strolling the market and purchasing seafood.

name: 10. Ashtalakshmi Temple
info: You can visit the Ashtalakshmi temple in the South of the city in Besant Nagar, which is often a few feet from the beach side and has a good-facing sunset. Enchanting Goddess Asthalakshmi Devi is worshipped in this temple, and everyone wishes for their well-wishers.

name: 11. Government Museum
info: The Government Museum, founded in 1851, is the country's 2nd oldest museum, after the Indian Museum in Kolkata. It is located in Chennai's Egmore area and was constructed in the Indo-Saracenic style. It holds an extensive collection of paintings by Raja Ravi Varma. So, you should visit the Government Museum of Chennai, if you are an artist or a painter or has an apid interest in paintings and 90s art of modern India.

name: 12. MGR Film City
info: If you are a South Indian movies fan, you must have heard about the MGR film city, named after the late MG Ramachandran, a great actor. It was built in 1994 and is quite a new building in respect of others.

name: 13. Nettukuppam
info: Nettukuppam is Chennai's northernmost tip, featuring a beach that crowds haven't discovered. It's a quiet hideaway for those who like to get up and personal with the rushing river while in a calm environment. Ennore's salty stream meets the sea here, making a type of estuary; the setting is ideal for a relaxed holiday because it is still off the usual tourist road.

name: 14. Vadapalani Murugan Temple
info: One of the most renowned temples devoted to Lord Murugan is Vadapalani Murugan Temple. The temple, located in Vadapalani, Chennai, is recognised for assisting worshippers in finding solutions to life's issues. People come here to help with marital, intellectual, and professional issues. Many devotees report that coming here to pray has helped them overcome their problems and find serenity in their lives. Worshipping Lord Murugan is likewise seen to be equally devout as worshipping him at the original Palani temple. If people cannot worship at Murugan's native abode, they may do it here, and Murugan will still shower blessing on them.

name: 15. Kolli Hills
info: The Kolli Hills, also called Kolli Malai, is a mountainous region in Tamil Nadu's Namakkal region renowned as the "Mountain of Death." Its natural beauty has been retained because commercial tourists have virtually undisturbed it.

name: Best Time to Visit Chennai
info: From March to early July, the weather is unsuitable for travellers in Chennai. The tropical environment of Chennai makes the summertime heat nearly intolerable. Going outside in the afternoon is not advised since it is hot and humid. It is also not a good idea to visit sites around Chennai during this time.

name: 1. Gavi
info: The village of Gavi is located in Kerala, India's Pathanamthitta district. It is a little community hidden between tea gardens and broad, lush forests, making it one of India's most stunning locations. The location is a model eco-tourism site that showcases the world's astounding abundance of flora and wildlife. It is a unique endekilometersavour in and of itself. Near Thekkady, Gavi is located 14 kilometers southwest of Vandiperiyar and 28 kilometers from Kumily. In many ways, Gavi, which is located within the Ranni reserve forest, is heaven on Earth.

name: 2. Thriveni Sanganam
info: The Holy Pamba River meets the Manimala River in its north and the Achankovil River in its south at the Thriveni Sanganam, as the name suggests. It can be found along the route to Sabarimala. The worshippers stop here to bathe in the holy water to atone for their transgressions. Millions of tourists also flock here to take in the stunning scenery. The third-longest river in India's southern region, the Pamba River, sometimes referred to as the Dakshina Ganga or the Ganges of South India, originates from the Western Ghats. Believed by devotees, King Rajasekara had a glimpse of Lord Ayappa close to this sacred river.

name: 3. Kaviyoor Mahadeva Temple
info: On a small hilltop in Kaviyoor, Pathanamthitta District stands the historic Kaviyoor Mahadeva Temple. One of Kerala's most well-known and important Shiva temples, this temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati.

name: 4. Muloor Smarakam
info: Muloor Smarakam is a memorial honoring the social reformer and poet Muloor S. Padmanabha Panicker from the pre-independence era. It is located in the little village of Elavumthitta, 12 kilometers from Pathanamthitta town. This memorial is a typical Keralan home that the poet formerly called home.

name: 5. Manjinikkara Church
info: A monastery of the Syriac Orthodox Church is Manjanikkara Dayara. It may be found in Manjanikkara, close to Omallur, in the Pathanamthitta district in South Kerala, India. Mor Yulios Elias Qoro, a Patriarchal representative to the Malankara Church, founded the monastery. The Patriarchal Delegate to Malankara and the metropolitan of the Simhasana churches both have offices at the Manjanikkara Dayro.

name: 6. Sabarimala
info: The Sabarimala temple in Kerala receives more than 30 million pilgrims each year, making it the largest in India and the second largest in the world. After the Hajj pilgrimage of Mecca in Saudi Arabia. Sabarimala is a temple town on the banks of the river Pampa that is situated inside the Periyar Tiger Reserve in the Keralan district of Pathanamthitta.

name: 7. Paliakara Church
info: The historic Paliakara Church is a monument to the rich history and culture of the past. This church, which is located in Trivuvalla, has origins that date back to St. John the Evangelist's entrance there in 54 AD, making it one of the major religious sites for Syrian Christians.

name: 8. Aranmula
info: Kerala, India's state capital, contains the temple town of Aranmula. It is regarded as the district's cultural hub and is located on the banks of the revered Pampa River, some 116 kilometers from Trivandrum, the state capital of Kerala. It is located close to Kozhenchery in the Pathanamthitta District and has long been a significant location for pilgrimage and trade when the river served as the primary mode of transportation. From the nearby (10 km away) Chengannur railway station, it is conveniently accessible.

name: 9. Malayalappuzha
info: A Bhadrakali temple named Malayalappuzha Devi Temple is located in the Indian state of Kerala's Pathanamthitta. The temple was allegedly constructed more than a thousand years ago.

name: 10. Perunthenaruvi
info: The Perunthenaruvi Waterfalls are located in the Central Travancore region of Kerala State, India, 36 kilometers from Pathanamthitta. It is a well-known tourist site located in the Ranni taluk's Vechoochira Panchayat. Kudamurutty is on the waterfall's one shore, while Vechoochira is on the other. Later on, the creek merges with the Pamba River. It is stunning and perilous at the same time.

name: 1. Kudroli Temple
info: Kudroli Temple is a well-known temple in Mangalore devoted to Gokarneshwara, another avatar of Lord Shiva. Narayan Guru, a well-known social reformer from Kerala, founded this temple. It is one of Mangalore's most famous tourist attractions.

name: 2. Mangladevi Temple
info: Bolar is home to the Mangaladevi Temple. Mangalore is derived from Goddess Mangaladevi, the temple's principal goddess. In the 9th century, this shrine was established to remember the princess of Malabar Mangal. It is one of the most beautiful places to visit in Mangalore. Mangaladevi Temple has a long and successful history. The temple has special meaning for unmarried ladies since it is believed that unmarried girls who worship here are blessed.

name: 3. Tannirbavi Beach
info: Tannirbavi Beach is located near the Mangalore port's southern edge. The Mangalore Port Trust owns the beach. This is one of Mangalore's most beautiful beaches and a famous tourist attraction.

name: 4. St. Aloysius Chapel
info: St. Aloysius Chapel is located on the campus of St. Aloysius College, in the centre of Mangalore. The chapel's walls are decorated with paintings by Italian artist Antoni Moschini. Father Joseph Willey established the church in 1899-100. It is one of the most popular tourist sites in Mangalore. Mangalore Railway Station is 1.5 kilometres away.

name: 5. Panambur Beach
info: Mangalore Railway Station is 11 kilometres away from Panambur Beach. Panambur Beach, located near Mangalore port, is a popular Mangalore tourist destination. This beach is suitable for swimming. The beach provides excellent views of the sunset. Because of its proximity to the city, the beach receives many visitors. A camel ride is available as an additional attraction at this beach. Visitors may enjoy boating and water sports at the beach. Panambur Beach is also well-known for hosting the International Kite Festival in the last week of April.

name: 6. Surthkal Beach in Mangalore
info: Surathkal Beach is a lovely beach with stunning natural beauty. The beach has spectacular sunset views and is frequently fairly busy in the evenings. It is one of Mangalore's most popular beaches. The old Sadashiva Temple near the seashore is well worth a visit. According to the mythology, in order to stop Ravana from taking the Aatma Ling to Lanka, Lord Ganesha and Lord Vishnu's planned and succeeded and Ravana's Shivling was placed by him on the ground, Ravana attempted to grab it by force, and some fragments were scattered. One such linga fragment is supposed to have fallen at Suratkal. A lighthouse near the Sadashiva temple is located on a tiny hill. Suratkal is home to the well-known National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NITK).

name: 7. Kateel Durgaparameshwari Temple
info: Kateel Shree Durgaparameshwari Temple is one of the region's most holy temples. The temple's most notable feature, which draws many visitors, is its location on an islet in the middle of the river Nandini, surrounded by natural beauty. The temple is 27 kilometres from Mangalore and is dedicated to Goddess Durga Parameshwari. If you wish to visit this temple, you should go during the monsoon season because the panoramic view here in the monsoon season is particularly appealing to tourists. Devotees can worship, chant mantras, or sit at this temple. This temple is a fantastic spot to visit if you're looking for spirituality.

name: 8. Pilikula Nisargadhama Park
info: Pilikula Nisargadhama is a well-known entertainment park in Mangalore. Pilikula translates as "Tiger Pool." Tigers used to visit the lake for water. Hence the location was once a natural home for them. Pilikula draws not just nature lovers but also botanists, zoologists, and students interested in studying the variety of flora and fauna found here. In addition, there is a zoo, botanical gardens, a scientific centre, and an artisan village. You can take a guide who will provide information on all aspects of Pilicula. If you come here to explore between October and February, they will also have the opportunity to watch migratory birds.

name: 9. Shri Sharavu Mahaganapathi Temple
info: Sri Sharavu Mahaganpati Temple is a well-known ancient temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha and Shiva. The temple is said to be 800 years old. Sharavu is derived from the term 'Shara,' which means arrow, and is associated with an interesting narrative. Lord Ganesha is said to take away his worshippers' difficulties and sorrows. The big temple is busy during key festival days like Sankranti, Ganesh Chaturthi, and Dussehra. Along with conducting aarti at the temple, each devotee is allowed to pull the palanquin. Surprisingly, these rites are accompanied by both traditional instrumental music and chanting.

name: 10. Polali Rajarajeshwari Temple
info: The Polali Rajarajeshwari Temple was built in the 8th century and is dedicated to Sri Rajarajeshwari. The temple's architecture is impressive, with fine woodwork carvings of Hindu deities and copper plates on the roofs. The main attraction for visitors is the idol of Sri Rajarajeshwari, which is made of clay that is supposed to have medicinal virtues. Sri Rajarajeshwari Devi is a manifestation of Shakti, who is said to have the capacity to create and even destroy the cosmos. The goddess deactivates all negative energy, making her one of Hindu mythology's most powerful deities. The beautiful temple is regularly used for Hindu celebrations such as the yearly and Polali Chendu festivals.

name: 11. Manjunatha Temple
info: Dharmasthala is one of Karnataka's most prominent pilgrimage places, located 70 kilometres from Mangalore on the banks of the Netravati River. The famous Manjunatha temple is the temple's major attraction. Shree Kshetra is another name for this place. This temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva as Manjunatha or Lokeshwar, dates from the 16th century. The Shiva Linga revered at this temple is claimed to have been purchased from the Kadri temple in Mangalore. In the 16th century, Vadiraja Swami of Udupi called the area Kuduma and renamed it Dharmasthala.

name: 12. Mangalore Beach
info: Mangalore beach is a popular tourist destination at the confluence of two lovely rivers: Gurupara and Nehravati. If you visit Mangalore, the best time to visit the beach is around sunset, when there is a stunning sunset view. The beauty of the Arabian Sea surrounds Mangalore Beach. From here, you may witness an amazing sunset.

name: 13. Ullal Beach
info: Ullal Beach is regarded as Karnataka's favourite beach. Ullal Beach, only 12 kilometres from Mangalore, captivates tourists with its long shoreline and panoramic view of the gorgeous Arabian Sea. Various water sports activities are planned for an adrenaline rush that will undoubtedly entertain the guests. If you're on vacation or want to spend the weekend near the beach, check out Someshwara Temple, St. Sebastian's Church, Queen Abbakka Fort, and Summer Sands Beach Resort.

name: 14. New Mangalore Port
info: New Mangalore Port is one of the most famous ports in Karnataka and the country's 7th largest port. It was opened on 4 May 1974 by the then Prime Minister of India, Indira Gandhi. This port is located in Panambur on India's west coast. It stretches from the Falguni River to the Arabian Sea. It is the seventh-largest port in the country and exports some of the primary commodities.

name: 15. Sakleshpur
info: There are several hill stations in Karnataka, but Sakleshpur in Mangalore is one of the most picturesque. Tourists frequently visit this highland station to spend the weekend. This hill station, located at an elevation of 950 meters, is ornamented with coffee, tea, cardamom, and cinnamon. It's also known as "Poor Man's Ooty." Having a large budget to visit here is not required, but you may enjoy the magnificent plains and hills at a lower cost.

name: 16. Kadri Hill Park
info: Kadri Hill Park is Mangalore's largest park, where they can enjoy the splendid beauty of nature. Rare animal species can also be found here. The eight tanks stored here are the most interesting feature. It is stated that the water in these tanks may treat skin ailments.

name: 17. Someshwara Beach
info: During your visit to Mangalore, you will pass by various beaches, one of which is Someshwara Beach. Someshwara Beach is also home to the Someshwara Temple, which is devoted to the Hindu deity Shiva, and it is said that the beach's rocks exist due to the Lord's presence. Another notable attraction near the beach is "Otienne Hill," a magnificent vantage point where you can see the city below, the Netravati River, and the lovely Arabian Sea.

name: 18. Sasihithlu Beach
info: Sasihthlu Beach is a lovely beach in Karnataka, approximately 25 kilometres from Mangalore in the town of Sasihthlu. This is where the Nandini and Shambhavi rivers meet the Arabian Sea. Most people have no understanding of this beach and are just now beginning to explore it.

name: 19.Milagres Church
info: The age-old architecture, religious value, and historical importance are the main attraction for travellers. Milagres Church, which dates back to the late 1600s, is one of the oldest in South Karnataka. The old Milagres Church no longer exists since Tipu Sultan razed it, but the cemetery and a church added years later do. Followers leave to pray.

name: 20. Forum Fiza Mall
info: The Forum Fiza Mall, located in Pandeshwar, Mangalore, is the fourth largest mall in Karnataka. It was opened in 2014 as the Forum Mall and has since become a popular hangout for visitors and locals. This is the place to go if you want to shop and hang out after viewing tourist attractions.

name: How to Reach Mangalore
info: Mangalore is well-known for its Udupi-style food and popular seafood. Neer Dosa, Mangalorean Fish Curry, Cashew Upkari, Rasam, Ken (Lady Fish), Ole Bela (Palm Jaggery), Export Quality Cashews, and various coffees are available to visitors. Aside from that, the sweets served here have a unique taste. Desserts include Mangalorean parfait ice cream, pudding in three flavours, and a variety of fruit drinks and treats. Mangalore also provides Catholic cuisine with Mangalorean, Goan, and Portuguese influences. Don't miss out on the amazing thali here, including Fried Fish, Fried Ro Curry, Pork Roast, etc. You may easily experience these delicious dishes here, especially if you are a non-vegetarian.

name: Local Food of Mangalore
info: Mangalore is well-known for its Udupi-style food and popular seafood. Neer Dosa, Mangalorean Fish Curry, Cashew Upkari, Rasam, Ken (Lady Fish), Ole Bela (Palm Jaggery), Export Quality Cashews, and various coffees are available to visitors. Aside from that, the sweets served here have a unique taste. Desserts include Mangalorean parfait ice cream, pudding in three flavours, and a variety of fruit drinks and treats. Mangalore also provides Catholic cuisine with Mangalorean, Goan, and Portuguese influences. Don't miss out on the amazing thali here, including Fried Fish, Fried Ro Curry, Pork Roast, etc. You may easily experience these delicious dishes here, especially if you are a non-vegetarian.

name: Best Time to Visit Mangalore
info: Mangalore is best visited between September and April. Because the temperature rarely rises beyond 30 degrees, you may spend the entire day relaxing on the beaches. Summers are quite hot, with significant levels of humidity. So don't forget to visit here throughout the summer. Mangalore has considerable rains in July and August, making it an unsuitable season to visit. As a result, the winters and monsoons are the greatest times to visit Mangalore.

name: 1. Radha Soami Samadhi
info: When having a trip to Agra, the Radha Soami Samadhi, an ornate building and one of the most iconic destinations of this city, cannot be missed. The people who have faith in Radha Soami and worship their name, count it as one of the most prestigious places of worship. The main characterization of this tourist place is the surrounding pillars and a large dome in the centre of the building. The founder of the Radha Soami faith, Huzur Swamiji Maharaj, started the construction of this temple, and it is his mausoleum. The interesting fact about Radha Soami Samadhi is that its consecution began in 1904 and continued for a century. This place is located at the Soami Bagh of Poiya Ghat Rd of the city.

name: 2. Mariam-Uz-Zamani Tomb
info: Built by Jahangir, Mariam-Uz-Zamani Tomb is the mausoleum of Jodha Bai, who was the Hindu wife of the emperor Akbar, and it is listed among one of the most popular tourist places in Agra. The Hindu wife of emperor Akbar was known by a lot of names in history books, and Mariam-Uz-Zamani is one of her most popular names. Jahangir built this tomb as the mausoleum in fond memory of his loving mother, and it is located on the west side of Akbar's tomb. Positioned at Mathura Road near Pathwari Mandir of Mahadev Pur, this tomb is surrounded by lavish Mughal gardens and constructed with red sandstone.

name: 3. Nagina Masjid
info: Nagina Masjid is one of the magnificent attractions to explore in Agra, and Shah Jahan built this Masjid during 1631-1640 AD for the royal ladies. Located in Agra Fort, Rakabanj, Agra, it is a private mosque that was constructed using white marble with decent decoration and astute architecture. Also, this beautiful mosque is characterized by wonderful domes and praiseworthy arches.

name: 4. Diwan-I-Khas
info: Located in Musamman Burj, SH 62, Agra Fort, Rakabganj, Agra, UP, Diwan-I-Khas is another attraction to explore in the city that was built by Shah Jahan in 1635. It is a private section where Shah Jahan met with important and special guests such as kings, nobles, and ambassadors and was also known as The Iwan-I-Khas. It is placed behind Macchi Bhawan. The popular Takht-I-Taus (Peacock Throne) was kept here before it was relocated to Red Fort in Delhi. One can spot Persian inscriptions within the black stones in the hall.

name: 5. Khas Mahal
info: As the name implies, Khas Mahal was a site erected by the king for his daughters Jahanara and Roshnara and was placed at Agra Fort, Rakabganj, Agra. The ceilings of the mahal are heavily embellished, and wall niches are a perfect treat to one's eyes. In addition, Khas Mahal is edged by Anguri Bagh on one side and Yamuna River on another. One must wander around the site and soak in the magnificent architectonics and captivating views.

name: 6. Diwan-I-Aam
info: As the name says, Diwan-I-Aam used to be the site where public gatherings and general meetings were conducted. Shah Jahan built this site during 1631-40, and it was a place where he used to hear the complaints of common people. The huge hall was originally erected in red sandstone and is partitioned into three sections. The king's throne was separated from the attendants using golden railing in the forepart and silver on the remaining three sites. The pomp where the king addressed the listeners was known as Jharokha Darshan.

name: 7. Machhi Bhawan
info: Located in Agra Fort, Rakabganj, Agra is a site built by Shah Jahan and is placed opposite to Diwan-I-Aam. It is a double-storeyed complex flanked by a lush garden and is characterized by domed galleries. It was embellished with fountains and marble tanks where silver and gold fishes were kept, and this is a reason it was also named Machi Bhawan. This site was Shah Jahan's golden throne that allowed him to have a complete view of the court.

name: 8. Anguri Bagh
info: Anguri Bagh is among the tourist attractions in Agra that is placed on the premises of Agra Fort and was erected by Shah Jahan. The luxuriant gardens were built in 1637 so that in the evening, the emperor could take a leisure walk in the garden. The garden is made in Charbagh style, depicted by four partitions and complex geometrical patterns. The juiciest grapes in those times used to grow in this garden were brought into use for making wine for the king.

name: 9. Akbar's Tomb
info: Located in the great area of the Sikandra region of Agra, Akbar's tomb is the place where the immortal remains of the great emperor Akbar are placed, and this tomb was built-in 1605-1613. Akbar himself ordered the construction of the tomb, and its construction began when he was alive. Even though Aurangzeb's army looted all the jewels, silver, gold and other precious metals and items from the Akbar's tomb during Aurangzeb's reign, this place is still counted among the most beautiful tourist places in Agra. There is one southern way in the tomb, which leads to a huge garden (which is constructed in Charbagh style), and one can enter this tomb through this way.

name: 10. Chini ka Rauza
info: If one is planning a visit to Itimad-ud-Daulah Tomb, one should not miss the chance to visit Chini ka Rauza. Chini ka Rauza, one of the best places to see in Agra, is positioned in the Katra Wazir Khan region of Agra. During Jahangir's reign, Allama Afzal Khan Mullah was a famous poet and Persian scholar; later, he was promoted to Wazir, and this Chini ka Rauza (his tomb) was dedicated to him. This tomb is a perfect example of the Indo-Persian architecture model, built-in 1635 AD. The structure of this tomb is glazed with tile works, and its central chamber is in an octagonal shape.

name: 11. Taj Mahal
info: Located in the Dharampuri area of the Forest Colony, Tajganj, the Taj Mahal is not only one of the most beautiful and popular tourist places in Agra, but it is one of the most famous buildings in India. Included in the seven wonders of the world, the Taj Mahal is a perfect showpiece of Mughal Architecture of that time. The exteriors, as well as the interior edifice of this building, are specifically designed with white marble only. The interior chamber of the Taj Mahal is inlaid with precious gems, and the shape of this chamber is like an octagon. The exterior gardens of the Taj Mahal, which are flush with fresh air and greenery, perfectly complement the beauty of this monument. The construction of the Taj Mahal began under the orders of Emperor Shah Jahan, who dedicated this to his late wife Arjumand Bano Begum, and its construction was completed in 18 years (1631-48).

name: 12. Traditional Bazars
info: A tour of Agra is incomplete without visiting the traditional bazars and without shopping in the numerous remote shopping areas of the city. Sadar Bazar, Raja ki Mandi, Kinari Bazar, Shubash Bazar, and many other popular bazars are included in the traditional bazars of the city, and these traditional bazars are home to a large variety of souvenirs, extinct handicrafts, and rare artefacts. Among all the traditional bazars of Agra, Sadar Bazar is the most popular and stand-out market, and it is one of the best places in Agra where one can visit in the evening time.

name: 13. Mehtab Bagh
info: Mehtab Bagh is located near the Taj Mahal, Dharmapuri, Forest Colony, Nagle Devjit, Agra and was built by Babur in early 1500s. It is positioned on the River Yamuna's Bank and is a square-shaped complex, and is in perfect sync with the Taj Mahal on the opposite shore of the river Yamuna. It is a famous spot for photographers to capture a striking view of the sunset. This place remains flocked by visitors throughout the year and is one of the top sites to explore in the city. This breathtaking garden sports four towers just at each edge of an octennial tank. The Taj Mahal's reflection in the tank, especially on full moon nights, is easy on the eyes. The garden owns fruit-bearing trees, medicinal herbs and blooming flower plants. With a layout of 4 gardens, it is an ideal symbol of Mughal architecture. The huge water tank placed on the east of the structure ensures that the entire area is adequately irrigated.

name: 14. Agra Red Fort
info: Agra Red Fort, a UNESCO world heritage monument, stands as a splendid honour of the bygone times of the Mughal Empire. In the year 1556, this fort was erected by Emperor Akbar; later, in 1573, it was renovated with red sandstone. At a distance of 2.2 km from Agra, the fort is a perfect fortress, surrounded by 70 feet-high compound walls from all sides.

name: 15. Fatehpur Sikri
info: Fatehpur Sikri, which has been the erstwhile capital city for many Mughals Emperors, including some popular ones, like Akbar, is one of the must-visit destinations of Agra, and it has always remained a historical town for the district Agra. The original name of this town was Sikri, which was a decrepit village before being the capital city of the Mughal Emperor, and only when Akbar got victory over Gujrat in the year 1573 it was named as its present name in commemoration of the victory.

name: 16. Jama Masjid
info: Jama Masjid, even though a religious monument, is one of the notable and most popular tourist places in Agra, and it is popularly known for its architectural richness and also for its astounding loftiness, which appeals to everybody. Positioned at the Jama Masjid Road of Subash Bazar, Jama Masjid can easily accommodate up to 25,000 people to pray at a time, and it is a four-minaret Masjid. Agra Red Fort is positioned in the eastern direction of this Masjid, which has three gateways, and both this monument gives a very beautiful and magnificent look to the visitors. Jama Masjid is a world heritage site, and it has a stunning tapestry, imposing archways, and a lofty dome lends in Redstone, giving an aura to this place.

name: 1. Heritage Transport Museum
info: The Heritage Transport Museum, located in Tauru near Manesar, Gurgaon, is India's First Transport Museum. The museum covers the history of the evolution of human mobility. There is a vast display of all modes of transportation from the British era to the present day. The museum is open Tuesday through Sunday from 10 a.m. to 7 p.m.

name: 2. Kingdom of Dreams
info: The Kingdom of Dreams was the country's first live entertainment and theatre facility. The Kingdom of Dreams, or KOD, is a popular tourist destination in Gurgaon. You can learn about India's rich cultural heritage, crafts, and cuisines by visiting this location. Among the numerous significant attractions here, the Nautanki Mahal and Shosha Theater are two places to see great shows.

name: 3. Fun N Food
info: Fun and Food Village is an entertainment park that features the Lazy River, the world's longest water channel (400 feet). It is an excellent choice for a day excursion for children and adults. It is open all year, except during the significant Hindu festival holiday of Diwali etc., and may be visited between 9.30 a.m. and 6.30 p.m. It has activities for schoolchildren, corporate personnel, and college students.

name: 4. DLF Cyber Hub
info: One of the most interesting sites to visit in Gurgaon is the Cyber Hub. It is a vast retail space featuring a variety of shopping locations and high-end cafes. Other attractions include Smash and numerous other pubs. There are several family-friendly attractions that you may take your children to.

name: 5. Ambience Mall
info: Ambience Mall is one of Gurgaon's greatest shopping malls, drawing people of all ages. Ambience Mall in Gurgaon is a shopping sanctuary for anyone who enjoys the great outdoors. You could spend all day exploring here. Several alternatives are available to you, ranging from national to worldwide brands.

name: 6. The Paintball Company
info: If you're looking for fun places in Gurgaon for youngsters, Paintball Company is one of them. Paintball is the fastest-growing sport in which players work together to destroy their opponents. This location is recommended for families looking to have some fun while providing their children with plenty of space for various explorations.

name: 7. Leisure Valley Park
info: Leisure Valley Park is a lovely urban park with fountains and melodic water performances. It has a lovely rose garden and is popular for picnics. It is situated in Gurugram's Sector 29. It is open seven days a week and closes at 9 p.m.

name: 8. Camp Tikkling
info: Camp Tikkaling is a village and adventure camp on the outskirts of Gurgaon. Rappelling, zip-lining, trekking, rappelling on natural rocks, jumping, paintball, paramotoring, and other activities are available here. Schoolchildren, corporate clients, and adventure seekers all visit the camp.

name: 9. Smaaash
info: Smaaash in Sector 29, Gurgaon, is a great place to visit if you enjoy gaming. It is an excellent entertainment location where you may engage in various sports such as sky karting, go-karting, cricket, etc. Birthday parties, team-building activities, and even corporate parties are conducted here.

name: 10. Vintage Camera Museum
info: If you want to learn more about the history of museums, go to the Vintage Camera Museum in DLF Phase 3. This location is also known as Museo Camera. It features a significant collection of cameras accumulated over 100 years. You will appreciate this site if you enjoy photography. The museum houses personal camera collections of well-known photographer Aditya Arya. People usually come here to learn more about photography.

name: 11. Appu Ghar
info: Appu Ghar is one of India's first and most popular amusement parks. It has about 15 rides and a banquet seating capacity of around 2000 people. It is home to the country's fastest, highest, and fastest water rides, which attract people of all ages and children, with a 10-acre property in a fantastic position near HUDA City Metro Station. The cost of a ticket varies based on the day and age. That's all it takes to be pleased by the world of water splashes.

name: 12. Lohagarh Farms
info: Lohagarh Farm is a popular outdoor destination for corporate and family outings. You can do things like take a mud bath and bathe under a tube well at this location. This farm brings back memories of people's childhoods and village life. This location is popular with friends and couples and with families and children. You and your family may participate in various indoor and outdoor activities. Evenings here are filled with folk music and dancing performances. A full-day tour costs Rs 1150 for adults and Rs 650 for youngsters.

name: 13. Damdama Lake
info: This lake is a beautiful lake located about 25 kilometres from Gurgaon. This lake was built to store water and is located in a lush green environment. This Damdama Lake currently serves as a habitat for over 200 bird species. This Damdama Lake, located away from the hustle and bustle of the city, is a great place to spend quality time with your family or friends.

name: 14. Pataudi Palace
info: The Pataudi Palace in Gurgaon is also a popular tourist destination. Let us tell you that this palace is also known as Ibrahim Kothi and is associated with the royal family. This palace, which covers an area of more than 25 acres, features stunning gardens, lawns, and fountains; it is a kind of romantic destination for couples in Gurgaon. In such a case, if you want to enjoy roaming in royal style, you should come here. You will require permission to enter this palace.

name: 15. Sultanpur Bird Sanctuary
info: It is a national park which is located in Farukh Nagar, 15 km from Gurgaon. It is a beautiful lush green place full of trees, shrubs etc., and you can watch the wildlife from a safe distance. You can watch different varieties of birds from their four watch towers located at different points. There are all the important facilities for the visitors, and there is also a tourist complex built in the park.

name: 16. Aravalli Biodiversity Park
info: Biodiversity Park of Aravalli contains over 170 bird and animal species and 160 plant species. The Aravalli Biodiversity Park covers 1.54 square kilometres and is located 21 kilometres from the city centre of Gurgaon. It is one of the most interesting places to visit in Gurgaon. The Aravalli Biodiversity Park was created to restore and preserve the desert's vegetation ecologically. The park opened on World Environment Day in June 2010, after the Supreme Court banned stone mining in the area.

name: 17. Digambar Temple
info: The Digambar Temple in Gurgaon is a Jain temple constructed during the Mughal era. This temple was constructed in the 17th century. This temple is also well-known for its tranquil atmosphere. This temple is dedicated to Lord Mahavir, the 24th Tirthankara of the Jains. There is a bookstore within the temple grounds to see many artefacts and study materials related to Jainism.

name: 18. Sheetla Mata Temple in Gurgaon
info: In Hindu mythology, Mata Sheetla is a widely worshipped goddess in North India, West Bengal, Nepal, and Bangladesh. Sheetla Mata Temple is well-known for its festival in the Hindu month of Chaitra.

name: How to Reach Gurgaon
info: The closest airport to Gurgaon is in Delhi. It is also easily accessible from nearby major cities to Gurgaon. Gurgaon has its railway station, which is well connected to India's major cities. Gurgaon is also served by a metro system connecting it to other Delhi parts, including Noida and Faridabad.

name: Local Food in Gurgaon
info: As a centre of industry, commerce, and tourism, Gurgaon has an amazing array of food options. Delicious food from India and worldwide and North Indian food culture are readily available in the dhabas, restaurants, and streets. Gurgaon has some delicious North Indian dishes that you should try. You can sample a variety of parathas, chicken, mince, delicious pulses, and egg dishes here.

name: Best Time to Visit Gurgaon
info: Summers in Gurgaon are extremely hot, making it difficult to venture out into the sun. After September, the temperature in this city drops significantly, and the weather remains pleasant until December. After September to December, February and March are ideal months to visit Gurgaon. You should avoid visiting this city in January because the weather is extremely cold and severe.

name: 1. Marmalade Waterfalls:
info: The Marmalade Waterfalls, which are only a few miles from Erattupetta and exactly 8 kilometres from Jeekoy, are the ideal destination for adventure. The mesmerizing beauty of the waterfalls gives the difficult and exhausting trek there rewarding.

name: 2. Taj Juma Masjid:
info: On the banks of the Meenachil river sits this 1,000-Year-old mosque, which claims to be the oldest mosque in Kerala. The mosque is renowned for its countless examples of historical and cultural elegance.

name: 3. Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary:
info: The Kumarakom bird sanctuary, gorgeously situated by the Vembanad Lake's shores, is home to a wide variety of rare, colourful, and beautiful bird species. Visitors may relax on the 14-acre area of lush, beautiful green meadows and enjoy the colourful birds in flight. This paradise for birdwatchers displays its various avifauna species and attracts wildlife enthusiasts from all over the world. Couples on their honeymoon, those who like picnics, and tourists and visitors looking for a quiet place to rest and relax may find joy at the sanctuary.

name: 4. Mozart Art Gallery:
info: Art lovers and fans should attend this well-kept private art gallery in Aymanam as a getaway. This gallery offers a platform for artists from all regions of the world to view examples of modern and vintage paintings, drawings, and other works of art and learn about the processes and techniques used in painting and sketching.

name: 5. Elaveezha Poonchira:
info: Do you want to go on a hiking or trekking excursion where you may enjoy the attraction of the floral scent? Then you have to go to the ElaveezhaPoonchira. This valley, situated between three majestic hillocks, provides an incredible view of the city from its apex. Additionally, it provides a breathtakingly lovely and stunning view of the sunset.

name: 6. Mary Orthodox Church:
info: This 440-year-old church, also known as Kottayam Cheriapali, is in the centre of Kottayam city. Devotees and pilgrims would be fascinated by the church's combination of Kerala and Portuguese architectural styles, its excellent architectural framework, delightful paintings, and lovely murals. The European architectural style has long been a tourist attraction since it is adorned with pillars, pediments, cornices, and galleries.

name: 7. Monroe Lighthouse:
info: The Monroe Lighthouse has established itself as a major tourist destination in Kottayam, surrounded by attractive waterways, islands, and lakes.

name: 8. Vaikom:
info: Tourists wishing to escape the rush of city life will find Viacom an outstanding destination. It is cool, peaceful, and lonely.

name: 9. Bay Island Driftwood Museum:
info: This well-known museum in Kumarakom offers a large collection of fine driftwood items with exceptional aesthetic value created using a unique and creative modern art technique.

name: 10. Illikkal Kallu:
info: The sunrise and sunset views from one of Kottayam's highest peaks are beautiful.

name: 11. Nadukani:
info: Nadukani, surrounded by heavily forested hills, provides its tourists with the best in natural beauty.

name: 12. Nattakom And Panachikkad:
info: Nattakom and Panachikkad, two independent villages located a few kilometres from the city, are well recognized for their serenity and peacefulness.

name: 13. Thangal Para:
info: Thangal Para is surrounded by a treasure of unbelievable natural beauty, including lush green hills covered with forest, beautiful waterfalls, and clear, shining rivers. The Thangal hills, only 5 kilometres from Vegamon, are a significant Muslim pilgrimage destination and frequented hundreds of worshipers, particularly during the Urs festival.

name: 14. Vembanad Lake:
info: Vembanad Lake is India's largest lake. This rapidly growing backwater tourism destination is one of the greatest places for picnickers to sit and enjoy the mesmerizing beauty of Kottayam's rivers and canals emptying into one body.

name: 15. Poonjar Palace:
info: The Poonjar Palace showcases the splendor of royal wealth, elegance, a beautiful collection of artifacts, exotic furniture (including a palanquin and a thoni), jewel boxes, lamps, Nataraja sculptures, enormous chandeliers, statues, and weaponry. Also accessible to visitors is the palace's unique sofa, which is only brought out for ceremonies once a year. This palace's walls, which have sculptures of battle scenes from the Puranas (an old Indian tale), and its closeness to the identical replica of the Madurai Meenakshi temple add to its magnificence. The Chuttuvilakku (rows of lights) sculptures on the stone walls of the Sastha Temple nearby the palace are worth seeing because it's rare to see such lamp rock sculptures in India.

name: 1. Calangute Beach
info: Calangute Beach, located 15 kilometres from Panjim, is North Goa's longest beach, stretching from Candolim to Baga. Due to its size and significance, it draws visitors from all over the world. At Calangute Beach, water activities such as parasailing, water surfing, and jet skiing are popular. Calangute Beach is well-known for its vibrant nightlife, with a variety of entertainment late at night. Tio Tilly's Bar and Kitchen, Carvalho's, and Spice is among the city's most renowned nightlife spots.

name: 2. Fort Aguada
info: Fort Aguada is a Portuguese fort from the 17th century located near the confluence of the Mandovi River and the Arabian Sea. The fort was built in 1864 and is Asia's oldest lighthouse. The major attraction of the fort is a four-story lighthouse with a spectacular sunset outlook. Fort Aguada also housed the Aguada Prison. A statue honouring the independence warriors has been built in front of the prison cell, adding a patriotic touch to the fort.

name: 3. Baga Beach
info: Baga Beach is one of North Goa's most popular beaches. It is adjacent to Calangute Beach and around 30 kilometres from Panjim. Baga Beach is well known for its vibrant nightlife, which provides lots of entertainment until late at night. If you want tattoos, there are several tattoo parlours here. There are also several entertainment options such as palm shops, spas, sun decks, and a variety of famous shacks where you can spend time with your friends or family. Cafe Mambos and Club Titos are two of the city's most prominent nightlife establishments. Mackie Night Bazaar is the most popular place to purchase clothing, toys, and trinkets. Spend the day with meals and drinks, listen to music, and attend live dramatic performances. The beach is 16 kilometres from Panjim; therefore, a cab is a smart alternative if you want to get to Baga Beach from Panjim.

name: 4. Dudhsagar Falls
info: Mollem National Park has magnificent Dudhsagar Falls on the Goa-Karnataka border, roughly 60 kilometres from Panaji. Most visitors arrive at Dudhsagar Falls via jeep or personal transport from Panaji and from the neighbouring districts. The monsoon season is the greatest time to see Dudhsagar Falls since the surrounding deciduous trees are at their most beautiful. Dudhsagar Falls can also be reached by walking, which you can start near Kuveshi village. This waterfall draws visitors who come to admire its majesty, and it is regarded as one of India's highest waterfalls.

name: 5. Divar Island
info: The Divar Island, or Divaade Island, is situated in a deep forest in the middle of the sea and attracts travellers from all over the world in nature's splendour. Divar Island is located 10 kilometres from Goa's Panjim town. It is only accessible from Old Goa by boat service, so if you are searching for a tranquil area to visit, this island is ideal. If you visit Divar Island, you should try the local cuisine 'Urak,' a lighter version of Cashew Feni.

name: 6. Anjuna Beach
info: Anjuna Beach, located 21 kilometres from Panjim and 11 kilometres from Mapusa, is the most popular beach in North Goa. Anjuna Beach is well-known worldwide for its golden sands, watersports, nightclubs, and full moon parties. If you are considering a trip to Anjuna, some of the most popular adventure sports are jet-skiing, parasailing, bumpy rides, water scooters, paragliding, etc.

name: 7. Basilica of Bom Jesus
info: UNESCO has designated the Basilica of Bom Jesus as a World Heritage Site. The church is at Banguinim, Old Goa, about 10 kilometres from Panjim. The remains of St. Francis Xavier, a close colleague of St. Ignatius Loyola, with whom he established the Society of Jesus, are housed here in Goa's oldest church. The Basilica's floor is built of marble mosaic with beautiful stones, giving it a sad appearance.

name: 8. Chapora Fort
info: Chapora Fort, located 10 kilometres from Mapusa, is one of Goa's most famous forts. The Portuguese constructed the massive and magnificent Chapora Fort in 1717. The fort was originally known as Shahpura and was erected by the Muslim monarch Adil Shah. The Portuguese reconstructed the fort and called it Chapora Fort after the Chapora River.

name: 9. Palolem Beach
info: Palolem Beach is 38 kilometres from Margao in Canacona and is the most popular tourist attraction in Goa. Palolem Beach is well-known for its calm atmosphere. Palolem Beach is ideal for spending your nights dancing to the pulse of the music. Palolem beach has a beautiful night view of the beach, and people are dancing and partying. You may take a bus from Madgaon Bus Stand to Canacona to go to Palolem Beach. After arriving at Canacona Bus Station, take a cab to Palolem Beach.

name: 10. Dona Paula
info: Lover's Paradise is another name for Dona Paula Beach. Dona Paula is a prominent tourist destination in Goa known for its long stretch of beach. Dona Paula is also a famous filming location; some of Bollywood's biggest films have been shot here. Visitors from all over the world come to see the panoramic view from Dona Paula View Point. As you walk down the beach, a soft wind brushes your face.

name: 11. Arambol Beach
info: Arambol Beach is one of North Goa's greatest beaches. This beach draws visitors from all around the world. Arambol Beach is a rocky, sandy beach bounded on one end by a forest and the other by the sea. Arambol Beach is around 30 kilometres away from Anjuna Beach. The ideal time to visit Arambol Beach is between November and March. It is also the peak season for overseas beach holidaymakers. It is one of Goa's most famous tourist spots. Bring your swimming suit, sunscreen lotion, and sunglasses if you visit Arambol Beach.

name: 12. Sinquerim Beach
info: This beach is located in North Goa, close to Baga Beach. There are several nightclubs around this Sinquarium Beach. If you enjoy going to clubs, you will enjoy this beach. Otherwise, you will love this beach if you enjoy water sports such as water skiing, dolphin fishing, scuba diving, parasailing, windsurfing, and so on because you can do all these things here.

name: 13. Our Lady of the Immaculate
info: One of Goa's most well-known buildings is Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception Church. This church was constructed in the Portuguese Baroque style. The church houses the famed Augustinian bells, which are thought to be the second biggest of their kind in Goa. The Church of Our Lady was constructed during the period when Portuguese colonists inhabited the region. On December 8, a spectacular celebration is conducted in the Church of Our Lady. A large fair is planned as part of the celebrations on this day. It is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Goa.

name: How to Reach Goa
info: November to February is the greatest season to visit Goa since the weather is perfect for enjoying and relaxing on the beaches. The temperature remains between the range of 15 and 25 degrees during this time. If you love beaches during the rainy season, the months of June to September are ideal for a trip to Goa. We will provide detailed information on Goa's tourist attractions and beaches. If you are coming to Goa, you must see the tourist attractions below.

name: Best time to visit Goa

We will provide detailed information on Goa's tourist attractions and beaches. If you are coming to Goa, you must see the tourist attractions below.

name: 1. Chettikulangara Bhagavathi Temple
info: There are several names for the goddess Bhagavathi, including Bhadrakali and Jagadambika. One of the most well-known temples in Kerala is the Chettikulangara Bhagavathi Temple. This place of worship is devoted to the Hindu deity Sree Bhadrakali, who is worshipped here in a number of her forms. The fascinating aspect of the temple is that a sizeable portion of the offerings presented to the deity is put toward preparing the prasad that is served at Sabarimala. This dish is called "Appams" and "Aravana Payasam."

name: 2. Mandala Beach House and Resorts
info: The cosy Mandala Cottage comprises one bedroom and can sleep up to three guests. This property is ideal for use as a therapeutic gateway because it is located amidst greeneries paddy fields and bordered by palm trees, bamboo, and banana trees.

name: 3. Mary's Forane Church
info: St. Mary's Church, which can trace its roots back to 835 A.D., is a well-known destination among deeply spiritual people. The location is well-known for the many religious gatherings that occur throughout the year, regardless of the season.

name: 4. Alappuzha Beach
info: If you enjoy being at the beach, then the captivating beauty of Alappuzha is something you cannot skip. One of the most well-known beaches in the region, Alappuzha beach is a major draw for visitors to the city of Alappuzha.

name: 5. Kuttanad Backwaters
info: The real charm of Alappuzha may be found in its many bodies of water, but the backwaters of Kuttanad are the ones that have gained the greatest reputation throughout the years. The Kuttanad backwaters, commonly known as the "Rice bowl of Kerala," are considered one of the most attractive tourist destinations in the Alappuzha region. Due to the breathtaking scenery, this is among the most popular tourist destinations in the Alappuzha district.

name: 6. Karumadikkuttan
info: One of the best places to go in Alappuzha to seek the divine blessings of Buddha is a well-known pilgrim centre known for its tranquil atmosphere. Karumadikkuttan is the name of a marble statue of Lord Buddha that can be found in Karumadi, which is not far from Alappuzha. The locals have given it this name because the statue here is dark in colour.

name: 7. Krishnapuram Palace
info: The Krishnapuram Palace is a one-of-a-kind example of the architecture characteristic of the state of Kerala. Its gabled, low roofs and winding corridors make it a fascinating sight. Due to its proximity to the Krishnaswamy Temple and its construction in the traditional style of Kerala, the palace is widely considered the state's most popular tourist destination.

name: 8. Marari Beach
info: Marari Beach is among the best places to visit in Alappuzha for vacations with friends and family because it is beautiful and features golden sands and coconut palm trees. Marari beach will provide an entirely new experience of walking around the stunning and marvellous seashore. The area surrounding Marari Beach is home to several magnificent resorts and hotels renowned for providing exceptional hospitality to tourists. Individuals searching for an escape from the stress and chaos of their everyday lives and who want to be closer to the ocean will find this the ideal destination.

name: 9. Mullakkal Rajarajeswari Temple
info: The Mullakkal Rajarajeswari Temple, also known as the Mullakkal Bhagavathy Temple, is a holy temple included on the list of Places to Visit in Alleppey to increase one's level of spirituality. The worship of the goddess Durga is the primary focus of this particular temple.

name: 10. Vembanad Lake
info: This particular lake is not only the biggest but also the longest of those that can be found in Kerala. When it comes to enjoying backwater tourism in Alappuzha, one of the greatest spots is Vembanad Lake. Vembanad lake, located in the middle of Kerala, is surrounded by mangrove and coconut tree forests. The Vembanad Lake is the largest lake and the only one that never stops flowing since it is fed by a network of smaller lakes that all flow into it at some point.

name: Conclusion
info: In addition to these recommended sights to see in Alleppey, the city is also famous for its houseboats and backwaters. Alappuzha is just the image that one would like to have in front of his eyes at all times. This magnificent town is a sight to see and is deserving of one's awe and respect. There are a greater number of churches and temples. November to March is ideal for travel to Alappuzha because of the pleasant weather.

name: 1. Ajanta Caves
info: Ajanta Caves is one of the most prominent names when you search for spots to visit in Aurangabad. These caves are made of limestone and comprise around 30 Buddhist caves. They date back to the 2nd Century and are considered the epitome of ancient Indian architecture. They are considered a masterpiece of Buddhist religious art. Ajanta Caves was designated as UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1983. It is further divided into different caves that are meant for different purposes. The murals, paintings, and carvings inside these caves reveal many secrets about past cultures and traditions. It is evident from the cave's architecture and shape that ancient Buddhist monks used the caves for study, living, and worship.

name: 2. Bibi Ka Maqbara
info: Taj Mahal is considered the supreme symbol of love, but Bibi Ka Maqbara is sure to come next. It is one of the most famous historical places you must see while you are in Aurangabad. Although not as well-known and popular as the Taj Mahal, this historical monument is emblematic of the love between Aurangzeb, the Mughal Emperor, and Dilras Banu Begum, his beloved wife.

name: 3. Ellora Caves
info: Ellora Caves, another architectural gem from a bygone age, is another place to see near Aurangabad. This series of caves are located at a distance of 29 kilometers from the city center. It was constructed by the Rashtrakuta Dynasty of Buddhist clans and the Yadav Group of Jains.

name: 4. Grishneshwar Temple
info: A significant pilgrimage site for Hindus, this ancient temple is known as the Grihneshwar temple. It is a shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva and is believed to be one of the 12 'Jyotirlingas' in India, considered extremely auspicious and sacred. Located around 30 kilometers from Aurangabad, this pious destination is not very far from Ellora Caves. The calmness of this place cannot be described; it can only be witnessed upon visiting it.

name: 5. Daulatabad Fort
info: Daultabad Fort is also known as Devagiri Fort and is located in Devagiri, Aurangabad, Maharashtra. It is around 16 kilometers northwest of Aurangabad. This fort symbolizes victory. It was built in 1187 by Bhillama V, the first Yadava King. Later, it was annexed by the Khalji dynasty in 1308 and the Tughlaq dynasty in 1327. The fort is constructed on a conical hill at an elevation of 200 meters, surrounded by a moat filled with water, with crocodiles protecting it from enemy attacks.

name: 6. Chhatrapati Shivaji Museum
info: One of the top places to go to in Aurangabad is the Chhatrapati Shivaji Museum, dedicated to the legendary, fearless Maratha fighter Chhatrapati Shivaji's history and contributions. A tour of this museum will help you understand the fascinating history of the Marathas. The museum houses six rooms for exhibitions in which a myriad of historical items is displayed. Take the time to relive the past by looking through the collection of old war weapons such as old sword shields, rifles, and other objects used in the battle against the Mughals. The galleries also display older photos of the forts Shivaji conquered and constructed during his time. Other attractions include the copy of the sacred Quran written by Aurangzeb; the war suit dates to the period 500 years ago, Paithani Saree, which is 400 years old; and many more.

name: 7. Salim Ali Lake
info: Suppose you are looking for tranquil places with beautiful scenery in contrast to bustling markets and touristy locations. In that case, Salim Ali Lake counts among the most popular tourist spots in Aurangabad for those who want to relax. Surrounded by lush greenery, the picturesque lake is, due to its tranquillity, a paradise for a nature-lover that allows one to enjoy the uninterrupted sounds of Nature.

name: 8. Pitalkhora Caves
info: The caves date back to the 3rd Century BCE. The stunning Pitalkhora Caves have been made of rock, making them one of the most impressive examples of rock-cut architecture in India. They comprise 14 old Buddhist caves situated in the lap of Western Ghats right next to a gushing waterfall that lends the place an aesthetic vibe and enhances its charm. Monks would pray in the Chaityas or Viharas, which are two sub-categories of caves. This site is now looked after by The Archaeological Survey of India and depicts various motifs, buildings, paintings, and more from the past.

name: 9. Bhadra Maruti Temple
info: This temple is thronged with devotees of the Hindu God, Lord Hanuman, who come from across the nation. This temple is situated in Khuldabad, four kilometers from Ellora caves. Folklore tells us that this place was previously ruled by King Bhadrasena and was, therefore, known as Bhadravati. After hearing the king sing a devotional for Lord Rama, Lord Hanuman came and became so happy that he slept over there. He blessed this place which was made into a temple, after that. Lord Hanuman's idol is placed in a sleeping position because of the incident. This place is charismatic, serene, and a must-visit in Aurangabad.

name: 10. Siddharth Garden and Zoo
info: If you want to spend a day amidst Nature to calm yourself or have a family day out, Sidharth Garden and Zoo should be your pick. This place is always teeming with beautiful flowering plants, a variety of trees, and an aquarium. The presence of the Zoo is like the cherry on top, making this place a great spot for tourists and locals.

name: 11. Jayakwadi Dam
info: Another must-see Aurangabad tourist attraction is the intriguing Jayakwadi Dam. It is regarded as one of Maharashtra's largest dams and one of the biggest earthen dams in Asia. It is primarily used for irrigation purposes and secondarily for agricultural reasons in the Marathwada area, which is mostly a region that suffers from drought. While visiting Jayakwadi Dam, don't forget to pay a visit to the Jayakwadi Bird Sanctuary. Comprising 30 tiny islands carved by Nath Sagar, it serves as one of the prominent tourist destinations close to Aurangabad.

name: 12. Bani Begum Garden
info: Bani Begum Garden is one of the best spots to visit in Aurangabad. The garden was named in honor of Bani Begum, Aurangzeb's daughter-in-law. Her tomb is situated in the middle of the garden. Alongside the tranquil atmosphere that is created by green grass, swaying trees, and stunning fountains, this site showcases examples of fine Mughal architecture, with gracefully built pillars and domes. These places not only make you aware of the history of the Mughal Emperor, Aurangzeb but also provides a serene atmosphere to spend a relaxing day away from work.

name: 13. Lonar Crater Lake
info: The Lonar Crater Lake is located in the Buldhana district in Maharashtra, about 3 kilometers from Aurangabad, and is one of the top places to visit near the city. This lake is of interest to various archaeologists, geologists, natural scientists, astronomers, and curious individuals because of the source of the formation of this lake. The lake was formed because of the collision of a meteor which is believed to be the biggest ever recorded.

name: 14. Goga Baba Hill
info: This one is for adventure lovers. If you're someone who has a zeal for hiking, then you've got your spot! Goga Baba Hill provides you with a breathtaking view of Aurangabad city. You can reach the top after a short hike. It is extremely popular among hikers, photographers, nature lovers, and devotees. You can pay reverence to the Lord at the temple located on the outskirts of Goga Baba Hill and in a small temple on the highest point of the hill. Take a moment to be in the lap of nature and relish the tranquillity around you.
