name: 1. Vishwa Shanti Stupa
info: Vishwa Shanti Stupa or also known as Japanese Stupa, is 8 km away from the Railway station of Rajgir. It is created on the hill of Ratnagiri (much more popular than Griddhakuta) and is one of the seven Peace Pagodas (Shanti Stupas in Hindi) and also one of the most popular tourist places in Rajgir.

name: 2. Rajgir Glass bridge
info: A stunning glass bridge is increasing the beauty of Rajgir and it is a must visit place if you are in the city. It is just 10 km away from the Rajgir Railway Station and 6 Km away from the Rajgir Wildlife Safari. The main purpose behind the construction of the bridge is to give a viweing platform to the place. The Bridge is located inside the Nature Safari Park, and no one should ever miss it during the tour to Rajgir.

name: 3. Rajgir Wildlife Safari
info: Just 4 km Away from the Railway station, the Rajgiri Zoo Safariis one of the most beautiful places there. It is located near the Maniyar Math (a tourist place itself) in Rajgir, Bihar. Someone who loves to visit wildlife and safaris should include in the trip. Covered by the mountains of Vaibhgiri and Songiri, it is adjacent to the popular Pant Wildlife Sanctuary in the last of the Jethian Hills. It was created in the year 2017 by order of Chief Minister Mr. Nitish Kumar and, in 2022, got permission to let nearby 1000 visitors come in daily.The Foundation of Zoo Safari wasn't easy at all. Still, with the contribution of the various departments (such as Environment, Forest, and climate change) of the Bihar state government, it was completed at the cost of 177 Crore Indian Rupees. Now it has various animals, tigers, lions, leopards, elephants, and many other animals, and is divided into five different and massive zones. There is also a butterfly park, an interpretation center, a gallery for orientation, and an amphitheater in the park. It also offers a management section for proper care at the park.

name: 4. Venuvana
info: A magic monument of history, Venuvana was created by Bimbisar, who was one of the strongest emperors of the Magadha Emperor.He built it after coming under the influence of the Lord Buddha. It consists of artificial forests and a space to meditate and get inner peace, and this is also the place where Buddha used to meditate and teach his people with the premises.

name: 5. Pandu Pokhara
info: Another beautiful monument of history from the time of Mahabharata, Pandu Pokhara, is spread across 22 acres in the town. According to the Historical stories, King Pandu (father of Pandavas) attacked the Rajgriha (currently known as Rajgir). After winning, he created a more stable pond which was later filled up with rainwater and converted into the Pandu Pokhara. Later the area was turned into a very beautiful entertainment park to take part in various outdoor activities such as bull riding, horse riding, bungee jumping, and ziplines. Trampoline, boating, for both kids and adults. You also get a huge space to play games like cricket, volleyball, badminton and even basketball. People who love selfies and want to take pictures of these beautiful natural places can take pictures at the selfie point. People who don't prefer outdoor games also get a chance to play indoor games like table tennis, Pool Table, Air Hockey, Table Soccer, and Carro. So people who don't want to miss the sporty atmosphere should pay a visit to Pandu Pokhara sometime to play games here.

name: 6. Ajatshatru fort
info: This historical tourist place is just 2 km away from the Railway Station of Rajgir, and it is situated in the Bangali Para area of Rajgir town in Bihar. And also is one of the most precious and ancient places in the entire Bihar. It was built in the 6th century when king Ajatshatru was the ruler of the Magadha (modern-day part of Bihar), and it has completed more than 2500 years.This fort is also believed to be one of the most excellent forts ever created in the country.

name: 7. Pant Wildlife Sanctuary
info: Rajgir is full of nature, and this is why another beautiful wildlife sanctuary known as Pant Wildlife Sanctuary is also a tourist attraction in the town. It is inside the Nalanda Forest and nearby the heart-melting Rajgiri hills (located in the Gangetic plain) with a variety of various flowers and greenery of nature which gives you a chance to enjoy a beautiful landscape ecosystem.

name: 8. Saptaparni Caves
info: A very beautiful Saptaparni Caves, also popular as the Saptaparni Guha or the Sattapanni Guha, which means the seven leave the cave and is a place which is known as the place where Buddha used to live before he died. It is also believed to be the area where the first Buddha Council was held after his death.

name: 9. Bimbisara Jail
info: When the Ajatshatru became the emperor after his dad, he built a jail for his father and kept him there inside the Ajatshatru fort. This jail is a very important part of history as the king was imprisoned just because Ajatshatru wanted to usurp the throne, and he was also moved to the small room nearby Lord Buddha (who was living in the fort at that time) in his last days to listen to his values and see him. This jail is created with stone pillars and huge walls near the Maniyar Math. You can also admire the beauty of Indian History and see the panoramic view of the Japanese Peace Pagoda at the peak of the hill.

name: 10. Brahma Kund (Rajgir Hot spring)
info: Hot springs are not easily available in the country. But only 3 km away from the Railway Station of Rajgir, there is Rajgir Hot Springs which are full of the natural Holi water in Rajgir, Bihar.  This kund is located nearby Pandu Pokhara and is also known as the pilgrimage place in Rajgir with hot water. These beautiful water springs are situated at the end of Vaibhava Hills and can win your heart in seconds with their beauty.

name: 11. Cyclopean wall
info: A huge wall in Bihar, The Cyclopean Wall, is 40 kilometers long, completely created by stone and covering the whole Rajgir. It is a beautiful and antique example of beautiful cyclopean masonry, which was spread all over the world.This wall was created by Jarasandh, who was the second ruler of the Brihadratha or Rawani dynasty, to secure the city from enemies and imposters.

name: 12. Veerayatan Museum
info: One of the best tourist places in the Rajgir is the Veerayatan Museum which was started in 1982. People also call this Museum as Kala Mandir. This Museum is devoted to Jainism and displays many handmade artifacts that illustrate the teachings and lifestyles of the 24 Jain Tirthankaras. The museum is situated in the Vaibhav Giri, which gives it a very tranquil and calm ambiance.

name: 13. Ghora Katora Lake
info: In the vicinity of Rajgir, there is a beautiful lake called Ghora Katora Lake. According to legend, the Rajgir kings' horses drank water from this lake, giving the lake a horse-like shape. It is close to the World Peace Pagoda and has mountains on three sides. Since private vehicles are not permitted, you must use the conventional "tonga." The trek to this location, which is 6 km from the main road, is incredibly captivating. The name "Horse Bowl" refers to the shape of the Ghora Katora Lake, which is an off-road body of water in Rajgir. This area is well-known for being one of the cleanest tourist attractions, making it a great place for picnics at the Rajgir. Locals also believe that During the time of Mahabharata, king Jarasandha also had his horse stable at this beautiful lake. This beautiful lake has the power to steal your heart at the very first glance of it. The lake is perfect for wandering over and capturing beautiful shots because it appears peaceful. Visitors can spend quality time with their families and find some peace away from the bustle of everyday life by boating here. Winter's first few months are the best time to visit this location.

name: 14. Makhdum Kund
info: Another example of love and unity, the Makhdum or Makhdoom Kund, is a dargah and hot spring created in honor of the Sufi saint Makhdum Shah. People from both Muslim and Hindu religions love to go to this kund because of its sacredness. The saint spent his entire 12-year residence in Rajgir's woodland and frequently went to the kund. The water in the Kund is said never to dry up.

name: 15. Vulture's Peak or Griddhakuta
info: One more really amazing tourist place in Rajgir, Bihar is known as Vulture Peak or well known as the Griddhakuta, is a beautiful pilgrimage place of the Buddha religion.People believe it is one of those three places where Gautama Buddha stayed for several years. The Vulture Peak is located on a minor hill standing outside the Rajgir town and is known as the best sightseeing place with an altitude of 400 m. The reason behind the name "Vulture Peak" is that it has a shape that seems like Vulture, and you can also find so many views of the birds. Due to its beauty and peace, people have believed it to be Buddha's residence for years, and from the peak, you can get a view of 360 degrees of all beautiful places and nature which makes people stay for hours here.

name: 16. Maniyar Math
info: The Maniyar Math, which is located near Swarna Bhandar, is nothing more than a deep well with a small Jain temple placed on top of it. This monument is located near Rajgir's Hot Water Spring. It was recognized as the Nirman Koop of Queen Chalanna and Sheel Bhadra in the history of Jains. In the time of the Buddhist period, it was also used as a Yagna site.

name: 17. Contemporary Nalanda University
info: Nalanda, the most popular Mahavihara of ancient times, a significant Buddhist seat of academic excellence, and a modest pilgrim center, all rolled up in a small piece of spirituality, remains an equally rewarding and fulfilling location today. It has a thriving spirituality, history, culture, architecture, and tourism. It was historically located near the city of Rajagriha (now Rajgir) and about 90 kilometers (56 mi) southeast of Pataliputra (now Patna), operating from 427 to 1197 CE, also recognized in the era of scholars as the "Golden Age of India." It is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: 1. Vallarpadam Church
info: One of Ernakulam's top tourist destinations is the Vallarpadam Church. It also goes by the name Our Lady of Ransom. Mary, Jesus' mother, was lovingly referred to as Vallarpadathamma by the locals. Visitors to this church come not just from the state of Kerala but also other states. In the year 1524, the Portuguese missionaries constructed this church.

name: 2. The Museum of Mattancherry
info: The quaint and traditional suburb of Mattancherry will undoubtedly lure you if you take a stroll through Fort Kochi's streets. According to legend, the street used to be bordered by mutton butchers, which is how it got the name "Mattoncherry," which eventually changed to "Mattancherry." The location now exhibits historic structures and other social and cultural legacies brought by visitors. Mattancherry, which the government designated as a historic site, has served as an inspiration to historians, filmmakers, tourists, and artists alike. This museum is one of the most well-known sights among Ernakulam's tourist attractions.

name: 3. Thattekkad Bird Sanctuary
info: One of Kerala's original bird sanctuaries and a refuge for outdoor enthusiasts. Thattekkad, home to hundreds of various endangered species of migratory birds, has been dubbed "the richest bird sanctuary in India" by Salim Ali, a noted naturalist. This is a deep deciduous forest where you may find mahogany, teak, rosewood, and rubber plantations. The months of November through March would be ideal for travel. Binoculars should be brought along if you want to see the birds.

name: 4. Hill Palace museum
info: While making travel arrangements to Ernakulam, you may visit the renowned Hill Palace Museum. The Hill Palace Museum, widely regarded as Kerala's first historical and largest archaeological museum, draws both local and foreign visitors with its exquisite beauty and excellent design. The Maharaja of Cochin constructed the palace in 1865. This covers a region of around 52 acres. There are roughly 49 structures of Kerala's traditional architecture in this area. There are around 14 types of exhibits at the museum, including crowns, jewelry, weapons, coins, inscriptions, sculptures, etc. The palace serves as a location for Malayalam movie shoots.

name: 5. Cherai Beach
info: There is a beautiful beach in Cherai stretches from Cochin to Vypeen Island. It is roughly 30 kilometers from Kochi International Airport and 25 kilometers from Kochi. This beach is a well-liked vacation spot, particularly for international visitors. Compared to many other beaches in the Ernakulam area, the beach is less crowded and cleaner. This gorgeous beach Cherai has paddy farms, coconut palms, and Chinese fishing nets.

name: 6. Vypeen Island
info: One of the main tourist destinations in Ernakulam for couples is Vypeen Island, which offers a desktop-worthy vista away from the busy surroundings. One of the most well-liked tourist destinations in Ernakulam, Vypeen is unquestionably the most elegant island in Kerala. You can reach this peaceful island, which is filled with beaches, backwaters, and various restaurants and hotels, by taking a quick and beautiful ferry journey from the city.

name: 7. David Hall Art Gallery
info: A Dutch villa in Fort Kochi was rebuilt and transformed into a popular destination for art enthusiasts. The gallery features pieces by well-known and local artists, making it one of the greatest tourist destinations in Ernakulam. While the café is renowned for its fresh and crispy pizzas, visitors will also be happy to discover a peaceful garden restaurant that provides a range of cakes and snacks.

name: 8. Willingdon Island
info: A beautiful artificial island in Kochi's backwaters is called Willingdon Island. The island was developed in 1936 as a component of the current Kochi port's development. To make room for the new port, Vembanad Lake was deepened. Resulting in the creation of the stunning island. The project was commissioned by Lord Willingdon, the Viceroy of India at the time, thus the name Willingdon. The great island now serves as a connection between Kochi and other seaports throughout the globe.

name: 9. Andhkarnajhi Beach
info: Located 4 kilometers from Pattanakkad is a coastal town. The ongoing filming of Malayalam movies at Andhunazhi Beach has increased public awareness of the location. This beach is popular with visitors. While helping seamen navigate nighttime, the large white and red lighthouse grabs attention.

name: 10. Mahatma Gandhi Road
info: The Times Square of Ernakulam might be compared to the Mahatma Gandhi Road. Huge apparel stores, huge jewelry stores, and magnificent restaurants provide a variety of cuisines line both sides of the road. The finest area to enjoy shopping in Kerala is MG Road, which young, trendy people primarily frequent. MG Road is a shopaholic's delight.

name: 11. Santa Cruz Basilica Church
info: The nearby Santa Cruz Basilica Church is definitely worth a visit; it is situated next to St. Francis Church. You may view some lovely images here. This church, which blends Kerala and Portuguese architectural styles, is regarded as the most beautiful and oldest in the city of Ernakulam. Additionally, Ernakulam is a well-known and attractive tourist destination.

name: Local Food in Ernakulam
info: The best variety of sea foods is the main cuisine for Ernakulam residents. Sardines, tuna, mackerel, shark, rays, and even oysters, crab, and mussels are some popular species eaten here. They specialize in creative fish curry dishes, which they often serve over a serving of hot rice.

name: Best time to visit Ernakulam
info: The ideal months to visit Ernakulam are October through February. Although Ernakulam is often fairly hot all year round, the winters are more pleasant. The possibility of temperatures exceeding 30°C at other times of the year might make travel or exploration unpleasant.

name: 1. Raja's Seat:
info: An important historical place. The magnificent garden and historical place known as Raja's Seat is a thing of amazing beauty. The garden in the Coorg neighborhood is well-known for its amazing waterfalls and variety of delicious-looking flowers. This is one of Madikeri's most visited tourist attractions. The garden is filled with many colorful animal sculptures. The location offers some very gorgeous views. Enjoy the tranquility of nature and the lovely sunset.

name: 2. Madikeri Fort:
info: The Madikeri Fort is an amazing piece of architecture and a masterwork of 17th-century architecture. King Mudduraja first constructed the fort in the latter half of the 17th century. Tipu Sultan subsequently acquired the fort and rebuilt it. Additionally, there is a palace there that has been turned into a government building. One of the oldest forts in this area, this shining prince of architecture is still mostly intact and in its original form. A national heritage site designation has been given to the fort. There is also a beautiful elephant statue that attracts people for pictures.

name: 3. Omkareshwara Temple:
info: The Omkareshwara temple is surrounded by a tranquil environment, Purest Spirituality, and beautiful scenery. In front of the temple is a cute lake where visitors enjoy feeding the fish. Lord Shiva is honoured at this temple. This magnificent temple is a wonderful example of architecture. The temple and its surroundings are exceptionally well kept and are part of a vast structure. A beautiful location for peace and meditation.

name: 4. Abbey Falls:
info: See the Wonder of Nature, and One of the top attractions in Madikeri is Abbey Falls. Many people visit this spectacular, stunning waterfall. This fall's surroundings are kept up beautifully, and nearby parking and restrooms are also easily accessible. The waterfall is beautiful, and the surrounding region is very stunning. Near the waterfall, there is a nice bridge as well. To see this natural wonder, one would have to descend. During the monsoon season, the entire location, including the waterfall, appears rather bizarre. This is a must-see destination close to Madikeri.

name: 5. Raja's Tomb:
info: Take pleasure in the royal architecture. King and royal tombs from the Kodava kingdom are in this unique location. The mausoleum has a highly attractive design and architecture and is located in an enticing landscape. One of Karnataka's most picturesque historical sites, it offers excellent views of the hills. From here, you'll enjoy a beautiful perspective of the Coorg region. The style of the architecture is influenced by Indian beautiful architecture. There are two important tombs in this area, and both were constructed in the first half of the 19th century. If you love history, you must visit this location in Madikeri.

name: 6. Mandalpatti:
info: In The Heart of Nature Due to the breathtaking beauty of the surrounding region, Mandalpatti Hills in Mahadevpet are amazing and mesmerizing. This is a fantastic location because it is right in the middle of nature. The cliffs are draped with evergreen forests that reach the skies. The full view from these cliffs is just stunning. This area occasionally experiences cloudiness and fog, which increases the atmosphere significantly.

name: 7. Government Museum:
info: The museum is a must-see attraction in Madikeri and is located inside the fort. Fascinating relics and old sculptures may be seen throughout this amazing museum. The museum is home to several fascinating statues of old gods and goddesses. This excellent museum has no entrance charge.

name: 8. Kootu Poley Dam:
info: A charming small dam with beautiful scenery is called Kootu Poley Dam. The area around the dam is gorgeous. This is a wonderful location that offers plenty of peace and tranquility away from the bustle of the city. There is a lot of lush greenery and a variety of beautiful flowers in the surrounding areas. The area hasn't seen much development. Thus, its pristine natural beauty has been preserved. Your emotions will be relaxed by the sounds of the water falling and flowing from the little waterfall. One will enjoy spending some nice, peaceful time at this gorgeous tiny location, which is full of the beauty of nature.

name: 9. Shree Kanchi Kamakshi Temple:
info: This little temple may be found in the middle of Madikeri Hill Town, close to Raja's Seat. This temple in the hill town may be the oldest. Goddess Kamakshi, one of the manifestations of Parvati's divinity, is the major focus of the temple. In this area of the nation, the temple is very important religiously. The stunning statue of Goddess Kamakshi in the temple is popular. On Fridays, there is a great rush of visitors to the temple. The yearly religious events held at the temple are also well-known.

name: 10. Mercara Downs Golf Club:
info: A beautiful green space called Mercara Downs Golf Club may be found close to Galibidu town. This is a fantastic attraction, even for those not fans of golf. The golf club has a nice clubhouse where you can relax, have coffee, and munch on your favourite foods while enjoying the expansive natural green beauty. Bird lovers will enjoy this lovely golf course, surrounded by fascinating Coorg hills and a haven for various birds. Golf equipment is not included in the admission fee for non-members, which is 200 INR.

name: 11. Dubare Elephant Camp:
info: This is the ideal location to spend time with lovable giant animals if you enjoy doing so. This elephant camp is one of the most well-known tourist destinations for an unforgettable experience with these animals. You may play with them, observe them, or both while they bathe at one of the nicest locations close to Madikeri. These friendly animals are among the top tourist attractions in Madikeri, and they are well worth your time.

name: 12. Kote Betta:
info: This is one of the main Madikeri tourist attractions, and it is situated in the centre of Coorg, around 30 kilometres from Madikeri. Trekking is encouraged here as you may explore the area's diverse flora and wildlife, flowing rivers, tumbling waterfalls, lush woodlands, and vivid meadows. On the route, you may also go to the Lord Shiva temple and pray for blessings. Enjoy a romantic sunset and a campfire camp.

name: 13. Tadiandamol Peak:
info: One of the most popular destinations in Madikeri to visit, this mountain peak is the tallest in Coorg. This peak is perfect for all adventure lovers and hiking enthusiasts if you're searching for camping options in Madikeri. You may trek to the peak, relax there, and have a quick snack at one of the many little tea shops along the way. Begin your journey from Nalknad Palace and take in the beautiful panoramas.

name: 14. Talacauvery:
info: Talacauvery is a Holy Location; it is the Kaveri (Cauvery) River's source, 27 kilometres from Madikeri, and is a popular destination for Hindu devotees. Many Hindus consider it a spiritual destination and the location of the river Kaveri's origins. It is well recognized for its gorgeous surroundings and natural beauty, as well as being a pilgrimage destination. You may reach the hilltop from the temple after a 407-step difficult climb and see the glimpse structure of clouds and the beautiful surrounding mountain ranges.

name: 15. Bhagamandala:
info: The Triveni Sangam or Bhagamandala, a sacred location in the Kodagu region, represents the confluence of three rivers and is found in the Talacauvery mountains. One of the greatest spots to visit in Madikeri is located 35 kilometers away from the city. If you come down from Talacauvery, you may see the well-known temple of Bhagamandala, which is revered as a holy place and attracts both residents and visitors. Bhagamandala is in the Talacauvery's Foothills.

name: 16. Cauvery Nisargadhama:
info: This lovely destination is surrounded by beautiful greenery and is encircled by the Cauvery River, making it the perfect location to venture out and enjoy boating with your loved ones. Explore the wildlife and look for wild animals in their naturalistic environments, such as deer, elephants, and orchidarium. This is a favourite destination to relax and enjoy in the lap of nature and lovely surroundings, thanks to its large bamboo groves, rosewood, teak, and other greenery. One of the best things to do in Madikeri is to stay in one of the city's finest cottages and take in the fascinating views of the wild surroundings.

name: 17. Pushpagiri Wildlife Sanctuary:
info: It is one of the most well-known nature sanctuaries and a haven for some of the most endangered bird species. There are magnificent scenery, lovely waterfalls, mountain streams, and some breathtaking views from the highest peaks that you will experience. It's one of the most pristine Madikeri destinations to visit. Therefore, wildlife and environment enthusiasts must go there and Witness The Rare Birds.

name: 18. Iruppu Falls:
info: It is situated 50 kilometres away from Madikeri and is also known as Lakshmana Teertha Falls. The villagers think that this fall's water can wipe away sins. This is one of the key factors contributing to its increased popularity among visitors. Among the places to see in Madikeri, the breathtaking waterfall that cascades from the Coorg mountains are a spectacular sight and a tranquil atmosphere.

name: 19. Chingara Falls:
info: This waterfall is one of the greatest tourist destinations in Madikeri because of its position. It is one of the most picturesque locations, surrounded by coffee plantations and tropical forests, with the natural waterfall offering the perfect atmosphere. Many hikers and adventure seekers like visiting this waterfall as a favourite spot to go rock climbing and rappelling. To spend your time away from nature, you may select to stay at some of the best resorts in Madikeri. Chingara Falls is the best picnic location.

name: 20. Harangi Backwaters:
info: The journey to the backwaters is quite dangerous but well worth it because they are undoubtedly some of the most beautiful. You will be rewarded with stunning scenery that will completely surprise you after hiking through lush jungles. Watch a spectacular sunset over the pristine backwaters, surrounded by lush greenery and stunning scenery. One of the greatest places for families to go on vacation in India to take in the scenery is Karnataka.

name: 21. St Michael's Church:
info: A Catholic church, St. Michael's Church, is one among the many places of worship in Madikeri. Do you long for the tranquillity you expect from a vacation? Especially on a Sunday when there is prayer, there can be nothing better than going to this church. There is a lot of open space around the church and attractive contemporary architecture. You'll feel better just by being there.

name: 22. Chettali:
info: One more of the tourist destinations in Madikeri provides a purely exclusive experience. A cute little town near Madikeri that is surrounded by greenery. You will be surprised by the village's peaks, hills, and beautiful scenery when you come, just like in your art book. Remember to stop at the neighbouring waterfall and the Cherala Bhagavathy temple. If you haven't noticed, vast areas are also covered with plantations.

name: 23. Chiklihole Reservoir:
info: To completely explore Chiklihole Reservoir, plan to stay there for at least a day. Undoubtedly, it's a popular destination for tourists in Madikeri, providing a calm environment, a lot of greenery, and a pleasant atmosphere. But instead of the normal crowds, you will enjoy the tranquillity and peace you want here. The large open areas and lush greenery attract your mind to a tranquil picnic with loved ones or even friends.

name: 24. Coffee Plantations:
info: Coffee Plantations is a vast expanse, not a specific location, with lush greenery and the delightful fragrance of herbs. These are Madikeri's various coffee plantations spread across the region. The plantations are lined with many acres of greenery, little strolling paths, and pleasant moods that make your trip enjoyable. Can you think of any other Madikeri locations to visit that would provide the same outcome, Without a doubt?

name: 25. Nehru Mantap:
info: Nehru Mantap is among the less well-known attractions in Madikeri. The Madikeri Radio Station and the surrounding mountains may be seen from the mandap area, which is a pleasant sight. Nehru Mantap, near Raja's Seat, is unquestionably a day trip you should make, especially if you enjoy nature. Don't miss the stunning sunrise and sunset views.

name: 1. Meenakshi Temple
info: This is a popular religious site in Madurai. This temple is situated on the Vaigai river's bank. Lord Shiva and Goddess Meenakshi are the main deities of this temple.

name: 2. Thirumalai Nayakar Mahal
info: This is a popular tourist destination in Madurai. This palace was built in 1636. King Thirumalai Nayak built this Palace. The palace is the ideal fusion of Dravidian and Islamic styles. This majestic mansion is situated near the well-known Meenakshi Amman Temple. It was created under the Nayak Dynasty's authority and depicted the Saracenic architectural style. It is regarded as the most prestigious monument the Madurai Nayak Dynasty had erected.

name: 3. Vaigai Dam
info: Vaigai Dam is an incredible man-made structure that is built above the River Vaigai close to Andipatti, Theni District in Tamil Nadu. Andipatti is about 70 kilometers from Madurai, where tourists frequently stop on their route to the Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary.

name: 4. Alagar Koil
info: A magnificent temple called Alagar Koil is located in Madurai's northeast. It is Madurai's most well-known temple. The temple serves as Lord Vishnu's resting spot, and this is a sacred site for many Lord Vishnu believers or followers in the area. It is situated in the Alagar Hills, and it is also referred to as the Azhagarkovil. The Lord's statue is entirely fashioned of stone, and it is a wonderful masterpiece carved from kallalgar.

name: 5. Meghamalai
info: This place is commonly referred to as the "High Wavy Mountains". Meghamalai is a small yet lovely spot found in the western ghats in the state of Tamil Nadu. It is 1500 meters above the earth's surface, and this location is perfect for escaping the heat and enjoying some quiet time in the company of nature.

name: 6. Samanar Hills
info: It is located in the Keelakuyilkudi village near Madurai. This hill cave is a well-liked tourist destination and has beautiful monk woodwork and drawings on the walls. Additionally, the area is home to a beautiful lotus temple, and it is 8 kilometers away from Madurai.

name: 7. Gandhi Memorial
info: The Gandhi Memorial Museum honors and remembers the contributions of our nation's founding father, Mahatma Gandhi. This memorial was established in 1959 to honor his cherished memory. The museum is home to various remarkable artifacts related to Indian history, like the bloodstained cloth of Gandhi wore when he was assassinated in 1948.

name: 8. Koodal Azhagar Temple
info: Koodal azhagar temple is in Madurai; it is the best place for visiting. The Koodal Azhagar Temple is a Krishna temple. Koodal is another name for Madurai, while Azghar means "beautiful" in Tamil. Vishnu is referred to as Koodal Alagar; it serves as the primary deity, and Lakshmi is referred to as Mathuravalli. This temple, one of the 108 Divyadesams, is located at place number 65.

name: 9. Athisayam
info: It is loactaed in the Madurai. It is 10 kilometers away from the city. Athisayam is a massive water cum amusement park. It spans over 70 acres of land. The park has a total of 20 rides and 40 games. The park has a 7D theatre, restaurant, and a garden for children. Athisayam's biggest attraction is Courtallam falls. Aqua Bowl and Cyclone are the other fun attraction in the Athisayam. The water Chute is the park's longest slide.

name: Best Time to Visit Sikkim
info: May to September is the ideal month to travel to Sikkim. The maximum temperature during these months is from 28 to 30 degrees Celsius. Throughout these months, North Sikkim's weather has been cold. In July and September, it rains lightly. We do not advise you to travel to Sikkim since the weather here in the winter might dip to below zero, which can make your journey challenging. The ideal times to visit Sikkim are April and May if you're considering going there.

name: Local Food to Try Out in Sikkim
info: Sikkim is one such Indian state where visitors are prompted to lick their fingers after eating, which is known for its well-known tourist attractions and cuisine. Many products, cooking techniques, and culinary aspects from Tibet, Bhutan, Nepal, and India may be found in Sikkim. The ethnicities and faiths influence this state's cuisine in the area.

name: Way To Reach Sikkim
info: If you wish to visit Sikkim, you must first choose the means of transportation you will use to go there. Below, we have included some special information about Sikkim to help you have a more enjoyable trip.

name: 1. Pushkar Lake:
info: Pushkar Lake is said to be as old as creation itself because of the legend that it was created when a lotus fell from the hands of Lord Brahma, the creator deity. Hindu mythology describes the five lakes: Man Sarovar, Bindu Sarovar, Narayan Sarovar, Pampa Sarovar, and Pushkar Sarovar. The holiest of all of them is believed to be Pushkar Lake. Devotees believe that bathing in the lake on Kartik Poornima (during the Pushkar Fair) will atone for sins and cure all skin problems. This artificial lake was created by building a dam hidden away in the Aravalli range, surrounded by a desert and hills.

name: 2. Brahma Temple:
info: The Jagatpita Brahma Mandir, close to the well-known Pushkar Lake, honours Lord Brahma, the Hindu God of Creation. Although the existing structure comes from the 14th century, the original construction is roughly 2000 years old. Pushkar is home to more than 500 temples, many of which are quite old, but the Brahma temple is the most prominent one. After coming to earth to carry out a yajna, according to mythology, Brahma built his temple here. Hindu philosopher Adi Shankara renovated the temple in the eighth century. However, Maharaja Jawat Raj of Ratlam is credited with repairing and making minor modifications to the existing structure. The Lord Brahma and Gayatri, his second wife, are honoured in the temple's.

name: 3. Gurudwara Singh Sabha:
info: Starting in the early 19th century, the eastern part of Pushkar's Gurudwara Singh Sabha was built to honour the visits of the first and tenth gurus, Guru Nanak Dev and Guru Govind Singhji.

name: 4. Varaha temple:
info: The Varaha Temple is Pushkar's biggest and oldest temple. This temple was built by King Anaji Chauhan in the 12th century and honoured Lord Vishnu's third appearance as a wild boar. The mythology says that Varaha prevented a devil from dragging the earth into the primordial ocean (Hirnayaksh). One of Pushkar's most visited temples is this one.

name: 5. Savitri temple:
info: This temple is situated on a mountain just behind the Brahma temple and is dedicated to Lord Brahma's first wife, Goddess Savitri. One may get a panoramic view of the lake, nearby temples, and dunes while acclimating to the long flight of steps leading to the temple. Savitri cursed Brahma for marrying Gayatri while beginning his yagna at Pushkar; that's why there is only one Brahma Temple in Pushkar.

name: 6. Rangji Temple:
info: Another well-known temple that attracts many pilgrims and visitors each year is the graceful and striking Rangji Temple. Lord Rangji, who is said to be an avatar of Lord Vishnu, is the subject of the temple. The temple's architecture influences South Indian, Rajput, and Mughal styles. Another aspect of the temple that attracts tourists is the tall "Gopuram," which is mostly found in temples in South India.

name: 7. Rose Garden:
info: Pushkar is surprisingly well-known for its rose growing. The Rajasthan Rose Garden is the name given to Rose Garden. The farmers in this area raise a lot of different varieties of roses, which are exported all over the world. Various coloured, fragrant, and stunning red roses cover acres of farmland, enticing one to relax and spend some beautiful time. Travel to these popular Pushkar tourism destinations for an unforgettable trip with your loved ones.

name: 8. Naga Pahar:
info: The Naga Pahar hills separate Pushkar from Ajmer. According to mythology, the hills of Naga Pahar are still eroding and may soon totally disappear. The famous Sage Agastya is thought to have lived among these mountains. Nag Kund Lake is located in the mountains as well. From its height, Naga Pahar provides a magnificent view of Pushkar and is a popular destination for photographers to take pictures. It is among the top sites in Pushkar to come for a special vacation.

name: 9. Kishangarh:
info: There are many attractions to see even in Pushkar. Kishangarh, a township outside Pushkar, is well-known for its majestic forts and marble mines. Roopangarh Fort and the Phool Mahal provide a glimpse into the area's historical past. To better understand the procedures involved in creating the marble slabs in your home, visiting the marble mines in Kishangarh is worthwhile.

name: 10. Man Mahal:
info: Raja Man Singh of Amber constructed this stunning palace, and it is near the Pushkar Sarovar. There is a temple inside the palace, which was constructed using conventional Rajasthani style. The Rajasthan Tourism Development Corporation cares for the palace, which provides a lodging facility for tourists. The stunning sunset views of the nearby lakes and temples are the main attractions for tourists. On request, tourists can arrange for camel rides and camping. Unquestionably, the Man Mahal is among the top destinations in Rajasthan to see in January.

name: 11. Apteshwar Temple:
info: The Apteshwar Temple, which is devoted to Lord Mahadev or Shiva, is also included on the list of the top attractions in Pushkar. This underground temple is said to have been constructed in the 12th century before being covered. It is very important to the people, so the temple is usually crowded with believers yearly. To obtain the graces of God, they arrive bearing gifts such as milk, bel (leaf), and other goods.

name: 12. The Laughing Buddha Café:
info: One of the finest things to do in Pushkar is to satisfy your soul with the delicious flavors of Rajasthani cuisine, which is easy to achieve given that Pushkar is also a well-known travelling destination. When you become hungry while exploring Pushkar, come to the Lord Buddha Vegan Cafe, where you may eat a variety of dishes. Your stomach will be filled, and your heart will be joyful after eating the vegan dish made from fresh fruit.

name: 13. Pap Mochini temple:
info: The Pap Mochini temple presided over by the goddess Ekadashi Mata is said to provide devotees relief from their sins. The temple in Pushkar's northern region resembles a jewel in the city's crown. One of the most well-known temples in Rajasthan is the Pap Mochini temple, which is highly respected spiritually and has beautiful architecture.

name: 14. Merta:
info: Merta is nearly 400 years old and well-known for the Meera Temple, a devotee of Krishna. This city, originally known as Medantak, is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Pushkar since it is the birthplace of Meera Bai. Here are two other temples, Dadhimati and Charbhuja, which see many visitors annually. A famous destination in Pushkar, this city is also rich in historical value because of the numerous conflicts it has seen. If you are going to Pushkar, make sure it is one of them.

name: 15. Mahadeva Temple:
info: One of the top tourist destinations in Rajasthan and one of the most well-known cities in India is Pushkar, famous for its stunning temples. The city has many attractive temples. These temples offer a spiritual retreat and lead visitors through this old city's historic streets. The Mahadeva Temple, one of the well-known tourist attractions in Pushkar, is one such temple. The 19th-century Mahadeva Temple is among Pushkar's most well-known attractions. The main God of the temple is Lord Shiva, who is shown inside as a statue made of white marble. This temple's highlights include beautiful murals and polished floors. The embossed pink pillars are another prominent feature of its construction.

name: 16. Pushkar Bazaar:
info: A trip isn't complete without visiting the local market to buy some things. Therefore, if Pushkar is your first tourist spot, visit its namesake market. You will discover many people selling Rajasthani-inspired handicrafts, purses, souvenirs, and colourful clothing here. Rose pulp and gulkand are a couple of the specific items available here. Additionally, you may buy various leather products made from camel skin. As one of the best sites to visit in Pushkar, make sure you walk through the streets of Pushkar Bazaar.

name: 17. In Pushkar, where can Visitors stay?
info: In Rajasthan, Pushkar has some of the most luxurious and diverse lodging options. The top resorts in Pushkar for every price range are listed below:

name: 18. Going To Pushkar:
info: The Pink City Express and Shatabdi Express are the top choices when travelling to Ajmer from Delhi and Jaipur. The nearest railway station is in Ajmer (11 km). Pushkar has nonstop bus service to Ajmer (30 minutes, 20 INR), Jaipur (3 hours, 220-410 INR), Udaipur (6 hours, 450 INR), and night buses to Delhi (10 hours, INR 400-850). From Jaipur, it is only 147 kilometres via road. It is one of the greatest cheap excursions in India because of how easily it can be reached from Delhi.

name: History and Culture of Manipur
info: The establishment of Manipur in the first century AD resulted from the 10 clans coming together under the leadership of the Ningthouja tribe.

name: 1. Loktak Lake
info: Loktak Lake is the best tourist destination in Manipur and is 53 kilometres distant from Imphal. This capital city is situated in the heart of a lovely valley and is one of the oldest towns in India. Due to its extensive pastures and lush woodland, it also resembles paradise on earth. The Loktak nere is noted for its phumdis or spherical-shaped floating marshlands. This largest natural freshwater reserve covers an arena of 280 square kilometres. The last remaining natural habitat of the threatened "Sangai" breed is found there. Thus, it is famous for the brow-antlered deer, which is among the three kinds of Eld's deer found in Manipur.

name: 2. Senapati
info: Senapati is a less well-known place in Manipur. However, one must have a stroll amidst the quirky surroundings in order to admire this heavenly space. One of the top tourist destinations in Manipur, Senapati, is a simple but captivating refuge that is bestowed with the abundance of nature. Here, lush forests occupy almost 80% of the land, with villages dotting the remaining 20%.

name: 3. Keibul Lamjao National Park
info: Keibul Lamjao National Park, which encircles Loktak Lake, is most renowned for its endangered brow-antlered deer, also known as Sangai, and its floating phumdis vegetation. Among the most stunning tourist destinations in Manipur, this national park spanning 40 sq. km. offers mesmerising views of the lake. Additionally, Keibul Lamjao National Park is well-liked by ornithologists, animal aficionados, and those who enjoy the outdoors because it is the world's only floating sanctuary.

name: 4. Tharon Cave
info: One of the intriguing tourist destinations in Manipur is the Tharon Cave, also known as The Uluan Cave. This 650 metres long cave tunnel, which is close to Tamenglong, features engravings and excavations from North Vietnamese Hovnanian culture.

name: 5. INA Memorial Complex
info: While on vacation in Manipur, one should check out the INA Memorial Complex, which was erected in honour of the brave soldiers of the Indian National Army (INA) who gave their lives to secure the nation.

name: 6. Manipur Zoological Garden
info: One of the nicest places to visit in Manipur is to explore this zoo, where one can see wildlife and soak in the tranquil atmosphere. Manipur Zoological Garden, which opened in 1976, is one of the state's most well-liked tourism destinations, particularly by families and young children.

name: 7. Shree Govindaji Temple
info: Shree Govindajee Temple, one of the most popular tourist attractions in Manipur, is devoted to Radha, Krishna, Jagannatha, Balarama, and Govinda. An important area near the Kangla fort is home to a Vaishnav temple devoted to the Lord Sri Baikunth Nath, who is said to grant eternal peace to Thounaojam Kunjakishwor Singh's departed soul.

name: 8. Dzukou Valley
info: Dzukou Valley, which is well-known for its natural setting, is situated on the boundary between the states of Manipur and Nagaland. The Dzukou lily, a unique flower found exclusively in this region, gave the valley its name. It is certainly the essence that dreams are made of, with stunning valleys, crystal-clear water, and lush green trees. The Blyth's tragopan, the state bird of Nagaland, resides in this valley, which is abundant in vegetation and fauna. It welcomes visitors all year long and entices them with its splendour.

name: 9. Leimaram Waterfall
info: Another well-known major tourist spot in Manipur is the Leimaram Waterfall. Because of its picturesque beauty and serene surroundings, it has recently developed into a fantastic tourist destination.

name: 10. Chandel
info: The abundance of nature is showered upon Chandel, the entrance to Myanmar. Not only that, but the area is one of Manipur's most beautiful tourist destinations and features a culturally diverse environment. So, in this oasis, which in itself is one of the most stunning Manipur destinations, one would get the best of both worlds.

name: 1. Elephant's Head Point
info: Elephant's Head Point in Mahabaleshwar, also known as Needle Hole Point, offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. Needle's point is the best place to visit during sundown. It is one of the greatest sites to visit in Mahabaleshwar, The rock present here has been compared to the head of an elephant, and the gap between the elephant's trunk and foot has the appearance of a hole-like needle.

name: 2. Chinaman's Falls
info: One of the most well-known attractions to visit in Mahabaleshwar is the Chinaman's Falls, which is about 2.5 km south of the city in the Koyana valley. Since the Chinese were responsible for maintaining the surrounding gardens, therefore waterfall is known as Chinaman's waterfall. As sunlight passes through the falls, that time the water shimmers like gold and diamonds. The beautiful surroundings, stunning waterfalls, and gardens make it a perfect vacation destination. It is the ideal destination for a holiday that offers a stunning experience. Arrange a picnic at Chinaman's falls for you and your loved ones. The monsoon season is the best time to view the falls. It is one of the favourite areas to visit in Mahabaleshwar because of its peaceful surroundings. If you visit Mahabaleshwar, you should visit Chinaman Falls. The time requires to visit and see Chinaman's falls is 2 or 3 hours.

name: 3. Dhobi Waterfall
info: It is one of Mahabaleshwar's best tourist destinations. Dhobi falls are a collection of waterfalls that connect Elphinston Point and Lodwick, and after that, connect Petit Road to Old Mahabaleshwar Road. The Dhobi waterfall is located around 3 kilometres from Mahabaleshwar's main town. For adventure lovers and picnickers, a waterfall has always been a particularly attractive destination. One of the greatest spots to visit in Mahabaleshwar is the Koyna River; it is a tributary of the Krishna River that falls directly into the valley from the mountains.

name: 4. Arthur's Seat
info: The Arthur's Seat is one of Mahabaleshwar's most well-known tourist attractions. It is also known as the Madhi Mahaal or the Queen of the Points. Arthur's Seat is around 13 kilometres from Mahabaleshwar's market. The unique feature of this location is that if you toss a light object down the valley, it will quickly rise due to air pressure. The Konkan and the Deccan are seen on one side of Arthur's Seat and surrounded by an amazing view. October to June is the ideal time to visit Arthur's Seat. The climate here is generally pleasant; in summer, it is mild, and in winter, it is chilly. Suicide Point is another name for this area.

name: 5. Venna Lake
info: The Venna Lake is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Mahabaleshwar that visitors should not miss. It is an artificial lake that Shri Appasaheb Maharaj, a descendant of Shivaji Maharaj, constructed in 1942. The 7 km to 8 km long Veena Lake is surrounded by lush forest, enhancing its attractiveness. Pratap Singh Garden is situated on the banks of this lake, which is a popular tourist attraction. To fulfil the water needs of the city of Mahabaleshwar, it was initially constructed.

name: 6. Wilson Point (Sunrise Point)
info: One of the greatest spots to visit in Mahabaleshwar is Wilson point, commonly referred to as the Sunrise point, since it is the highest point in the city. Watch the sunrise from Wilson Point while standing tall at 4,710 feet above sea level and mesmerize yourself. The sun rising brightens your day and gives you energy for the trip ahead.

name: 7. Mahabaleshwar Temple
info: Lord Shiva is honoured in the Mahabaleshwar Temple, which is situated 6 km north of the main city. It was constructed in the 16th century. It is one of the most well-known tourist destinations in Mahabaleshwar, attracting many pilgrims. It is commonly referred to as the Mahabali. Throughout the year, tourists and followers throng the temple to enjoy peace and tranquilly.

name: 8. Panchgani
info: Panchgani is a prominent hill resort in the Indian state of Maharashtra and is named after the five gorgeous hills surrounding it. This hill town is located at an elevation of around 1334 meters above sea level. It is surrounded by imposing mountains, bleak valleys, flowing waterfalls, and dense forests. This village, which is covered by the Sahyadri mountains, was once a lovely summer hideaway for British officials. Many visitors are currently attracted to Panchgani by its tranquillity, natural beauty, and adventure.

name: 9. Tapola
info: It is one of the greatest spots to visit in Mahabaleshwar. Tapola is a little town known for the stunning Shivsagar lake, and it is sometimes referred to as the "Mini Kashmir" of the west. Tourists enjoy activities such as swimming in the lake and riding a water scooter, kayaking, or taking a motorboat trip. For the unforgettable view, wait till sunset. Trekking in the Tapola forests is another option for adventurers. The nearby strawberry fields are a must-see while visiting.

name: 10. Elphinstone Point
info: Murray discovered Elphinstone Point in the year 1830. It is among the highest points in Mahabaleshwar. Mount Stuart Elphinstone, the legislative head of the Bombay Administration at the time, inspired the naming of the Elphinstone Point. Elphinstone Point is one of the most beautiful places in Mahabaleshwar, and the gorgeous surroundings add to its beauty.

name: 11. Pratapgad Fort
info: Maharashtra's Pratapgad is a hill fort. The height of the pratapgad fort is approximately 3500 feet above the ground. The defences are still mostly intact, and a fort is a well-liked place to vacation. There are four lakes in the fort, many of which overflow during the monsoon season. A watchtower is located right next to the Mahadarwaza, or the main entrance, which is at the end of the road with traffic.

name: 1. Lulu Shopping Mall
info: The Lulu Shopping Mall is one of the biggest malls in India. A 17-acre mall featuring food courts, 215 restaurants, a multiplex, a bowling alley, entertainment areas, money exchange offices, a 5D movie theatre, and arcade games. This mall is located in Edapally, Cochin. The largest central atrium with a transparent glass roof is available in Lulu mall. The mall makes an Asia book of records in an effort to show support for Indian soldiers. To convey the message "Lulu salutes our soldiers," 5509 staff illuminated Deepavali bulbs within the mall.

name: 2. Fort Kochi
info: The beach town Fort Kochi is located in Main Cochin's southwest. This town is famous for its old-world colonial beauty. Throughout the year, tourists swarm here to get a sight of how Dutch colonialism or Portuguese affected different regions of our nation. Many European-style buildings are dotted across this charming city. The Fort Kochi beach is absolutely beautiful at sunset, with many shades of scarlet and vermilion.

name: 3. Kerala Kathakali Centre
info: Kerala Kathakali Center was established in 1990, and it aims to popularise Keralan traditional art, find fresh talent, and train current performers with rigorous discipline and devotion. A combination of literature, art, music, dancing, and acting is called kathakali. These all five forms combine to create this lovely dancing style, performed with command and grace. If you are willing to study this dance form directly from the professionals, go to this spot in Cochin. It also offers courses in Kalaripayattu, flute, classical music, tabla, madalam, violin, veena, sitar, and the drums.

name: 4. Mattancherry Palace
info: It is commonly referred to as the Dutch Palace. This quadrangular palace was constructed in the traditional Nalukettu architecture of Kerala. The palace's flooring is stunning because it looks like polished black marble, but it has been produced in the conventional Keralan manner by utilising charcoal, burned coconut shells, lime, egg white, and other materials to give a long-lasting finish.

name: 5. Cherai Beach
info: This lovely beach is neatly tucked away in Cherai's suburbs. This is a popular beach because of its calm atmosphere and cleanliness. It is an excellent beach for swimming and other water sports due to the low tides and soothing waves. There is a lovely promenade along the beach lined with greenery with seating areas. Elderly visitors are frequently observed practising yoga, engaging in meditation, or taking leisurely strolls in the early morning or late evening to enjoy the beauty of nature along the Arabian Sea, where the Periyar River confluences. The beach is flanked by many luxurious villas and beach hotels that create a picture-postcard backdrop.

name: 6. Wonderla Amusement Park
info: This is one of Cochin's biggest theme parks. This amusement park offers a variety of exciting rides like 3D rides, land rides, water rides, and more to keep visitors entertained. Wonderla contains everything a person could possibly need to rejoice vivaciously. Some of its main attractions are wonder splash, sky wheel, chikku's adventures, dashing cars, fire brigade, windmill, and caterpillar village.

name: 7. Bolgatty Palace
info: It is a popular tourist destination in Cochin. On Cochin's Bolgatty Island, there is Bolgatty Palace. It is one of the oldest Dutch palaces still in use that is located outside of Holland. It is a beautiful illustration of Kochi-style architecture. Dutch traders constructed it in 1744. The Bolgatty Palace is surrounded by lush gardens, clear skies, and the unspoiled beauties of Kerela.

name: 8. Hill Palace Museum
info: It is constructed in typical Kerala architecture with a lavish facade, and it was once the home of the King of Cochin. As its name implies, the huge palace is situated on a hill. The palace complex is made up of 49 buildings and features classical architecture. There is a heritage museum, an archaeological museum, a deer park, a pre-historic park, and a children's park at the complex.

name: 9. Marine Drive
info: Marine Drive has a view of Kerala's tranquil backwaters. It is Cochin's most well-liked hangout area. It provides a nice and beautiful scene, especially in the evening. The Houseboat Bridge, Rainbow Bridge, GCDA shopping Complex, and the China Net Bridge are a few notable sites in the area. Kochi's Marine Drive is undoubtedly a shopper's paradise. This place has everything, from flea markets to high-rise commercial centres.

name: 10. Veeranpuzha lake and Backwaters
info: It is located in the northern portion of Vembanad Lake. This attractive lake lies parallel to the Malabar coast. A popular weekend pastime for locals is fishing, and it is well known for growing Pokkali rice.

name: 11. Santa Cruz Basilica
info: This is regarded as one of Kerala's eight basilicas. It is a famous tourist spot in Cochin. Decorative frescoes adorn the church columns. Moreover, there are seven substantial canvas paintings along with stunning stained glass windows. Some magnificently painted pictures of Christ's Via Crucis are displayed on the ceiling. The basilica's architecture is a stunning combination of Indo-European and Gothic architecture.

name: 12. Andhakaranazhi Beach
info: This beach attracts many visitors, and it is situated in a coastal village. This beach is still undeveloped, untapped by tourism, and a well-kept secret of the city. The Andhakaranazhi Beach serves as a common location for Malayalam movie shoots. A brand-new bridge and an aerial walkway have been built to the sea wall for a wonderful view of an unforgettable sunset. It is the ideal peaceful retreat from the bustle of the city. Visit this place to experience nature in its purest form, which is complete with spotless sands, crystal-clear oceans, and stunning shorelines.

name: 1. Gaumukh Temple
info: The Gaumukh Temple, a temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, is situated near Mount Abu. You must ascend the 700 stairs steps to access this temple. The valley surrounding the temple can be seen from here. The Gaumukh Temple is always crowded with visitors and pilgrims. It is located within a lush forest. This temple is devoted to Nandi, the bull of Lord Shiva in Hindu mythology, who is shown as a marble bull with water dripping from his mouth. This temple has the idol of Nandi and the idols of Gaumukh, Lord Krishna, Lord Rama, and Sage Vashistha.

name: 2. Guru Shikhar
info: Guru Shikhar is the finest destination for you if you are tired of the fast-paced and stressful city life. The tallest mountain in the Aravalli Range, Guru Shikhar, is located around 15 kilometers away from Mount Abu. The Aravalli Range and the hill town of Mount Abu can be seen from this peak which is 1722 meters above sea level, and the view looks scenic. An Abuvedhsala and a cave shrine of Guru Dattatreya, devoted to Lord Vishnu, are nearby. There is a 1.2-meter infrared telescope at the site. You must climb a few stairs to reach the Guru Shikhar. There will be a lot of clouds and fog if you visit this location in October and November. Because of the surrounding mist, visitors feel as if they are traveling to Guru Shikhar with the aid of clouds. The tourists that visit this location take a beautiful memory of a lifetime with them.

name: 3. Nakki Lake
info: Nakki Lake, also called Nakki Lake locally, is situated in the Aravalli mountains in Mount Abu. It is Mount Abu's most well-known feature and is surrounded by breathtaking natural surroundings, and this lake is a haven for those who enjoy the outdoors. With a depth of around 11,000 meters and a width of one mile, Nakki Lake is the first artificial lake in India. This lovely lake is located in the middle of Mount Abu and is surrounded by mountains and oddly formed rocks. Your heart will be content to go on boating and enjoy Mount Abu's blowing breezes and comfortable temperatures. On February 12, 1948, Mahatma Gandhi's ashes were immersed in Nakki Lake, and Gandhi Ghat was built. Nature lovers and photographers adore this lake as a destination.

name: 4. Arbuda Devi Temple
info: The Arbuda Devi Temple is the most sacred site on Mount Abu. Out of 51 Shaktipeeth temples, this one is regarded as the sixth Shaktipeeth. According to legend, Katyayani Devi's incarnation is Arbuda Devi. On the festival of Navratri, Mount Abu transforms into a spiritual hub. Visitors from a great distance visit Arbuda Devi Temple. But it's quite a tough task to reach the temple as one has to climb 365 steps which are inside a cave. A sacred well with milk-colored water is rumored to exist close to the temple. The locals who live here view this as Kamadhenu. The primary water supply for the temple comes from this well. One of India's greatest examples of a rock temple is this one, which is made of an enormous, solid boulder.

name: 5. Universal Peace Hall
info: The Brahma Kumari Spiritual University's primary gathering space, named Universal Shanti Hall, is also called Om Shanti Bhavan. This structure was built in 1983. The capacity of this serene white edifice is roughly 5,000 people. During any event, this venue can provide translation services in 16 different languages. Since the hall was made a public tourist attraction, it has received more than 8,000 visitors daily. A Brahma Kumaris member will guide you to an engaging group when you arrive at the Universal Peace Hall, where the daily problems and tension that affect everyone are erased.

name: 6. Shri Raghunath Temple
info: Shri Raghunath Ji Mandir on the site of Niki Lake stands as a 650-year-old monument dedicated to Lord Vishnu's rebirth. It is regarded as one of the holiest temples on earth and is mostly visited by Vaishnavites. It is said that Shri Raghunath Ji would shield his devotees from all-natural disasters. His followers believe he would save them from suffering and all the other life issues. With the aid of the inscriptions on the walls of this temple, the architectural history of Mewar can be observed. This temple features delicate sculptures and paintings as well. The primary draw of Mount Abu is Shri Raghunath Ji's wonderfully crafted idol.

name: 7. Wildlife Sanctuary
info: The Mount Abu Wildlife Sanctuary is one of those locations with enormous prosperity of wildlife, making it a smaller but excellent tourist destination. One of the oldest locations in the Mount Abu mountain ranges, this sanctuary offers several picturesque locations and many breathtaking vistas. To protect the native plants and animals, the entire region was designated as a wildlife sanctuary. The colorful greenery of evergreen woods may be seen in this sanctuary. While visiting Rajasthan, if you want to view some wonderful wildlife and experience the outdoors, this is an incredible location to do it.

name: 8. Dilwara Jain Temple
info: One of the most well-known and stunning pilgrimage destinations for Jains is the Dilwara Jain Temple, located in Rajasthan's Aravalli highlands. Vastupala and Tejpal constructed this temple during the eleventh and thirteenth centuries. This temple is renowned for its beautiful carvings and marble construction. The designs on this temple's roof, walls, arches, and pillars will draw you in when you view it from the inside, even though it appears rather plain from the outside. This marble temple draws people to it despite not being a Jain pilgrimage place. It is one of the fascinating temple buildings in India.

name: 9. Sunset Point
info: If you are going to Mount Abu, then don't miss to visit the fascinating tourist destination Sun Set Point. It is a must-see for everyone who is on vacation in Mount Abu. You can experience a vista you would never have imagined. The vista of the sun at dusk beyond the untamed Aravalli hills is quite popular among travelers. Any lover of nature will find this particular location wonderful since when the sun sets, colors of red and orange are visible in the beautiful Aravalli greenery. The area has a lovely climate all year round. Mount Abu is the ideal location for those who wish to enjoy the view of the sunset in solitude and leave the city's bustle.

name: 10. Achalgarh Fort
info: One of the renowned old forts in Rajasthan is Achalgarh Fort, which is situated 11 kilometers from Mount Abu. Achalgarh Village, a scenic village on Mount Abu, is well-known for its old Jain temples, the Achaleshwar Temple, and the Achalgarh Fort. The Achaleshwar Mahadev Temple, a well-known Shiva temple, and Mandakini Lake are within the fort's walls.

name: 11. Trevors Tank
info: Travers Tank is a popular destination for those who enjoy the outdoors, 5 kilometers from Mount Abu. It bears the name of the engineer called Trevor, who created it. The reservoir is still located in the remote forest, where people go to see crocodiles, birds, and other animals. Currently, both residents and the yearly visitors that come here enjoy picnicking there. You may enjoy a stunning view of the outdoors here.

name: 12. Toad Rock
info: Toad Rock is a spectacular area built of rocks where you will discover enormous rocks and is recognized as the mascot of Mount Abu. All of the visitors to Mount Abu go to Toad Rock. You may ascend the bluff here for a beautiful view of the nearby lake and the verdant hills, which you can photograph with the aid of your camera.

name: 13. Brahmakumari Peace Park
info: Achalgarh and Guru Shikhar, Mount Abu's two most well-known attractions, are separated by this park, which is the ideal balance of tranquility and beauty. There are many types of cacti and roses in the on-site rock garden. It has several calm locations perfect for meditation and is encircled on all sides by peaceful hills.

name: 14. Honeymoon Point
info: This area is known as the Honeymoon Point because of the existence of Love Rock, or two rocks representing a man and a woman. It is situated at a level of around 1220 meters above sea level and is near the northeastern extremity of Nakki Lake. Couples choose to visit this location because it offers the greatest views of the beautiful sun at dusk. Couples also love to click photos and selfies at this location.

name: 15. Shopping in Chacha Museum
info: One of Mount Abu's oldest and biggest stores is called Chacha Museum. The Chacha Museum, close to the well-known Nakki Lake, is a must-see on a trip to Mount Abu. The store opened 37 years ago and has hundreds of gifts, souvenirs, handicrafts, local artwork, and more. To appreciate the magnificence of the museum, you may spend the entire evening there. Here, a wide variety of commodities are sold, including quilts, cotton goods, and wooden and metal objects.

name: How to Reach Mount Abu
info: You can reach Mount Abu by road, train, or plane.

name: Best Local Food in Mount Abu
info: In addition to being a renowned and famous hill station, Mount Abu is a unique location to get organic, vegetarian meals. Since it is a well-known Jain pilgrimage place, many eateries only serve vegetarian dishes. Thus the likelihood that you would encounter non-vegetarian cuisine is quite minimal. Chinese, Punjabi, and local Rajasthani cuisine are readily accessible at Mount Abu. However, restaurants in the city center are the only places where you can enjoy Chinese and Punjabi food. It would be best if you tried the native cuisine here because of this.

name: Best Time To Visit Mount Abu
info: The location is surrounded by a variety of lush greenery, including coniferous trees and blooming bushes, which helps Mount Abu maintain a pleasant environment all year round. The winter and monsoon seasons are ideal for visiting Mount Abu. So, from the month of July to February, you may travel to Mount Abu on whatever date you decide. This location is wonderful for vacationing due to the lovely weather and comfortable temperatures during these months.

info: Splunk

name: 1. Ranipuram
info: Ranipuram's beautiful hills in Kerala are well-known for their hiking path. Usually called Madathumala, this location is 750 meters above sea level and offers spectacular walking routes with a top cave around 2.5 kilometres long. The shola woods and monsoon forests' lush greenery has everything their untouched beauty has to show you if you're looking for pleasure.

name: 2. Bekal Fort
info: The largest and best-preserved fort in Kasaragod, with a 300-year-old defensive system, makes it one of the top tourist destinations. You can enjoy a breathtaking view of the captivating Arabian Sea from the fort's observation tower. Tourists visit the fort in considerable numbers to experience the magnificent past and be impressed by its remarkable strength. Visit, learn more about the history and go to an ancient mosque close to this fort.

name: 3. Parappa Wildlife Sanctuary
info: A top tourist spot in Kasaragod and a haven for those who enjoy the outdoors. It is home to various animals, including the sluggish turtle, the prickly porcupine, the Malabar hornbill, the thin loris, and the cute wild jungle cat.

name: 4. Thaikadappuram Beach
info: A perfect setting for a relaxing vacation! It would be best to visit this beach during the monsoon season to see some olive ridley turtles. Observe the sunset with vibrant colours and watch the beach turn golden.

name: 5. Bela Church
info: This church, also known as the Ladies of Sorrow Church, has a gothic design that appeals to history lovers and anyone with user interest. Worshippers visit this Roman Catholic church because it is on the list of places with significant religious history. Bela Church is the place to go if you want to see a place that perfectly represents tranquillity.

name: 6. Malom Wildlife Sanctuary
info: This Sanctuary is home to gorgeous tropical wildlife, including bison, deer, elephants, tigers, and around 200 colourful bird species. You might be able to see a cobra or python if you're lucky.

name: 7. Mallikarjuna Temple
info: In the heart of Kasaragod, there is a temple Mallikarjuna Temple to Lord Shiva. The attractive atmosphere of this temple brings people inside to sit and spend some time delighting in the ceremonial acts that are a standard part of everyday life.

name: 8. Hosdurg Fort
info: It is sometimes generically called the Kanhangad fort. This fort's design attracts tourists who are passing by and who find it beautiful. Its chain of forts, constructed during the Ikkeri dynasty, is so well-known. Learn about the history and go to this fort.

name: 9. Manjeshwar
info: There is a small town named Manjeshwar in the northernmost point of Kerala, in the Kasaragod district. It is 584 kilometres from the state capital Thiruvananthapuram and 28 kilometres from Kasaragod.

name: 10. Chandragiri Fort
info: This fort, which is surrounded by ruins hillsides and is full of history, provides tourists with a beautiful sunset sight. A scenery set is calm with a panoramic view. This odd fort is square in shape and stands majestically 150 feet above the sea. While unwinding, you may enjoy the city from above.

name: 11. Nellikunnu Mosque
info: This area is crowded in November because of the week-long Nercha celebration that takes place there. A famous mosque that you must visit for religious reasons, and this place's hypostyle architecture attracts visitors and worshippers.

name: 12. Kottancheri Hills
info: This place may serve as both a hiking route and a picnic area. Adventure seekers and hikers are drawn to the site's stunning view of the high-elevation jungle. Visualize yourself relaxing in tranquillity while enjoying a bird's eye vision of your surroundings, complete with picturesque sceneries.

name: 13. Veeramala Hills
info: Since the 18th century, this location has hosted a Dutch fort and is renowned for its architecture. Hike around this hilly area to find other viewpoints that have yet to be discovered.

name: 14. Valiyaparamba
info: This spot is a favourite among travellers looking for tranquillity. It is a lovely, leisurely backwater site, and the emerald-green lakes and lush green forests enhance the picturesque's enchanting characteristics.

name: 15. Ananthapura Lake Temple
info: This temple, well-preserved for surprising reactions due to its unique construction, is carved with legendary tales from the Puranas and a secret cave connecting to a pond. However, this location is one of Kasaragod's most popular tourist destinations.

name: 16. Ajanoor
info: Visit this village to understand how a rural panchayat operates. As a village that has seen an uprising, there is plenty to see and learn. Ajanoor is the perfect place for intellectual geniuses. Meet the people, observe how rural Kerala functions, and learn the little-known yet fascinating details. If visitors search for serenity and spirituality in nature, Ajanoor is the place for visitors.

name: 17. Kareem'S Forest Park
info: Kareem's Forest Park, widely regarded as the top private place in the nation, is a haven for those who value nature, science, biology, the environment, and Ayurveda. If you love the outdoors, you see this magnificent beauty.

name: 18. Kumbla
info: Today a renowned Gopalakrishna temple resides at a place with a glorious past that formerly held the Raja's palace. 13 kilometres from Kasaragod, this location attracts a large number of worshippers all year round.

name: 19. Cheruvathur
info: The birthplace of a remarkable poet who wrote sonnets and melody works is officially known as Kuttamath Nagar. This location is perfect for the visitor if they enjoy modern paintings. During the tourist season, people go for an adventure and enjoy the day from the chaos of the city.

name: 20. Nileshwar
info: Nileshwaram, located between the Nileshwaram Puzha and Thejaswini Puzha rivers, is commonly referred to as the Kasargod District's cultural centre. The town, which has the Arabian Sea to its west, is stunningly gorgeous and a fantastic place to be.

name: How to reach Kasaragod
info: The closest airport to Kasargod town is Mangalore, which is 65 kilometres; Kozhikodeode, which is 200 kilometres away, serves as the nearest international airport. Outside the airport, taxis are easy to reach the preferred destination.
