There is a pool in the center of the waterfall where, if you toss a stone into it, it will land on the other side of you and fall into the water.

name: 1. Topslip, Pollachi
info: In the Annamalai Hills, there is a protected area called Indira Gandhi Wildlife Sanctuary and National Park. Following the Indian Prime Minister's 1961 visit, the park received a new name. name: 9. Thirumoorthy Hills
info: The Thirumoothy temple is situated in the Thirumoorthy Hills, next to the Thirumoothy dam. In these hills, there is a stream that runs by the Sri Amaralingeswarar temple and the Thirumoorthy falls. Legend has it that the Hindu deity had descended to test the loyalty of Athari Maharishi and his spouse Anushiya Devi while they were living in these hills. The Divine beings instructed them to make their sacrifices while Anushiya Devi was naked. She concurred, fed the infants, and altered the gods in their hearts with her devotion. The Hills acquired their name after the Gods greeted the pair and left.

name: 1. Paraty
info: Brazil's Paraty, surrounded by mountains and jungles, is one of the most beautiful places to visit. Tourists enjoy Paraty's streets and buildings a lot since they are so attractive. A naturalist's dream, the region around Paraty features some of southeast Brazil's most breathtaking mountain and coastline beauty. You may explore several of the area's gorgeous beaches while you're here. The name of Paraty should be at the top of your list if you are compiling a list of tourist destinations for your visit to Brazil.

name: 2. Manaus
info: A great starting place for experiencing the Amazon. The Negro and Solimas rivers meet at Manaus, the state capital of the Brazilian state of Amazon. To provide you with some facts, Manaus is the second-largest city in the northern region of Brazil. This city is the entry point to the world's most extensive tropical jungles and is situated in the centre of the Amazon rainforest. Beyond this, the city is a fantastic starting point for exploring the Amazon because of its ancient colonial structures, diverse flora, animals, and handicrafts. Spend a few days in Manaus city if you're visiting the tourist destinations in Brazil. Manaus boasts a lively nightlife being the biggest urban area in the Amazon. The majority of the nightlife in this city is concentrated on Ponta Negra Beach.

name: 3. Rio De Janeiro
info: Rio de Janeiro, one of Brazil's brightest cities, is famed for its beaches, music, events, and traditions. Here, there is a celebration called the Rio Carnival, which draws many visitors. There is a sizable gathering in the streets here during this festival. Rio de Janeiro, now a popular tourist destination, was formerly Brazil's capital. Both cultural attractions and well-known monuments are found here. The most well-known is the Christ the Redeemer statue, one of the Seven Wonders of the World. If you intend to travel to Rio de Janeiro, you must attend the city's yearly carnival events. This beach is known for its excellent nightlife and delicious cuisine. If you intend to visit the tourist sites in Brazil, Rio-de-Janeiro needs to be at the top of your list.

name: 4. São Paulo
info: Paulo, the largest city in Brazil, does not lack tourist attractions, even though some visitors may perceive it as lacking in attractive characteristics. The city of Sao Paulo, which also acts as the nation's financial hub, is renowned for its rich cultural and architectural past. Sao Paulo is home to several tall structures, colonial-style churches, and neo-Gothic cathedrals. People enjoy the local nightlife in addition to this.

name: 5. Brasilia
info: The planned city of Brasilia acts as the federal capital of Brazil. The city is famous for trying to cut construction and creative city planning. In 1960, Brasilia was designated as the nation's capital. In 1987, the city received the UNESCO World Heritage Site designation. Brasilia is the only city in the 20th century to have this ranking. In Brasilia, several attractions draw a lot of tourists. Visit this interesting city of Brasilia if you are considering a trip to Brazil.

name: 6. Fortaleza
info: The fifth-largest city in Brazil is Fortales, the capital of the Cearö state, with a population of over 4 million. Fortaleza, a city on Brazil's northeast coast, is one of the most well-liked travel destinations, drawing more than half a million visitors annually. The city's enticing sunny beaches, vibrant nightlife, and great restaurants are renowned. Fortaleza provides a broad range of water activities, from sailing to windsurfing and jet skiing, thanks to its more than 25 beaches and several fishing communities.

name: 7. The Amazon Rainforest
info: On a trip to the Amazon, you'll learn about the natural healing secrets this region protects, the remarkable animals that make this area home, and a wealth of knowledge about the indigenous people who still call it home. The Amazon jungle, another attraction in Brazil, is the best place to experience true Brazilian nature. If you go during the dry season, you may go on long walks right in the middle of this incredible environment. If you arrive throughout the rainy season, on the other hand, you may explore the endless waterways like an old-world explorer, riding on boats in search of sloths and soaking up one of the most spiritual landscapes on our globe. Remember, though, that December is not the most fantastic time to travel to this area of Brazil.

name: 8. Salvador de Bahia
info: The city of Salvador de Bahia in northern Brazil beats to a single, unique drum that incorporates African music and Caribbean rhythms. The city of Jubilee's founding is still the most vibrant, diverse, and exciting in the country, and a trip there is always enjoyable, even when it isn't Festival season. Salvador, one of the historical destinations to catch a glimpse of in December, is an interesting combination of Portuguese provincial architecture, Caribbean atmosphere, and culture. Joining to create a distinctive air while also drawing on African heritage.

name: 9. Chapada Dos Veadeiros National Park
info: More than 1.8 billion years have likely passed since the formation of Brazil's Chapada dos Veadeiros National Park. A few years following the park's actual completion, it was added to UNESCO's World Heritage Sites list. The greatest thing to do is go bird-watching or even people-watching from this breathtaking site, which features a variety of palm trees and comfortable chairs. The Brazilian government has worked hard to keep the Chapada dos Veadeiros National Park in good condition and accessible to the general public at all times.

name: 10. Lençois National Park
info: Another national park, Lençois National Park, is located in the state of Maranhao in northeastern Brazil. Like most of the parks in Brazil, the park covers a stunning 70 kilometres of beachfront all around it. The region's interior is entirely made up of dunes and rollers, a distinctive feature of this area. While it might seem like a typical sight in the summer, it comes to life and looks impressive when it rains because the dunes are covered in freshwater ponds.

name: 11. Florian?polis
info: Florianopolis, Brazil's most popular tourist destination is home to more than 42 beaches, lagoons, and cascading waterfalls. The Lagoa da Conceiço is well-known among the beaches around Florianópolis. In addition to being a great beach in and of itself, it also happens to be the island's giant lagoon. As a popular tourist attraction, the area teems with restaurants, pubs, markets, and independent stores that will keep you occupied all day. Most visitors to Florianopolis would even want to settle down permanently if given the option due to the high quality of life on offer there.

name: 12. Sao Paulo Museum of Art
info: The biggest city in Brazil, Sao Paulo, has much to offer visitors. It will undoubtedly take you more than a day to see at least the city's key attractions because of how large it is. While in So Paulo, there are many things to do, but at the top of the list should be a trip to the Sao Paulo Museum of Art. It was created by Lina Bo Bardi in 1968 and is now situated on Paulista Avenue. There is no entrance fee for guests because it is a non-profit organization. Brazil has a strong museum and art history scene, and the Sao Paulo Museum of Art appears to be where much of it is stored.

name: 13. Belo Horizonte
info: The English translation of Belo Horizonte is "A Beautiful Horizon." It must be first on your list of places to visit in Brazil. Many environmental education projects spread around the friendly city since it is passionate about protecting its flora and fauna. Visiting the Bela Horizonte Zoo is among the most popular things you may partake in while visiting.

name: 14. Brazil Restaurant and Nightlife
info: This area's greatest eating and nightlife may be found along the beaches of Praia De Iracema and Praia Do Futuro. The most well-known urban beach in the area is Praia do Futuro, where you may sample the local crab. The city is a significant commercial hub renowned for its large malls. Despite the unfortunate fact that Fortaleza has a high crime rate, you should still visit this stunning location if you are going to Brazil.

name: Best Time to Visit Brazil
info: If you have plans to go to Brazil, know that it is such a well-known destination that you may travel there any time of the year. The ideal time to travel here may vary depending on the location you choose to go. Every nation has a different climate, including dry and wet seasons. Travellers should consider visiting Brazil from April through June, while the weather is still favourable.

name: How to Reach Brazil
info: Let us know if you want to fly from India to Brazil if that's what you want to. The largest airports in the nation are found in So Paulo and Rio de Janeiro, and direct flights are offered from the majority of North American cities, several capital cities in South America and Europe, and certain locations in Asia and Africa.

name: How to Reach Brazil from India
info: There are no direct flights from India to Brasilia, as in most South American nations. All flights from India to Brazil stop somewhere along the way. Usually have connections to Sao Paulo, the biggest airport in Brazil, as well as Abu Dhabi or Dubai. From Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Kochi, and Thiruvananthapuram, you may fly to Brazil. Etihad Airways GOL Linhas Aereas and LATAM Airlines Brasil are the two major airlines that fly this route.

name: 1. Vindhyavasini Devi Temple
info: One of India's most recognized Shakti Peeths is this one. The Kajala Devi is another name for the Vindhyavasini Devi. Large groups visited the temple, notably during Navratri in the Hindu months of Chaitra and Ashwin. The period of weddings at this time drew a lot of worshippers to the temple, and the marriage of a couple in Durga's presence is seen as fortunate.

name: 2. Lakhaniya Dari
info: In Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur district, close to Ahraura, lies the magnificent waterfall known as Lakhaniya Dari. It is among the top places to visit in Mirzapur and is one of the most beautiful waterfalls in Uttar Pradesh.

name: 3. Sita Kund
info: One of the sacred sites in the area having ties to the ancient Ramayana narrative is Sita Kund. The story goes that when Goddess Sita was thirsty on her journey from Lanka, Lakshman broke an arrow in the ground to provide water, and the water developed into a never-ending spring.

name: 4. Chunar Fort
info: Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur district is where you will find Chunargarh Fort. Maharaja Vikramaditya, the ruler of Ujjain, erected the Chunargarh Fort in memory of Raja Bharthari, his brother. Additionally known as Chandrakanta Chunargarh and Charanadri, Chunar Fort is a well-known landmark.

name: 5. Ashtabhuja Devi temple
info: In Mirzapur, Uttar Pradesh, the Ashtabhuja Devi temple is found at the peak of Vindhya Mountain. According to Hindu mythology, Vasudev and Devaki had eight children, including Lord Krishna, and the couple's previous six children had all been murdered by King Kansa.

name: 6. Wyndham Falls
info: Uttar Pradesh, particularly Mirzapur, is home to many beautiful locations. One such natural wonder is Wyndham Falls, near Mirzapur and renowned as one of the most picturesque vacation destinations. The Wyndham waterfall, around 15 kilometres from Mirzapur, is frequently crowded with visitors.

name: 7. Tanda Falls
info: One of the most picturesque picnic areas in the area is Tanda Falls near Mirzapur. Due to their tranquil atmosphere and variety of beauty, the natural water stream and water reservoir are popular tourist destinations.

name: 8. Rameshwar Mahadev Temple
info: In the Uttar Pradesh district of Mirzapur, in Vindhyachal, is where you may find the Rameshwar Mahadev Temple. It is situated on Ram Gaya Ghat, a kilometre from Vindhyavasini Devi Temple and around 8 kilometres from Mirzapur. According to mythology, a Shivaling is claimed to have been erected here by Lord Ram, offering it throughout in honour of his ancestors.

name: 9. Agori Fort
info: Agori Fort is a fort found in Uttar Pradesh, India, around 10 km from Chopan, close to Obra, along the Son River, in the district of Mirzapur, which is 35 kilometres from Robertsganj. Kali's temple is located there and is a sacred site for Agori Baba. The Kharwar and Chandel empires lived in Agori Fort as their royal palace.

name: 10. Sirsi Dam
info: The distance from Mirzapur to Sirsi Dam or Sirsi Waterfall is roughly 45 kilometres. The Tanda Falls are not far from the dam; Sirsi Dam was skillfully constructed as a water storage facility. The water falls from a tremendous height at this location, making it magnificent. A visit is highlighted by the beautiful greenery and surrounding natural beauty.

name: 11. Kalikoh Temple
info: A well-known Mahakali temple is Kalhikoh Temple. It is situated in the Vindhya range of mountains and contains a statue of Goddess Kali at the top of the hill. It is set amid little streams and dense, lush forests that offer more than just a Hindu pilgrimage; it also provides a tranquil, calm, and peaceful sight.

name: 12. Kal Bhairav Temple
info: The Kal Bhairav Temple, an ancient temple, is located southwest of Vindhyachal City. The temple is devoted to Shri Kaal Bhairav, also known as Kshetrapal.

name: 13. Meja Dam
info: Famous for its varied greenery is the Meja Dam near Mirzapur. The location is also well-liked by birdwatchers who come here in large numbers to observe the many species of resident and migratory birds. The reservoir, about 50 miles from Mirzapur, is the ideal location for a weekend camping trip.

name: 14. Pakka Ghat
info: A stunning sandstone building with wonderful carvings is the Pakka Ghat. The ghat is beautiful, and the nearby temple gives the place a mysterious feel. Monks and temple worshipers frequently visit the magnificent construction, which features a vast staircase that descends to the water.

name: 15. Jhoolanotsava
info: The Shree Dwarkadheesh Temple, Ganga Jamuna Saraswati Temple, and Kunj Bhuwan are the three principal Hindu temples in the area. They all participate in the Jhoolanotsava or swing festival, which is devoted to the Hindu Gods. At this time, many worshipers crowd the locations of these three temples, often in the summer.

name: 16. Narghat
info: On the riverside of the city of Mirzapur, Narghat is located. According to historical records, there formerly was a tank there by the name of Narain; however, the river eventually consumed it.

name: 17. Kantit Mela
info: One of the well-known special events that both residents and visitors participate in is the Kantit Mela. The mela is a representation of the idea of brotherhood throughout the world. People of many backgrounds attend the celebration to honour the spirit of pleasure and happiness.

name: 18. Sidhnath Ki Dari
info: Siddhnath Baba, who formerly practised meditation here, gave this natural waterfall its name. Both residents and visitors like visiting the location as a vacation, and the ancient rock carvings and paintings are another reason people visit this location.

name: 19. Shiva Temple
info: This significant temple for the people is devoted to Lord Shiva and is situated in the Mahant Shivala region of Mirzapur, Uttar Pradesh, approximately 4. 5 kilometres from the railway station.

info: The best months to visit Mirzapur are November to April, when the weather is at its most excellent.

name: History of Sasharam
info: Sasaram holds an important place in Indian history. The city is the birthplace of the renowned Sur dynasty, whose leader Sher Shah Suri conquered the Mughal Emperor Humayun in the Battle of Chausa (1539) and the Battle of Kanauj or Billgram to gain control over Delhi and the surrounding northern area of the country (1540). King Suri oversaw the city for five years after defeating Humayun, the Mughal emperor. In the centre of an artificial lake in Sasaram, the ancient red sandstone tomb of the Afghan king Sher Shah Suri is 122 feet (37 metres) tall. An Iranian influence may be seen in the blue and yellow glazed tiles used in the Indo-Afghan style construction of the tomb.Sasaram is also home to the mausoleum of Sher Shah Suri's father, Hasan Khan Suri. Both graves bear striking similarities to Buddhist stupas from the Mauryan era. The city also features a historic swimming hole known as the baulia that the monarch frequented for bathing. The town of Sasaram is also home to the well-known Fort at Rohtasgarh. In the seventh century AD, the Fort was constructed. Raja Harishchandra, a Hindu king, built the Fort as a tribute to his son, prince Rohitashwa. During the time of Mughal emperor Akbar, who appointed Raja Man Singh governor of Bengal and Bihar, Man Singh seized the Fort and converted it into an administrative centre.

name: Best Time to Visit
info: Between October and March, you can travel to the revered city of Sasaram to take advantage of the lovely weather. These months experience friendly and calming weather conditions. During these months, one can make the most of their city vacation. Many travel companies and agents can organize and manage your journey to the city at reasonable prices.

name: Places to Visit in Sasaram
info: The city is endowed with several historical and religious sites surrounded by lush vegetation. The city has a mix of traditional, mediaeval, and modern buildings. The city is home to beautifully carved antique structures and well-built contemporary infrastructure. There are many hotspots in the city where you may combine the splendour of the outdoors with historically accurate manufactured buildings. The city is well-known for its illustrious temples and other sites of devotion in the area, in addition to its historical landmarks. Many pilgrims travel annually to Kaimur Mountain's Maa Tara Chandi Temple, as it is a well-known holy location. Due to the city's significance in spiritual and religious matters, its devotional areas are well known throughout the nation.MazharKund and DhuaKund, two well-known waterfalls, are in Sasaram.

name: 1. Sher Shah Suri Tomb
info: One of the most magnificent tombs inIndia is the Sher Shah Suri Tomb, located in the Bihar region of Sasaram. It is a massive monument built in honour of the late emperor Sher Shah Suri and is referred to as the second "Taj Mahal of India."

name: 2. ManjharKund
info: In the Bihar city of Sasaram, there is a waterfall called ManjharKund, and it is an incredible waterfall that produces power. Waterfalls ManjharKund and DhuanKund are located on Kaimur Hill, 10 kilometres from Sasaram. The Guru Granth Sahib was traditionally carried according to ancient history. Sikh community members used to spend three days on the ManjharKund. The water of the Kund is considered to be rich in natural minerals and highly beneficial to digestion.

name: 3. Maa Tara Chandi Temple
info: In a natural cave on the Kaimur hill in the Vindhya mountain range, Maa Tara is located in Sasaram. The Kharwar dynasty monarch, Mahanayak Pratap Dhavaldev of the twelfth century, has a large inscription written by his son Shatrudhan next to the goddess statue. The idol of Maa Tara features four hands, just like Mother Tara's form is depicted in Tantras and iconography. The left-hand holds a hood and a lotus, and the right hand has a knife and a pair of scissors. On top of the corpse, the left foot is forward. Short in stature, with a lambodar and indigo appearance. The cut is covered in tiger skin.The fragmentary figure of Agni outside and the statues of Maa Tara and Surya inside the Maa Tara temple complex are all from the late Gupta or later Gupta periods. The fact that the Kharwar king left an inscription here indicates that Tarachandi Devi's popularity was already well-known at the time.

name: 4. Tomb of Hasan Khan Suri
info: From 1535 to 1540, Sasaram was the Suri Dynasty's political and religious hub. Hasan Khan Suri and Ibrahim Ali Khan Suri travelled to India from Afghanistan. Jaigirdari, or Zamindari, was once bestowed to the courageous Pathans in Punjab. However, they arrived in Bihar as a result of some changes. They were first at Joanpur before moving to Sasaram. Hasan Khan Suri preserved the Suri Dynasty's cornerstone and lived honourably. But after passing away, he was cremated in Sasaram. His son Sher Shah Suri erected a mausoleum in his final resting place. The Hasan Khan Suri Tomb is located in Sasaram next to the Sher Shah Suri Tomb.

name: 5. Rohtasgarh Fort
info: Sasaram's major city is 39 kilometres away from Rohtasgarh Fort. Raja Harish Chandra erected the Fort in memory of his son. One of the most prominent and most potent forts on the hills was considered to be the Fort. Over 4 kilometres from east to west, the Fort is dispersed throughout the mountains. Raja Man Singh, the administrator of Bengal and Bihar during the Mughal era, later utilized the Fort as his administrative centre. The Fort was thought to include several hidden passages that would allow the royal people to flee in case of need. The Rohtas fort is a magnificent illustration of mediaeval architecture. One of India's once-largest and most powerful forts is now in ruins. A Rajputana-style Ganesh mandir has been erected inside the Fort. According to history, the Mandir was constructed during the reign of Man Singh.

name: 6. Tomb of Chandan Shaheed
info: The construction of the Tomb of Chandan Shaheed took place during the reign of the Mughal emperor Jahangir. The tomb is a long-gone mosque with Arabic and Urdu inscriptions. The mosque is supported by a dome and encircled by enormous pillars. The mosque's architecture is an eclectic fusion of Indo-Islamic design. According to historians, the mosque was constructed so the emperor could communicate with the Almighty. The Chandan Shaheed hills are where the tomb was built. The location is one of the most frequented in the city and draws several people each year.

name: 7. Chaurasan Mandir
info: One mile separates the Chandan Shaheed hills from the well-known shrine of Chaurasan Mandir. The city's Hindu lords constructed the temple during the Middle Ages. Lord Shiva was honoured in the temple. The temple experiences a significant influx of visitors all year long. The number of individuals visiting the religious site significantly rises during Shiva Ratri. Numerous sculptures have been carved into the temple's walls, constructed in the traditional Indian manner. Every sculpture represents a Hindu rite or custom. Because of the surrounding vegetation, the temple is much more beautiful. The temple is not only a spiritual location but also significant historically.With time, several components of the temple have deteriorated or been damaged. However, the local government is government in maintaining the old temple.

name: 8. Tara Chandi Hills
info: One kilometre separates Tara Chandi Hill from Chandan Shaheed Hill. Additionally, this temple has spiritual and religious values.The Hindu goddess Kali is honoured in the Tara Chandi hill temple.

name: 9. BhaluniDham
info: BhaluniDham is situated in the Vikramganj region close to Natwar. The locals often refer it Bhaluni Dham as Yakshini Mandir. The Hindu goddess Durga is honoured in the historic temple. The holy site is situated on the edge of a stunning lake. In the sixth century, the temple was planned and constructed. The temple is also referred to by its people as the Jakhini Mai temple. Every Chitra Navratra, a fair is organised near the shrine. Only a tiny piece of the temple is destroyed or damaged. But even so, the temple is stunning. In the area, Bhaluni Dham is now the venue of most pilgrimages.

name: 10. Indrapuri dam
info: Sasaram's IndraPuri Dam has become one of the most popular picnic spots. The massive dam was constructed on the Son River, a tributary of the mighty Ganga. Many people attend the picnic area during the public holidays since everyone wants to spend time with their family. Due to the River's lower water level, which makes the location appear like a little island, the area experienced a massive inflow of visitors in January. Few enjoy taking river baths and participating in water sports with their families. Few people enjoy sunbathing amidst the tranquil beauty of nature.Between Kadwan in the Garhwa district of Jharkhand and Matiwan in the Rohtas district of Bihar, a dam is proposed to be built across the Son.

name: 11. Tutrahi Waterfalls
info: It's another fantastic location to enjoy quality time with loved ones and friends. Greenery and beautiful scenery envelop the waterfall. During the winter, little coloured flowers cover the mountainous terrain. The area has grown to be one of the most well-liked spots in the city, where locals like hosting informal family gatherings. The site is arc-shaped, and the hills on both sides contribute to the region's generally temperate climate. Here, water falls from 100 metres, creating a foamy torrent and earning the area the additional name of Dhua Jharna. The local wildlife can also be investigated. Animals such as langoors, deers, and squirrels are readily apparent nearby.

name: 12. Shergarh
info: Shergarh is located 10 kilometres northwest of Shergarh, a well-known fort built in the Khaimur highlands. In the years 1540 to 1545, the Chenari region saw the construction of the Fort by Emperor Sher Shah Suri. Historians say the king constructed the Fort for his Hindu wife after defeating Humayun in Delhi. Few scholars argue that the Fort served as the administrative centre of Suri's dominion and was constructed for security reasons. There are many temples, cemeteries, and emambaras in the Fort. The monument's fortification offered security to the king's adherents.

name: 1. Khwaja Bande Nawaz Dargah
info: Visit the Khwaja Bande Nawaz Dargah to see a rare convergence of religious diversity. This is the tomb of the famous Sufi mystic Khwaja Bande Nawaz. This mausoleum, which houses a large library with over ten thousand books in Urdu, Arabic, and Persian, is one of the most visited sites in Gulbarga.

name: 2. The Buddha Vihar
info: If you enjoy peace, Buddha Vihar is the place to be. It is nestled among arrant tranquillity and serenity. The monument, which is located within Gulbarga University, is a significant Buddhist pilgrimage centre built in traditional Indian Buddhist styles. The Vihar is located in Gulbarga, which is also known as Kalaburagi Buddha Vihar; formally inaugurated by Tibet's spiritual leader, the Dalai Lama, and stands as a shrine to nonviolence and world peace. Remember that the site is closed every day between 12 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.

name: 3. Gulbarga Fort
info: This fort, arguably Gulbarga's most popular tourist attraction, was built in the twelfth century by Kakatiya king Raja Gulchand. This granite monument has a stunning façade with a lovely blend of Persian and Indian architecture. The Fort was expanded by the Bahmani rulers two hundred years later to form a formidable barrier to invaders. The structure, which has 15 towers, is sure to make you marvel at the glory of the rulers of old. With its spires and columns, the Jama Masjid located inside warms the soul. You can also picnic with your loved ones inside the fort's ruins!

name: 4. Sharana Basaveshwara Temple
info: Sharana Basaveshwara Temple, also known as Sabhamandapa, is located in Gulbarga. It is a sacred site dedicated to Saint Basaveshwara, who is known as a teacher, philosopher, and enlightened being who made numerous significant contributions to society while practising Hinduism. This temple, built in the twelfth century by the Lingayat saint Sharana Basaveshwara, is a work of Hindu stone carving art.

name: 5. Chandrampalli Dam
info: The Chandrampalli dam is located in the district of Gulbarga, Karnataka. It is one of the primary dams built on the Bhima River's bed (in 1973). The thick forests of Gotham Gotta surround the dam. On the Dam, there is an island that has drawn many tourists and visitors. The Dam is approximately 28.65 metres tall and 926 metres long. The town's pleasant weather is complemented by the stunning scenery of the two mountains linked by the Dam. The area has become well-known for its trekking and camping opportunities. Because the Chandrampalli dam is earthen, it is made of sand, loam, clay, and other materials.

name: 6. Jama Masjid
info: Jama Masjid is a 14th-century mosque in Gulbarga, Karnataka. It is part of the Gulbarga Fort complex, which commemorates the establishment of the Bahmani Kingdom in the Deccan. The mosque was one of the first in South India. The Jama Masjid Gulbarga and the Spanish Mosque of Hyderabad (built inside Paigah Palace) are the only two Indian mosques that reflect the essence of Spanish architecture. They both have interiors similar to the Great Cathedral-Mosque of Cordoba, Spain.

name: 7. Haft Gumbaz
info: The Haft Gumbaz, also spelled Haft Gumbad, are a collection of Bahmani dynasty tombs in Gulbarga, Karnataka, India. The tombs, which were built in the 14th and 15th centuries, are examples of early Indo-Islamic architecture. There are seven tombs in total, four of which are the tombs of the Bahmani dynasty's rulers. The Archeological Survey of India looks after the tomb complex as a national monument. The tomb complex is part of the "Monuments and Forts of the Deccan Sultanate," an ensemble of various structures that has been added to the UNESCO World Heritage List as a tentative listing.

name: 1. Joychandi Pahar
info: Joychandi Pahar, one of the main attractions in the area, is a paradise for skilled rock climbers. The Goddess Chandi is the inspiration behind the name of the Pahar, or hill, and her shrine may be seen at its top.

name: 2. Ajodhya Hills
info: The Ajodhya hills are another well-liked Purulia destination. The hills, a part of the Dalma mountain range, have legendary importance. It is said that Lord Rama and Sita resided here when they were in exile.

name: 3. Saheb Bandh
info: This significant tourist attraction in Purulia is a large lake that occupies a 50-acre area. Migratory birds gather at the sparkling lake in large numbers, and Birds go to this lovely location during the winter from as far away as Siberia and Baluchistan. Saheb Bandh is thus an excellent spot for someone who enjoys bird watching.

name: 4. Gajaburu Hills
info: Gajaburu hills, located around 59 kilometres from the Purulia district, are another excellent location for adventure seekers. The Gajaburu hills' rocky and rugged slopes make it a thrilling adventure location where visitors may engage in rock climbing, hiking, camping, or relaxing. You will be fascinated by the attractive environment and alluring beauty.

name: 5. Doldanga
info: On the banks of Kangsabati, there sits this lovely pool of water. In recent years, this location has become a tourist destination because of its beautiful surroundings and healthy atmosphere.

name: 6. Branti Reservoir or Muradi Lake
info: The Branti reservoir is an excellent choice if you wish for serenity in nature. This location offers a lovely view and a peaceful setting and is a favourite among local tourists.

name: 7. Cheliama
info: Cheliama, a village with a long and rich history, is one of Purulia's most well-liked tourist spots, and this region is home to many temples, which are 17th-century architectural masterpieces.

name: 8. Surulia
info: Surulia is a well-known eco-park that is only 6 kilometres away from the main town. One of the most popular destinations in the area is this eco-park, located on the banks of the river Kangsabati. Due to the several kinds of deer that are kept and protected here, this eco-park is also known as a "deer park."

name: 9. Murugama Dam
info: Stunning sunrises and fascinating sunsets may be seen at Muruguma Dam, a popular tourist site. It might be an unforgettable experience to spend an evening here amidst the stunning scenery and refreshing air. Other options include hiking to the top of the hills or wandering around the local communities.

name: 10. Garpanchkot
info: It is located in the northeastern portion of the Purulia District, near the border with the districts of Burdwan and Jharkhand, at the bottom of Panchakot (Panchet Hill).

name: 11. Para
info: The town of Para is a beautiful tourist destination and serves as a reminder of the arrival of Muslims in the east. The location has two pre-Muslim deuls.

name: 12. Deulghat
info: Deulghat is a place where temples are found, according to their name. There are roughly 15 temples in the area surrounding the Kansai River. One of the main factors making Deulghat one of the most popular tourist destinations in Purulia is the temple's outstanding architecture, which is complemented by its elegant decorations.

name: 13. Matha
info: The Matha Buru is a slope with a reputation for elegant beauty. On the hill, there is a "Mela" by tribal people. The particular association often conducts rock climbing classes and runs camps during the winter, and there were 31 camps with over 2000 high school and college students. People from the Forest Protection Committee provide food for the camp, and some serve as neighbourhood helpers.

name: 14. Baranti
info: Baranti is a tiny, peaceful, and beautiful place. Between two little hilltops, Muradi Hill and Baranti Hill there lies a 2 km long irrigation project dam. The Ramchandrapur Irrigation Project is close to Baranti, and Baranti offers a magnificent view of the reservoir.

name: 15. Tugga And Bramni Falls
info: Popular picnic locations include Tugga and Bramni Falls, which are close to Baghmundi. These dams are located in beautiful areas. Tall Sal trees across the region provide evidence of the area's rich past. There are several species of birds that live in the various trees. It is the ideal location for spending a relaxing day with loved ones.

name: 16. Duarsini
info: Duarsini is a little tribal community located in the Puruliya area. The Dalma Hills' scenic environment, complete with rolling hills and green vegetation, gives this community its whole charm.

name: 17. Pakhi Pahar
info: Rock climbers are attracted to The Bird's Hill, also known as "Pakhi Pahar." Visit the hill, which features roughly 65 birds that a group of artisans skillfully crafted. The Pardi Dam, which is around 12 kilometres from Charida, is another place where one may enjoy the natural beauty.

name: 18. Durga Bera
info: Durga Bera is a manufactured water body that is 40 feet deep. It produces stunning colouring when the sky is clear, and the water turns blue and seems clear, clean, and fresh. As a result, this location is also known as "Nil Jal".

name: How to Reach
info: The closeness of Purulia to the state of West Bengal and its capital, Kolkata, makes it an ideal vacation destination. This location, 312 kilometres from Kolkata, is easily reachable by various transportation options.

name: Best Time to Visit
info: Purulia's weather is humid and hot for nearly half of the year. The lovely weather and excellent environment make winter the most outstanding season to visit. The best months to visit are from October until March, when the temperature is comfortable.

name: (1) Kaman
info: Popularly known for being a part of Brij Bhoomi, Kaman is an old town in Bharatpur, and it is also called Kamaban. Brij Bhoomi is the place where Lord Krishna spent most of his childhood days, and it is the most worshipped place by Lord Krishna devotees. Including the Chakras Khamba Temple, one of the most popular temples all over India, Kaman has a total of 84 temples which makes it more famous among visitors. This temple has 84 intricate carved pillars on its walls, and one of the unique things about this temple is that it has no idol for worship but is still known as a temple. The beautiful carving and architectural style of the temple attract tourists to visit Bharatpur from all corners of India.

name: (2) Jawahar Burj
info: Jawahar Burj, which is positioned at the Lohagarh Fort, Gopalgarh, Bharatpur, was constructed as a victory tower and a coronation site for the Jat rulers, and there are three mandapas in this place. Out of these three mandapas, there is one which has paintings of epic scenes, and there is also a hammam or royal bathhouse with frescoes and intricate carvings. A part of this place has full portraits of Maharajas who are posing with their animal trophies, and this place is beautifully decorated with frescoes. These frescoes are currently in the state of extinction, and in this place, there is an inscribed iron pillar having genealogical carvings of the rulers. This place tells the stories of incredible battles fought between great kings, surviving, it's winning, and there is also an Ashtadhatu Gate in this place which also allures visitors from all parts of India. All these interesting things and facts about this place make it a must-visit one for the tourists while having a trip to Bharatpur, and the timings of this place are from 10 in the morning to 8 in the evening.

name: (3) Chawad Devi Temple
info: Chawad Devi Temple, which stands as a token of the tradition, culture, and history of the region, is a lovely tourist attraction in Bharatpur, and this temple is seldom populated. This means that this temple allows tourists to be immense themselves in solitude so that they can use this temple to revive their drained energy, and a visit to this peaceful temple allows the visitors to rejuvenate and relax in the serenity and peace that pervades the air of this temple. To experience a magical moment in this temple, tourists should visit the temple in the early morning time. This temple is open for 24 hours, and there is no entry fee charged to visitors.

name: (4) Seetharam Temple
info: Seetharam Temple, which is positioned inside the Keoladeo Ghana National Park, Bharatpur, is one of the serene places to visit in the district and a beautiful place to catch up on some serenity and healing solitude. Seetharam Temple is a small but scenic place which is located deep inside the national temple, and it allures tourists to come and enjoy the serenity of this nature. This temple is a lovely place close to the natural bounty of nature, and the only thing which will disturb the meditations of the visitors is the play of monkeys and the call of birds. There is one more temple positioned close to this temple, and that temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva. There is a popular legend about this temple which makes this temple a truly holy spot, and according to this legend, the lingum present in the temple originated from the earth around 300 years ago. There is no entry fee charged for the visitors to enter the temple, and its timings are from 8 in the morning to 5 in the evening.

name: (5) Band Baretha
info: Positioned approximately 45 KMs from the main city of Bharatpur, Band Baretha is the large town of the district and one of the major tourist attractions of the city. It is also one of the most popular tourist destinations of the city because one can enjoy various attractions of the town in its environs. The heritage and influence on the architecture of the town by the Mughals clearly depicts how long the history of this town had been associated with the Mughal's rule, and this can also be seen in its manifold monuments. Some of the most famous historical attractions in Band Baretha include the BarahKhambonki Chhatri and the old fort. Apart from these attractions of the town, the dam located on the Kakund River is also a great spot for the visitors where they can visit for some frolicking and picnicking.

name: (6) Dholpur Palace
info: The glamorous Dholpur Palace, which is positioned at the Nihal Ganj, Dholpur, Bharatpur, is one of the best palaces to visit in the whole of Rajasthan, and it is beautiful tourist sight to behold. Popularly known as Raj Niwas Palace, Dholpur Palace is very attractive in that it catches the eyes of everyone from afar, and it was built in the early 19th century. The intricate architecture of the temple makes it interesting to gaze upon and adds meaning and depth to the structure. Tourists can spend some hours here enjoying their time in Bharatpur, and walking through the red sandstone halls of this palace is a unique experience in itself. The mellowing sun adds a magical quality to this palace, and therefore, evening, in particular, is a fantastic time to spend in the Dholpur Palace. There is no entry fee charged from the visitors to enter the palace, and its timings are from 6 in the morning to 7 in the evening.

name: (7) Deeg
info: Deeg, which is positioned approximately 32 KMs to the north of the main city of Bharatpur, is a small but fascinating town in the district, and any visitor, who wants to explore the city around Bharatpur, cannot afford to miss visiting this town during their trip. The two most popular attractions of this town are the three-day Diwali festival, which is usually celebrated in the month of September here, and the Deeg Palace complex. The structure of Deeg Palace is wrought in the traditional Rajasthani style, and it is an imposing structure which allures many tourists to this town. This Deeg Palace is constructed in a unique manner in that countless palaces, and water gardens are interwoven with a series of Charbaghs. A magnificent way to spend some hours in the Deeg is roaming the grounds of this palace with friends or special ones. One more site that adds character to the region is the Deeg Fort, which attracts visitors with its pleasant and intricate architecture, and it is also known as Jal Mahal popularly.

name: (8) Government Museum Bharatpur
info: The government museum of Bharatpur, which is located inside the Lohagarh Fort, contains a lot of interesting artefacts, which are related to the tradition, history, and art of the city, and that's how this museum is a strong reflection of the culture of this area. The main attraction of this Government Museum consists of the local artthat, miniature paintings, weapons, coins, metallic objects, terracotta items, inscriptions, stone sculptures, and many more, and all of them have been housed in this museum for years. Inside the museum, the art gallery, which is also open for public viewing, contains miniature paintings on leaves of old litho papers, mica, and Peepal tree. For tourists, a good way to spend some time in the city is by admiring the grand views and the artefacts and spending some couple of hours inside the museum with family or friends. INR 20 as an entry fee is charged from the visitors to enter the museum, and its timings are from 9 in the morning to 5 in the evening.

name: (9) Laxman Mandir
info: Laxman Mandir, which is positioned at the Tara Mahendra Colony, Bharatpur, have imposing idols, grandiose arches, embellished walls, and Intricately carved doors, and all of these characteristics of the temple make it one of the best tourist destinations in Bharatpur. Inside the halls of this temple, a wealth of culture and history is inscribed, which makes it one of the most popular temples in whole Rajasthan, and many visitors come to Bharatpur from all over India just to visit this temple. The Laxman Mandir contains statues of Lord Laxman and his wife Urmila, and it was built in order to pay tributes to the brotherly virtues of Lord Laxman, brother of Lord Rama. Apart from the statues of Lord Rama and his wife Urmila, statues of Lord Ram, Bharat, Shatrughan, and Lord Hanuman are also present in this temple. The statues are made up of a unique combination of 8 metals, popularly known as "Ashtdhaatu", and these statues are particularly renowned for their uniqueness. To experience the beauty of Rajasthani culture in a different way, tourists should visit this beautiful temple at least once in their life. There is no entry fee charged from the visitors to enter the temple, and its timings are from 7 in the morning to 7 in the evening.

name: (10) Ganga Mandir
info: Ganga Mandir, which is positioned at the Pai Bagh, Bharatpur, is one of the most famous tourist destinations of the district because of its unique history; this temple was constructed in 1845. It took around 90 years to complete the construction of this temple, and the result of this long construction is an immaculate and beautiful structure present in the heart of the busy city. The hall of this temple is adorned by many striking idols of popular kings in the history of Bharatpur. Among these striking idols, the statue of Ganga Maharaj is the most awe-inspiring one, and other than this, the statue of King Bhagiratha, which is 4 feet tall, is another marvellous sight that the temple boast of. The statue of Ganga Maharaj stands imposingly in the temple, and it is entirely made up of Marble. Tourists, who are visiting Bharatpur city, should include this temple, which offers a deep combination of divinity and purity, in their list. There is no entry fee charged from the visitors to enter the temple, and its timings are from 5 in the morning to 9 in the evening.

name: (11) Bharatpur Palace And Museum
info: Positioned in the main city of Bharatpur, Bharatpur Palace And Museum is one of the best tourist attractions to visit in Bharatpur, and it is an imposing and elegant structure. This palace cum museum offers an interesting insight into Bharatpur's lifestyle, and it is a reflection of the heritage and culture of this old Rajasthan city. The style of this palace makes it a unique style of the monument because the structure of this palace fuses the Rajput and Mughal style structure, and the decorated walls and richly patterned flooring add glamour to the palatial apartments. Kamra Khas, which is a museum, is also present inside this palace, and this museum contains ancient scriptures & craft wares that depict the typical culture and art of Bharatpur, 861 local art, over 581 stone sculptures, and a vast number of antiques. The timings of Bharatpur Palace And Museum are from 9 in the morning to 5:30 in the evening.

name: (12) Bankey Bihari Temple
info: Bankey Bihari Temple, which is positioned inside the Lohagarh Fort, Gopalgarh, Bharatpur, is a world-famous and delightful temple in the city, and it was built during the Mughal rule on the town. This temple is a perfect spot to revive oneself and pleasant to look upon, and it is also one of the most popular temples in Rajasthan. This temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna, and tourists, especially the Lord Krishna devotees, come from all over India to visit this temple. The soothing gongs that reverberate the still air inside the temple, as well as the peace and silence that hang around the temple, are perfect for building a serene and auspicious atmosphere inside the temple. There are houses inside the temple, and these houses have several idols, which can be seen celebrating the power and virtue of Lord Krishna. INR 20 as an entry fee is charged from the visitors to enter the temple, and its timings are from 9 in the morning to 5 in the evening.

name: (13) Lohagarh Fort
info: Lohagarh Fort, which is positioned at the Gopalgarh, Bharatpur, is one of the strongest structures in the whole state, and it is also known as Iron Fort because of this. This fort was built in the early 18th century, and because of its unassailable defence quality, Jat ruler Maharaja Suraj Mal gave this fort its powerful name at that time. Because of its strength, and historical significance, this fort is among the best tourist attractions for visitors to visit during their trip to Bharatpur. The calm, strength air of the Lohagarh Fort and its austere and imposing qualities allure tourists from all over India to visit this fort at least once in their life. The government museum is also housed inside the fort, and the museum in itself is another tourist attraction where visitors can learn about the art & culture of the city. Another reason visiting this fort is known to be a visual treat is that the fort also commands grand views of the region. INR 20 as an entry fee is charged from the visitors to enter the temple, and its timings are from 10 in the morning to 6 in the evening.

name: (14) Keoladeo Ghana National Park
info: Positioned at the Agra-Jaipur Highway, Bharatpur, Keoladeo Ghana National Park is the main reason behind the popularity of Bharatpur all over India, and this national park is popularly known as Bharatpur Bird sanctuary. The intensity of the wildlife tourists can experience in this national park is startling, and this national park is one of the must-visit tourist destinations in the city. This sanctuary or national park has a wide variety of flora and fauna, and it is well-known for the hordes of birds that its hosts year-round; all of these qualities of this national park make this tourist destination a widely active place all year. Most of the migratory birds arrive in the sanctuary by the time of October-November, and that's why this time is considered the best time to visit this sanctuary. During this time, one can witness lots of rush in Keoladeo Ghana National Park because tourists from all over India come to witness the place's chirp and bustle, making it more magnificent. If one wants to explore inside the national park for multiple hours, then one can also choose to stay at the accommodations which are also available inside the sanctuary. The timings of this national park are from 8 in the morning to 5 in the evening, and INR 50 for Indians & INR 400 for foreigners are charged as the entry fee for this national park, and INR 100 from all those visitors who want to opt for a rickshaw ride.

name: Tourist Hotspots in Palampur
info: The monastery is located 15 kilometres away from the main district. It is situated in Tashi Jong village. It is one of the centre-point of tourist attractions in Palampur. The Tibetan monastery is surrounded by hills, lush green plants, and the beautiful Himalayas. The building is decorated with Buddha statues, carvings, and paintings. The 8th Khamtrul Rinpoche founded the monastery, and the monastery believes in the Drugpa Kagyu sect (one of the sects of Buddhism). Society and community practice Drukpa Kagyu tradition, and they follow acetic yoga. Indian Tantric Yogi deeply influenced the Kagyu School- Tilopa emerged through Mahamudra meditation. Later, Tibetan came out with a technique, namely Kadampa; both resulted in the establishment of Drukpa Kagyu School. The main temple is constructed in the inner complex of the monastery, and the stupa of the Yamantaka retreat Centre and Khamtrul Rinpoche is restricted to the ordinary public. Khamtrul Rinpoche crafted this monastery. The monastery has an excellent collection of craft and art displays and many Tibetan artifacts. The ambiance present around the monastery is serene, blissful, and immersing. The place is paradise and an excellent place to detox your inner soul.

name: (1) Unchalli Falls
info: Unchalli Falls, which is positioned near Sirsi in Uttara Kannada District of Karnataka, India, is a waterfall created by a 116-metre (381 ft) drop in the Aghanashini river, and it is also known as Lushington Falls. The falls were discovered by J D Lushington, who worked as a District Collector here under British Government, in 1945, and that's why these falls are named after him. Heggarne, which is positioned only 33 Kms from Sirsi, is a hamlet in Uttar Kannada district, and one can choose to trek 5 Kilometers (approximately 3 miles) from here to reach the Unchalli Falls through the thick forest. Here the river leaps into a steep valley to form a picturesque, spectacular waterfall view, and it also makes a cavalcade of the waterfall. Because of the deafening sound produced by the falls, these falls are sometimes called Keppa Joga by the native people of the city.

name: (2) Tattihallia Dam
info: Tattihallia Dam, which is positioned near Dandeli in Uttar Kannada district of Karnataka, India, is a small reservoir, and it is also known as Tattihalla Dam. This dam is one of the most popular tourist destinations in the city, and it is beautifully positioned between the forest and mountains. This dam is a source of livelihood for the surrounding rural people, and it is positioned only 3 KM from Bhagawati (haliyal taluk). This is a very nice dam & great fishing spot, and one can reach this dam by bike, car or any other four-wheeler. There is also a tar road which is connecting the dam with the main route, but this road needs to improve more, and overall, this dam is a great spot to enjoy and spend some time with family and friends.

name: (3) Supa Dam
info: Supa Dam, positioned near the town of Ganeshgudi (near Dandeli) in Uttara Kannada, is built across the Kali River, and there is a powerhouse at the foot of this dam. There are two electricity generators of 50 MW each are built inside this powerhouse, and the reservoir and dam are the biggest reason for the survival of wildlife around the area. The gigantic dam is a must-visit place in the Uttara Kannada, and the view around the dam is totally amazing. The blue water flowing in the river and the greenery all around is a perfect sight to enjoy with family and friends.

name: (4) Shivapura Hanging Bridge
info: Shivapura Hanging Bridge, which is positioned just 5 KMs away from the popular tourist spot Sathodi falls, is one of the most beautiful tourist destinations of the district, and it is located near Yellapur in Uttara Kannada district. This bridge is built on the backwaters of Kodasalli Reservoir, a reservoir which is formed by the Kali River, and it is pure bliss for all visitors to ride on this bridge. Getting to this is an adventure ride in itself, and it is a perfect place for nature lovers and bird watchers. The bridge is one of the must-visit places for photographers and nature lovers because the bridge is surrounded by green hills with clouds flying, which makes a stunning view around the bridge.

name: (5) Shivaganga Falls
info: Shivaganga Waterfalls, which is positioned near Sirsi in Uttara Kannada, falls from a height of 242 feet from the top, and it is one of the lesser-known and explored waterfalls of the state. Hidden in thick forestland, which is located very closely to Sirsi, Ankola and Yellapur Taluks of Uttara Kannada, Shivaganga Waterfall is a part of the Western Ghats of the state, and Shalmala River is the source river of this waterfall. To reach the waterfall, one has to trek down 3 Kilometers through the forest, and that's why this waterfall has become a must-visit tourist destination for all trek enthusiasts.

name: (6) Shirley Falls
info: Positioned near Yellapur, in Uttara Kannada, Shirley Falls is also known as Shirale Falls, and it is a very scenic waterfall that allures tourists from all over India. Many travellers or visitors, who visit the city, remain unaware of Shirley Falls because this fall is hidden inside the Arabail Ghat, and to reach this fall, one has to drive 15 minutes from small town Yellapur, which is followed by a trek on a muddy road of 2 km (30-minute scenic trekking). This 30-minute trek is known as very scenic because visitors during the trek walk through the jungle and speak with nature under the private areca palms, and this fall is positioned approximately 13 Km from Yellapur.

name: (7) Sathodi Falls
info: Sathodi Falls, which is positioned near Yellapur, in Uttara Kannada district, falls from a height of 50 feet, and it is also one of the lesser-known and explored waterfalls of the state. Being a beautiful hidden waterfall in the Western Ghats, Sathodi Waterfalls gives mesmerizing views to visitors, and it is formed by a number of unnamed streams. The streams, which form the Sathodi Waterfall, flow into the backwaters of the Kodasalli Dam, which is positioned on the Kali River after the streams fall from the height. The 5 KM range road near the waterfall is in very good condition; otherwise, the road to the waterfall is not in good condition, and despite the condition of the road, the road to the falls is never dangerous for visitors or anyone. The falls become heaven for nature lovers during the monsoon time, and there is a 1 KM long concrete walk path starting from the parking area to the foot of the falls. Visitors can also take a dip in the clean and crystal water during the months of December to March, and it is also known to be the best time for visiting this fall. Shivapura hanging bridge, which is a hanging bridge, positioned 5 KMs from the falls during the way, gives mesmerizing views of the surrounding hills and backwaters, and it was constructed on the backwaters of the Kodasalli dam across the hills.

name: (8) Sadashivgad Fort
info: Sadashivgad Fort, which is now a popular tourist destination located by the Kali river bridge, is a very picturesque and significant place for the native people as well as for visitors, and it is positioned in Karwar, Uttara Kannada district. Counted among one of the best forts of the northern region of the state, Sadashivgad Fort has been built at the confluence of the Arabian Sea and the Kali River.

name: (9) Om Beach
info: Om Beach, which is positioned in Gokarna in Uttara Kannada district of Karnataka, is one of the fantastic and beautiful beaches of the state, and it derives its name from its shape. The shape of this beach is in the form of the classic Sanskrit word Om in Hindi, and that's why it became popular with Om Beach's name only. There are steps leading down to the beach, and tourists can choose to watch amazing sunrise and sunset views and do trekking from there. Om Beach, located approximately 5 km from Gokarn temple, also offers many water adventures and sports for the visitors, such as Kayaking, Banana Boat, and many others. Thousands of visitors come to Gokarna every year from all over India to soak themselves on this beautiful beach and for pilgrims as well.

name: (10) Murudeshwara Beach
info: Murudeshwara Beach, which is positioned only 12km from Bhatkal in Uttara Kannada, is known for its beautiful beach, the tallest statue of lord Shiva, and ancient temple, and it is a major pilgrimage and beach destination of the state. Murudeshwara Beach is a perfect picnic spot for visitors to spend quality time with family or friends, and it is positioned overlooking the monumental statue of Lord Shiva, and this statue of Lord Shiva, which is located on the lap of the Arabian sea in Murudeshwara, is the second biggest statue of Lord Shiva in the whole world after the biggest one positioned in Nepal. The statue is built on Kanduka Hill, a typical Uttara Kannada hill which is surrounded by the Arabian Sea on three sides, and the view of the temple built on the beach is magnificent.

name: (11) Murudeshwar
info: Murudeshwar, which is known for its beach, tallest statue of Lord Shiva, and ancient temple, is positioned approximately 12 KMs from Bhatkal in the Uttara Kannada district, and it is a major pilgrimage and beach destination for all visitors. Tourists can here enjoy boat rides around the magnificent Murudeshwar Temple, and this is also a perfect picnic spot for families and loved ones. Murudeshwar is popular for having the tallest statue of Lord Shiva all in the world after the statue of Lord Shiva is present in Nepal, and it is positioned overlooking this monumental statue. Both the statue and temple are present on the beach in Murudeshwara, and the statue is positioned on the lap of the Arabian Sea. Tourists can witness the breathtaking and magnificent view of the statue of Lord Shiva from the top of the Gopura, which is the temple's main entrance, and it stands at the height of 123 feet. All these attractions and alluring features of the Murudeshwar make it one of the best and most beautiful tourist destinations of Uttara Kannada, and tourists can visit this spot throughout the year.

name: (12) Mirjan Fort
info: The Mirjan Fort, which was the location of several battles in the past, is known for its elegant architecture, and it is positioned on the west coast of the Uttar Kannada district. This fort is a very popular Hindu pilgrimage centre on the west coast of India, and it is only half a kilometer from the NH (National Highway) 66 and 11 KMs from Gokarna. Queen Chennabhairadevi of Gersoppa, a place which was under the Vijayanagara Empire, was initially credited for the construction of this fort in the early 16th century, according to the earlier historical versions. During the reign of the queen, the port of Mirjan was used for shipping betel nut, saltpeter, and pepper to Surat, Gujarat, and she lived in the fort during her entire ruling period of 54 years. Queen of Gersoppa, a district which was famous for the export of pepper, was given the epithet "Rainha de Pimenta" (which translates to "Rani, the Pepper queen") by the Portuguese because of pepper export only.

name: (13) Magod Falls
info: Magod Falls, which is positioned only 17 km from the town of Yellapur, in the district of Uttara Kannada, is a group of waterfalls in the state, and in this fall, the source River Bedti falls from a height of around 200m in two steps. It is one of the best tourist destinations of Uttara Kannada, which most tourists love to visit during their trip to the city, and these falls are easily accessible from several lakes and towns.

name: (14) Lalguli Falls
info: Lalguli Falls, which was created by River Kali, is positioned near Lalguli village in Uttara Kannada district, and it is an exotic waterfall present only 15 KMs from Yellapur. This waterfall attracts visitors from all over India throughout the year because it provides a peaceful and serene environment, and it is also a perfect spot for photographers and nature enthusiasts because of its natural scenic beauty. When the River Kali rolls down the rocky steps from a height of around 250 feet, it creates this famous Lalguli Falls and the best time to visit this waterfall is from October to December because, in the summer season, it gets dry. Many tourists are not able to locate the falls as it's inside the dense forest, and therefore, they have to take help from local people to reach the falls.

name: (15) Kuli Magod Waterfall
info: There are many tourist attractions present around the Magod Waterfall, and only Kuli Magod Waterfall among all of them stands out as the most popular and beautiful one. The Kuli Magod Waterfall, in which 'Kuli' means 'Pond' in Kannada, is formed by a tiny tributary of River Bedti, and it stands out because of its accessibility and sheer beauty. The relatively easy accessibility of this tourist attraction made it a not-to-be-missed tourist destination for visitors who are nature lovers and traveling to Magod Travels. Usually, in the Uttara Kannada district, it requires a great amount of trekking from the visitors to reach the foot of any waterfall in the city, but this is not the with the Kuli Magod Waterfall, which makes is one of the most famous waterfalls in the state. Tourists can get under the misty showers of this waterfall falling from a height of around 50 feet with very little effort and a few minutes of trekking and traveling from the Magod Falls.

name: (16) Kudle Beach
info: Gokarna, which has many beaches and temples, is one of the most popular tourist destinations in the whole state, and Kudle Beach is one of the beaches in this beautiful destination. Among all the beaches present in Gokarna, Kudle Beach is the most popular and most visited beach by visitors, and it is positioned near Gokarn Om Beach at approximately one and a half kilometers. This beach is surrounded by rocks and hillocks from three sides, and it is one of the most famous beaches in the state because of its unmatched beauty. To enjoy more the pristine scenery of the hills surrounding the beach on three sides, many tourists opt to walk for a long unobstructed distance, and during their walk, they also get amazing views of the sea stretching to the horizon. This is why this beach is very popular among trekking lovers and nature enthusiasts, and for photographers, this beach is a picturesque landscape.

name: (17) Kodasalli Dam
info: Kodasalli Dam, which was built by the Karnataka Power Corporation Limited, is positioned at the Yellapura taluk of Uttara Kannada district, and it is built across the Kali River (Kalindi). Kodasalli Dam, which is a major electric power generating station for the district, is positioned 97 km from Yellapur and 72km from Karwar, and it is classified as a hydroelectric power station. Because of its unique built style and size of the power station, this dam is counted as one of the tourist destinations visitors love to visit during their trip to the Uttara Kannada.

name: (18) Karwar Beach
info: Karwar Beach, positioned on the shores of the Arabian sea in Uttara Kannada district, is present in the beautiful Karwar city and is also known as Rabindranath Tagore Beach popularly. The serenity and peace around the beach and on the beach are mind-calming, and it is a silent and clean beach, which makes it a very popular tourist attraction in the whole district. Tourists can visit a fish museum and the war museum, both of them are located near the beach, and they can always spot children playing around the beach. This beach is positioned approximately 60 kms from Gokarn and 70 Kms from Goa, and one can also enjoy plenty of adventure sports always available at the beach. Karwar city, where Karwar Beach is present, is a harbor city surrounded by the Arabian Sea from one side and the Western Ghats from the other city and this city is also covered with ever-green geography. The beauty of the city, this Karwar Beach, and the mighty Kali River that flows through the city make this city an alluring and popular tourist attraction for all visitors.

name: (19) Kadra Dam
info: Built across the Kali River, Kadra Dam is also present near Karwar city, and this is a power generation and irrigation dam in the city with 150 MW capacity. It is well connected with the Yellapur city of Uttara Kannada and is also counted as one of the famous tourist spots in Karwar. A beautiful park around this dam is one of the major attractions of this area, and this park has colorful trees and plants, caves, cascades, fountains, and many other attractions. Mahamayi Temple, which attracts pilgrims and devotees from nearby villages, is a popular and ancient temple positioned near the dam, and this dam is present only 20 Kms from the Anshi National Park and 42 KMs from the Karwar.

name: (20) Half Moon Beach
info: Half Moon Beach, which is present in the South Shetland Islands of Antarctica, is positioned 2 KM southeast of Scarborough Castle on the north coast of Livingston Island, and it is a small crescent-shaped beautiful and magnificent beach. It is a very attractive beach that allures visitors from all over India to this city, and because of its beauty and picturesque landscape view, it is counted as one of the best places to visit during the trip to Uttara Kannada. Robert Fildes, who had salers working in this place from 1820 to 1822, recorded this descriptive name of the beach, and this beach lies at the western extreme of the Porlier Bay. The San Telmo, which was the Wreckage of the Spanish Ship that sank off the island in 1819, was subsequently found on the beach in later years.

name: (21) Gokarna
info: Gokarna, which is known for its numerous surrounding beaches and historic Mahabaleshwar Temple, attracts many visitors from all over India throughout the year, and it is counted as one of the major tourist destinations of Uttara Kannada district. Many tourists and devotees from all over India are attracted to this famous Mahabaleshwar Temple because the history and legends associated with it make a visit to this temple even more special, and one more reason for alluring the tourists is that it is also mentioned in the Hindu epics of Mahabharata and Ramayana. There are many beaches, such as Kudle beach, Full Moon Beach, Half Moon Beach, Om Beach, and many other popular beaches, present in this city and these are counted among the famous beaches of the state. Most of the beaches in the city have got their name because of their shape, and all of these beaches are very less crowded and very clean. Tourists can get an amazing view of the sunset and sunrise by spending some time on these beaches during their trip, and they can also enjoy some trekking to reach these beaches.

name: (22) Dandeli Wildlife Sanctuary
info: Dandeli Wildlife Sanctuary, which is a part of the Anshi Dandeli Tiger Reserve and adjacent to Anshi National Park, is a popular tourist destination of Uttara Kannada, and it is positioned near the town of Dandeli in Uttara Kannada district. This wildlife sanctuary is known as a paradise for birdwatchers because currently, it houses nearly 200 species of birds, and the mugger crocodile and the King Cobra are the prime reptilians in this wildlife sanctuary. Other than this, visitors can also get to enjoy the sighting of the Indian peafowl, Indian Elephant, Indian Sloth Bear, the giant Malabar squirrel, the Indian pangolin, and the Black Panther, which are very common in this wildlife sanctuary, and Nature viewpoints and small hidden waterfalls of the Dandeli present near this wildlife sanctuary also appease visitors from all India to visit this wildlife sanctuary at least once in their life.

name: (23) Anshi National Park
info: Anshi National Park, which is positioned near Dandeli in Uttara Kannada district of Karnataka, is a tiger reserve and protected area, and it is also known as Kali Tiger Reserve popularly. The name of the national park is on the name of Kali River because it is the lifeline of the national park's ecosystem and flows through the tiger reserve, and this national park is a habitat of Indian elephants, Black Panthers, and Bengal Tigers, amongst other distinctive and rare fauna species. Anshi National Park, which is positioned only 54 KMs from Karwar and 52 KMs from Dandeli, is a best know tourist attraction for Bird watching, Trekking, and Jungle Safari, and this tiger reserve is spread over an area of 1300 square kilometers.

name: Ways to Reach Pathankot
info: By Air

name: 1. Kathlour Wildlife Sanctuary
info: This wildlife sanctuary is a safe haven for numerous wildlife species and is a scenic beauty. It is a habitat for grey partridge, white-humped vultures, barking deer, chital, hog deer, pangolin, porcupine, black partridge, spotted owlet, and python. Tourists can visit the Sanctuary and see the world of animals and birds. People are also allowed to glance at wild animals with minimal interference. The Sanctuary has been partitioned into three zones- eco-sensitive, buffer, and core. The core zone is the main wildlife refuge and is a protected zone. Tourists are prohibited from going beyond the eco-sensitive zone.

name: 2. Mukteshwar Temple
info: This temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva, situated on the river Ravi's bank. It is believed that the Pandavas stayed in the caves while in exile. Mukteshwar Temple is situated on the top of a hill and consists of copper yoni and Shiv lingam. Idols of several Hindu deities, Ganesha, Hanuman, Parvati, Vishnu, and Brahama, are placed around the lingam. It is being established that these caves are 5500 years old, and the Pandavas constructed the temple. Texts from Hindu Mythology suggest that these caves are as ancient as Mahabharata. The cave became home to the Pandavas as they took shelter and rested there. They took shelter for six months in this cave during their Agyatwas. Sometimes this place is also called a Mini-Haridwar. People cannot immerse ash of their kin at the Haridwar, so here they do by immersing ashes in the river Rabi.

name: 3. Nurpur Fort
info: It was known as Dhameri Fort and was constructed in the tenth century. British destroyed the fort, and it also got destroyed by an earthquake. The fort had a temple inside it, and it was called Brij Raj Swami. It was constructed in the 16th century. Idols of Lord Krishna and Meera Bai were worshipped in the fort.

name: 4. Dhar Nature Retreat and Awareness Camp
info: The Ranjit Sagar Lake and the Dhar Forest spread over the Pathankot Forest Division's Dhar and Dunera Forest Ranges. The Forest is in the form of blocks, which differ in size. Forest has pristine beauty and has been shielded from human depredation. The lake provides an excellent picturesque for the Visitor. Pathankot forest division 2020 felt the need for protection, conservation, and raising awareness regarding the highly biodiverse area and establishing a nature awareness close to Chamrod Village, administered by Village Forest Committee (VFC), Chamrod, Dhar. The nature camp is established on the principle of empowerment to govern the resource on which they are dependent and local community ownership rights.

name: 5. Atal Setu
info: The cable-styled bridge is situated on the Ravi River, and it was commissioned by former Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar on 24 December 2015. Cable Styled bridge is 592 meters long. It was constructed to provide smooth connectivity between Himachal Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir, and Himachal Pradesh. The bridge is located on the Dunera to Basohli road. It is the first kind of bridge in north India and the fourth in the nation. The other three bridges are Kolkata (Hooghly), Allahabad (Naini), and Mumbai (Bandra- Worli). The bridge provides a picturesque of the mountain, which is nearby to the river. IIT Delhi has cleared the design of the bridge. Sonia Gandhi, the chairperson of the United Progressive Alliance, laid the foundation stone in May 2011. Mc Elhanney Consulting Services Ltd, a Canadian Company, prepared the design. Earlier, this firm, known as Infinity Engineering Ltd. Border Road Organisation, Infinity and SP Singla Constructions Pvt. Ltd., and IRCON, was entrusted with the bridge's construction. The name is inspired by the Former Prime Minister of India, Atal Bihari Vajpayee, and the bridge is dedicated to the nation.

name: 6. Ranjit Sagar Dam
info: The construction of the dam was completed in 2001, and the dam was built as part of the hydroelectricity project of the Punjab Government. The dam also has another name, and it is called Thien Dam, and it was built on the river Ravi. The dam serves as a great picnic spot and is surrounded by lush greenery. The dam is situated in a very idyllic and serene location. The dam is situated at a driveable distance, and the drive would be enjoyable and scenic.

name: 7. Hydraulic Research Station, Pathankot
info: This Hydraulic Research Station is present in Malikpur. It is 7 km from Pathankot. Hydraulic Research Station serves as a major attraction point in the Pathankot. The research station exhibits several models of irrigation projects and dams. The research station will produce an undercurrent among engineer enthusiasts keen on civil engineering and hydraulics. Comprehensive and detailed information is presented to the tourists regarding the models. Visitors will be thrilled to see the engineering techniques incorporated into the establishment of irrigation and dam projects.
